Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, But Rooms Too Hot”
Reviews.Author: PAMan804
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here as part of a national meeting. It is a nice place, and Fells Point is a great place for a meeting. Hotel is nicely appointed, and the staff was great on check-in. Two nights in a row the temperature in my room raised itself to sweltering about 2 AM. Really tough to sleep when the room becomes a sauna. I called the front desk to report the problem, but it repeated the next night. We had about 60 people at the hotel and all reported the same issue. Our meeting room on the 5th floor had a great view of the river, but the room temperature was 76.5 according to the room thermostat. What a tremendous disappointment, because the hotel and neighborhood have a lot to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: GermekGang
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights in Fells Point at the Admiral Fell Inn. This was our second time staying here and we would return again. We had some concerns with our room on the first night and after speaking with Hakeem Kazeem at the front desk he was able to change our room and we had no issues the rest of our stay. Take the Ghost tour in the hotel. It is both informative and fun. All of the staff members that we dealt with from Mike the valet to everyone at the front desk were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “luv it!!”
Reviews.Author: RV3_12
Reviews.Content: The nautical charm of this hotel and the the primo location makes this a great place to stay! You MUST do the ghost tour of the hotel as well (it's free!) and the stories are very interesting and our guide was most knowledgeable. Meli's next door was great for breakfast and the shuttle bus was a nice short trip to the aquarium and shopping. Definitely can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: Karen O
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Admiral Fell Inn during spring break. The staff was friendly and very helpful. They were eager to help us find places of interest. The Admiral's reception was very enjoyable. We expecially liked learning of the history of the area. The location was great. Close to excellent restaurants and next to the water taxi which was a quirky, convenient and fun way to get around. Room was small but clean-really just what we expected of a historic property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Andrew W
Reviews.Content: Great Location, but noisy. Historic charm. Front desk very courteous and professional. Manager reception just ok. Continental breakfast lacking. Rooms clean but antiquated...floors creak....some furniture nees to be updated. AC did not work.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Bailey2004
Reviews.Content: We booked the Inn for a March weekend getaway. We had stayed here several years ago on another Baltimore trip and really like the location. The front desk staff is very friendly and helpful. Hakeem was always professional and pleasant. The managers reception was great for some local brews and cheeses. We love the location of the Inn. It is right in the heart of Fells Point and not too far from everything else. If you want to stay in the 'tourist' area, then by all means stay by the Aquarium and all the chain restaurants. If you want good food, good local bars and music stay here. There is a yoga studio right outside the Inn's door, a really good French bakery and too many other places to mention. The hotel is historic. All the rooms are different. We stayed in the Poe room which was on the top floor facing the street. We did not hear any revelers at night. Bedroom was adequate and bathroom was clean and spacious. My only complaint was that the a/c unit was loud in our room and the bathroom fan was even louder. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: myeguy
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay @ the Admiral Fell Inn. The front desk staff (especially Hakeem) went out of their way to provide everything we needed for a great experience. The Harbor Night package was an excellent value & saved us alot of money during the course of our visit. We also loved that the hotel is pet-friendly (regardless of pet size) & our "dogter" received lots of attention as we passed thru the lobby. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: M C
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were just in Baltimore for a conference and really enjoyed the Admiral Fell Inn. The location could not have been nicer, and even though we were first placed in a street-side room which proved to be noisy (they really should use double-pane glass), the staff was so kind and changed rooms for us, moving our suitcases to a new room while we were out for the day. The happy hour with the entertaining Admiral giving us a historical background while we munched wine and cheese was very nice, and Hakeem at the front desk couldn't be more helpful and enthusiastic.

Reviews.Title: “"First choice in Fells Point"”
Reviews.Author: JerseyExit98
Reviews.Content: Admiral Fell is always our first choice when staying in Baltimore. Its location is perfect. Once you valet your car everything else is within close walking distance. We have stayed here many times through the years and it is always consistently wonderful. The customer service at Admiral Fell makes it stand out among all the other hotels. Hakeem at the front desk always gives a warm welcome and goes out of his way to make sure your stay will be perfect. Dorian made our reservation and immediately makes you feel that your have chosen the right place for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Always amazing”
Reviews.Author: Echolynn
Reviews.Content: Like last year's stay, I was impressed by the overall quality of the hotel in every aspect. The front desk staff was friendly and accommodating, the room was spacious and comfortable, and the conference area was perfect for our group. I love how conveniently located the Inn is as well. Everything I needed was within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Robin C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to Baltimore several times a year. Since we found the Admiral Fell, we always know where we'll be staying and what to expect, from being greeted by name by Hakeem at the front desk,to the valets that take care of our car and luggage, and the wonderfully quirky and charming rooms. The location in Fells Foint is super, allowing us to walk to restaurants and shops . It's a fantastic place to go and feel totally relaxed.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, historic ambience”
Reviews.Author: HauntedTraveler100
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on St. Patrick's Day. Our room was cozy and clean. We were very comfortable. Great location in the heart of Fells Point. There was a terrific entertainer who was dressed as an admiral who gave ghost tours and played the violin. The hotel was very accomodating to us and made us feel very welcome. They have valet parking which is great for this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Laura H
Reviews.Content: It was a perfect couples retreat! The weather was great! The stay at the Admiral Fell Inn was excellent. The staff was most helpful. They met are every request. The valet parking was great - the attendants most friendly, even on such a busy weekend (St. Patrick's Day). My husband and I are still talking about how great it was. Would stay their again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Harrisburg, PA Couple -Nice Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: Bill M
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to the time of our departure, we experienced exceptional and friendly service. It began at curbside with the young guys from the valet service who helped with our luggage and then helped with the parking which was at a conveniently located garage. The front desk manager Hakeem Kazeem was very nice, humorous and attentive to our needs, as were the hotel staff who were also friendly and accommodating. The convenient and free shuttle service to and from the hotel to the Inner Harbor area was a big plus! Although the rooms were on the smaller size, they were charming, clean and comfortable. The hotel is in a great location near the waterfront and a short distance to Inner Harbor, restaurants and historic sites. It was a great deal for the price and we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Locals' choice for a staycation”
Reviews.Author: vjcjenn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in Baltimore but decided to spend 2 evenings downtown, with our dog, and be tourists in our home town. I'll try and review every place we managed to hit: We've always wanted to stay at the Admiral Fell Inn and took advantage of a groupon special to do so. I felt it was a very good value! Positive: History is alive and well here! We enjoyed the admiral's reception where this history was shared with us. All the staff members were very friendly. We had our dog with us and they greeted him each time he passed. Coffee/Tea/Muffins each morning was a nice touch we found only the second day but that muffin was out-of-this-world insanely good. The room was nice, I liked the old furniture and the overall decor. While I found some things to be a bit scruffed, it but me at ease a bit with our pooch (who had no incidents). Negative: Our room was right on the corner, streetside, right above the lobby and right off the elevator. My husband and I are one's to stay up late and not light sleepers, so I thought of anyone, we're probably the most ideal candidates for this type of room. We had a REALLY tough time sleeping, especially night one. It wasn't so much "people" and "nightlife" that kept us awake...it was cars and trucks and deliveries. Every car that drove by sounded exceptionally loud, like something was amplifying it. And starting EARLY in the morning, the sound of people making deliveries, opening/closing truck doors, the loading/unloading off stuff, pretty much unbearable (this was a Monday morning). The only thing I could suggest is perhaps some sort of white noise machine that people could request or maybe just have in rooms that are known to be noisier (ours was Jerome Bonaparte). The beds weren't so comfy either. Surprisingly, our dog didn't react to the outside noises, but he did react (bark) when he heard someone out in the hallway, and being right off the elevator that was frequent and hard to deal with. I don't know how full the hotel was but I think sticking us perhaps further tucked away with our pooch probably would have been the better choice. We gave our number to the front desk representative when we left the dog in the room alone. We got called 2 of the 3 times, the one time we were actually right in the hotel for the admirals reception and we never heard him at all and frequently kept checking (even trying to purposely make noise to just to test it out). The second time, they had me sign a pet policy and gave me a hang tag for my door which looks as if it should have been given to me at check in. I was given this after midnight of the day we were supposed to check out (so took the dog for a walk in the middle of the night and as I passed back through, they had me stop to fill it out). That felt a bit threatening to me like they had to get me to sign something so that they could charge me a check out for the earlier incidents. There was no additional charge at check out but it left a bad taste in my mouth like I was being punished for I think was a minor incident (they got a noise complaint, called me, and I came right back as I was just around the corner) While that seems like quite a bit more negative then positive, I loved my time at the Admiral Fell Inn and have already recommended to friends who are considering doing a similar stay-cation. We didn't take advantage of all the extra guests benefits like shuttle and gym, but I think they're definitely impressive!

Reviews.Title: “In spite of it all”
Reviews.Author: pachipper
Reviews.Content: Even though my girlfriend broke her arm while we were jogging during our stay, the Admiral Fell Inn was great. I have stayed there many times and I am always made to feel at home. t The staff is warm and friendly, especially Hakeem. Even though months often elapse between my visits, Hakeem always greats me with a friendly greeting and warm smile. The location is great and the historic inn is great for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “The Right location for exploring Fells Point”
Reviews.Author: two_from_Greenville
Reviews.Content: Out of a possible ten, we give this hotel a five. Location is superb, right on the waterfront. Exterior architecture is period perfect - and this is a fun and historic part of Baltimore. Signage is a bit weak, but we found the right place to pull up in front of the hotel to visit the front desk. The lobby desk was easy to access, and desk personnel were attentive. Lobby sitting areas looked a bit jumbled in terms of decor. The upstairs has an interesting layout, with short ups and downs due to the combination of buildings that make up the hotel (not suitable for a disabled traveler). Our room with high ceiling was large enough to move around in, with hanging space for clothes and a little lobby of its own. Bed hangings were tastefully done but aging. The lightweight reproduction furniture was tired and worn, scuffed and chipped; the carpet was significantly stained. Bath was simple but adequate, mostly clean and the hairdryer worked. We arrived late and wanted a quick simple dinner, so asked for a bistro recommendation and were directed to a next door restaurant. It turned out to be a 'white tablecloth', full service restaurant associated with the hotel, which no one had mentioned. Our meals were fine but took forever, so the recommendation was not on point for us. On leaving we thought the Hotel might be a great base location for those who want to barhop and party, or those who like it quirky. We found it neglected and kind of sad.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: Gina M
Reviews.Content: I love old architecture and antiques; the Admiral Fell Inn had both. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We received a great deal on the price of the hotel plus several coupons at participating bars and restaurants. My husband had only one complaint: He's a light sleeper and people like to party around the Inn. I suggest to anyone who sleeps lightly to get a room that is not located directly over the street.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel - great location!”
Reviews.Author: pkinva
Reviews.Content: This is not a posh, upscale experience -- but a wonderful, quirky, historic structure (actually 7 structures merged together) right in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Fell's Point. Restaurants abound, the waterfront is right there. Couldn't be more convenient. The rooms are not spacious, but are very comfortable. The staff is helpful and friendly - and the Inn is small enough that they recognize their guests. Don't miss the happy hour with the Admiral's ghost tour - the guide is a font of information about the area's history. Not sure I will get back to Baltimore soon, but when I do, I am heading straight back to the Admiral Fell. It's a great value, and a nice change from the usual mega-chain-hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Fell's Point”
Reviews.Author: Eviker
Reviews.Content: The Admiral Fell Inn never disappoints. We love visiting Fell's Point and the Inn is perfectly located for daytime shopping and night-time bar-hopping. The staff is always eager to make our visit special, and the hotel's pet-friendly policy makes this the go-to Baltimore destination for us. Sparky loves the touring the waterfront and meeting new people and other dogs. The shuttle to their sister property makes the Inner Harbor neighborhood accessible for a change of pace. If you want a modern hotel, choose a different place, but if you enjoy historical charm and interesting buildings with lots of personality, the Admiral Fell Inn is just right.

Reviews.Title: “This place is cool”
Reviews.Author: KevinBaltimore
Reviews.Content: It's not the most modern of places and I've had better furnished rooms in less expensive places. But this is a historic hotel and the atmosphere is really cool and that's just inside the place. Walk out the door and within three blocks are dozens of places to eat, drink or just explore. Inside you are going back in time about two hundred years, there are no straight level walkways. Since it's built with seven connecting buildings are are quirky steps and turns everywhere. Oh yeah, every room had a name and story of a historic Baltimorean figure. Cooler to my wife and I cause we are from Baltimore and we have seen these names on parks and roads. There are two restaurants inside, we ate at the Tapas (unusual for us, cause we are more meat and potatoes people) and it was really good and surprisingly filling. May I suggest the Gazpacho. We didn't eat at the Meli. The staff was just great and the Admiral's evening(?) was just neat with a fun way to get a snack, drink and meet some other guests. Note: the room they gave us was on the quiet side street, next time we will ask for a room on the bar side so we can watch the night life. Note: On Monday mornings (0600-0630) a TV station does a 'Manic Monday' show from the square in front of the hotel. It's fun to watch.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Dawn W
Reviews.Content: We wish we could have stayed longer. The service was excellent and the staff was well informed and very courteous! The room was excellent, just the right size. It was a home away from home for the night. We thoroughly enjoyed our experience and would recommend it to everyone. We definitely plan to return and hopefully, make it a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service, but not what I'd call a "renovated" room”
Reviews.Author: Panda3403
Reviews.Content: I almost decided not to write this review. I didn't want to say anything negative about a hotel that has been lucky enough to hire such nice people. Yes, the service at this hotel is EXCELLENT. And while I'm being positive, let me add that the Fells Point neighborhood where this historic building is located is well worth exploring. Good restaurants. Fun shops. I wish I could be more positive about our room. I will say it was clean. It was quiet (I asked for a room in the back). And the bed I slept in (there were two double beds) was comfortable. Some people might say that the tiny bathroom was renovated. It had a new pedestal sink (no place to put anything), new white tile on the floor, but the bathtub was so old that the ceramic finish was worn down to the metal in places, and the stopper didn't work. The carpeting in the bedroom was also old. And brown. The furnishings were forgettable except for the canopy beds. The lighting was dim, and the heat was uncontrollable. We woke up in the middle of the night sweating. A lot of this stuff comes with old houses. I've been told that the hotel is under new management. Maybe they are just starting to renovate the rooms. Our room may not have been representative. I doubt I'll go back, but if I do, I'll get that very nice desk clerk who answers the phones to describe the room I'll be staying in, in detail.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Efficient and in the Center of Fells Point!”
Reviews.Author: Joe B
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2-day special package through Groupon, which turned out to be great! The hotel staff were super-efficient, from the Valet Parking to the Front Desk Clerk who explained everything and provided us with lots of friendly advice on where to go, what to see, etc. The Tapas restaurant attached to the Hotel was great for lunch, but there are literally dozens of great bars and restaurants nearby, along with some boutique shopping. The room, while small, was comfortable and a neat touch is that every room has a name and a story behind it (some say it's even a haunted hotel!) We stayed in the "Fell" room , named after the good Admiral himself. This was a pleasure trip but we will stay there on business in the fall, based on our first visit. In fact, our room is already booked.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Fells Point Inn- Right where the action is!”
Reviews.Author: kayakdiva
Reviews.Content: The Admiral Fell is a wonderful place to base yourself. The rooms are cozy-the service was excellent and it's really nice to just walk out the front door and have all of Fells Point at your feet! All the restaurants, bars and shops that make Fells Point such a fun destination are right there. I will say that my only complaint is that the Inn does not have parking that is reasonably priced. They offer Valet parking for around $40/night. Your other option for parking is a local garage for $15/night but they don't open until 9:00 a.m. the next morning, which makes leaving earlier than 9:00 impossible.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Brian J
Reviews.Content: I have always been wary of group deals when it comes to travel. However, if they are all like my stay at the Admiral Fell Inn, I need to take advantage of them more often! Check in was quick and easy, and they were incredibly accommodating with our need to get into our room early because our flight arrived in the afternoon. I first realized I was in for a unique experience when I received an email from one of their representatives one week before my check-in date. He outlined all of the services available, including tickets to local attractions. We decided to take advantage of the Aquarium VIP tickets and it was well worth it. Also, the representative answered my questions promptly and completely. The room was amazing, very spacious and well furnished and we were fortunate enough to have a balcony! Admittedly it was a shared balcony, and we stayed in February, but it was still a nice touch. The location cannot be beat, we were steps away from some of the best dining, live music, and small shops - there was even a taxi stand right across the street. The only disadvantage of being in the center of Fells Point is the street noise, but that's to be expected in a city and the windows are thick enough to drown out all but the noisiest revelers. My only hesitation with this hotel was the 'destination fee'. However, all you need to do is take advantage of the free shuttle once a day and it pays for itself. The driver was amazing, even turning around once to come back and get us when we had just missed him. We actually never had the occasion to take a taxi, since the shuttle got us within walking distance of the places were were interested to visit. You can't find a better place to stay in Baltimore for location, charm, and luxury - highly recommended. ~Brian J

Reviews.Title: “Baltimore Stay and Cruise-What a pleasant surprise...”
Reviews.Author: captain_keo
Reviews.Content: We were booked on a cruise out of Baltimore. It being February, we couldn't count on the weather cooperating, so I went looking for a place to sleep the night before the cruise. I also wanted a place to leave our car for the duration of the trip. I wanted something near the Inner Harbor or in Fell's Point. I came across the Admiral Fell Inn. It fell within the one parameter that I had set. It looked okay on the website. I contacted the other two couples and we all booked rooms. Well, I have to tell you...the expectations that I held weren't very high. Oh My God, I struck gold with this place. First contact was made with the reservation desk...great experience...friendly and helpful. After I made the reservation, I was asked if I wanted the "Harbor Magic Specialist" to call me prior to arrival to help with any excursions or dinner reservations. I set up an appointment, received a reminder email and was called right on time as requested. The "Specialist" , Bryce, was able to get me dinner reservations for six people, on the Saturday of Valentine's Day weekend, at a restaurant within walking distance of the hotel. It was fantastic. The hotel itself is beautiful. It is a historic property and Edgar Allen Poe was said to have been a regular in and around the hotel. It is within walking distance of every great Fell's Point bar and/or restaurant. The desk and valet staff was unbelievably friendly and helpful. There was live music in the lobby. Oh and I forgot to mention that the room was less than $140 (plus taxes and fees-about $30). It included the room, the Admiral's Reception (beer, wine and cheeses), a ghost tour if you'd like, a $25 restaurant voucher that can be used at 1/2 dozen local restaurants for dinner or breakfast, a $25 Gift Card towards a future stay, transportation to and from the cruise ship and valet parking (for up to eight days). Oh yeah and keep in mind that it would cost $105 to park your car at the harbor for the week. This place was a great find and I only wish I had known about it when my daughter was living in Baltimore. We would have visited her more often. We're definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: Cbot72
Reviews.Content: Historic building with twisting hallways and charming rooms. The Inn was in a great location within walking distance to many great restaurants, bars and unique shops. Staff was friendly and helpful and the room clean and well stocked. We also had breakfast at one of the two on site restaurants and found it to be affordable and delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Really darling get away”
Reviews.Author: Maui2soon
Reviews.Content: This is a really historic looking place, although they say it was renovated in 1985 as an Inn. It is darling, with fascinating little touches. For instance, each room has a little plaque outside the door with historical reference to someone or family--just interesting! Now, if you want cookie cutter Hampton Inn or something, please don't go here and then write a bad review. there is no DVD, no fridge in the room. But there are fabulous antiques, pure beautiful silk upholstery in the lobby, and the Inn is actually seven buildings joined together if you can imagine that. Food is great, staff is generous and in a good mood, towels are comfy, Figi water, hot jazz in a styling basement bar place---brunch was great. And, the desk staff is always falling over itself to give you a bonus here, dollars off there, cheap reservation next time---just for fun! and within walking distance are the greatest stores--jewelry, shoes, cool clothes, and a million restaurants, and 47 bars they told us. Super ghost tour of the hotel on Saturday night, and wine and cheese reception. I'm going back ASAP Oh, one downside, there is no handle or sticky surface on the tub, showers are dangerous for old folks.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull Facitlty to Seek Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Marie M
Reviews.Content: We had this Inn recommended to us while at John Hopkins, and so glad we stayed. The staff was warm, receptive, and helpful. The staff is very knowledgeable of the Inn's history which is rich. Our room was perfect. The overall decor matched the era of the Inn, with convinces of modern day. The only down side was we came when Baltimore was having unseasonably warm weather. We, even though the heat was all the way down, the room was warmer than we would have liked it. Please note the pluses far outweigh this one issue. We do recommend everyone to walk around the corner of the next street to The Fell Family Cemetery to pay respects, we did, and it kept away any ghost during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: cdb1582
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for a fun weekend getaway in Baltimore. You aren't real close to the Harbor so if that's what you are looking for then look elsewhere. This is right across from the water in Fells Point. The area offers a ton of great restaurants and bars with live music and entertainment. We like to stay here every once in a while even though we live in the area just as a break from life in the suburbs. They treat you very well here - the staff is attentive and extremely friendly. We have been here twice now and wouldn't hesitate to come back. It's an old hotel so be aware that the walls are pretty thin and you will hear some street noise and possibly your neighbors. I wouldn't let that keep you away though!

Reviews.Title: “Would go back anytime!”
Reviews.Author: SpiritWatch
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went there for an anniversary weekend. The lobby and entire building were in great condition. The building had the efficiency of a hotel and the feel of a bed and breakfast (which we loved). The staff was friendly and courteous. We look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff Makes Staying Here Quite Pleasing”
Reviews.Author: julie f
Reviews.Content: Got here by purchasing a Groupon. I was looking for a short mid winter get-away. I was looking for a relaxing weekend with historic value, variety of food choices and a decent, clean place to rest my head. I flew into BWI and grabbed a taxi as parking a car in this area will cost you more than a car rental. Then cab to the hotel was approx $50.00. Cobblestone sidewalks, the view of the harbor, small boutiques, restaurants, cafe's and bars on every corner added to my relaxing weekend. Most everything was a short walk, within a mile or two. Touring the Inner Harbor's ships and seaport was the highlight of the weekend. If you are a AAA member bring your card for huge discount off admission. There was never a lack of things to do or see even in mid January! The hotel was welcoming especially the front desk. You will feel like they were waiting for you. If you keep in mind the hotels historic value it will add to ambiance. My only gripe was it got noisey at night from patrons who may have indulged a little too much from the bar(s). The rooms were satisfactory. I never expected the Ritz Carlton. The restaurants in the hotel were fine but not memorable. We did eat down the street at the Blue Moon (as seen on TV, Diner's Drive-in's and Dives) be prepared to wait 45 minutes or more. Not sure that many local's bother to dine there but I will say it was hip, the food was good and at least I can say I was there. Overall Admiral Fell's Inn left a good impression on me because of the front desk staff, the history of the structure itself as well as the location.

Reviews.Title: “hated this place, mostly because of staff”
Reviews.Author: Entropia8
Reviews.Content: I would not stay here again, like, ever. The staff was rude to us and they made me feel very bad about myself and feel very un-welcome. I regret having stayed here and I regret giving them my money. The only good thing I can say about the place (to be fair) is it's location. If you are looking to be in fells point, it is pretty centrally located (but not worth it in my opinion). I still love fells point, but next time I'd choose to stay at Henderson's Warf like I did previously (that hotel is awesome). my review is short because my stay here was seriously not fun and I don't even want to recall it. My stay was not bad because of surrounding circumstances, either - I love the area and I loved the person I was with - it was the staff and the hotel. (Sorry I'm not up to being more detailed, I know it would make for a more useful review)

Reviews.AuthorLocation: West Palm Beach, Florida, United States
Reviews.Title: “Admiral Fell #1”
Reviews.Author: Peter C
Reviews.Content: I would like to Thank the staff, this was our 1st trip to Baltimore and they did everything possible to make are stay perfect...which it was. The accommodations were no less than perfect as well. We will be back next year. Peter & Christy Church

Reviews.Title: “Always a lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: dcpatti
Reviews.Content: We have stayed several times at the Admiral Fell Inn, and always enjoy it. The hotel has a lot of charm and character, and is quite old, which means you get a lot of funky little hallways, unusual floor plans, and other architectural "quirks." I doubt if any two of their rooms are identical, which makes it fun for us repeat guests to always get a "new" room. The rooms themselves are kept spotless. The room furnishings are comfortable and while not overly opulent, are still simple and elegant. As with any older hotel, you do get a bit of hallway noise; the hallways are well-carpeted to cut down, but you can occasionally hear your neighbors talking in the halls or slamming doors. The noise doesn't seem to travel between rooms, just from the hallways into the room, and it's not extreme, but I di want to mention it as some folks are sensitive to that kind of thing. The staff is consistently friendly and helpful; however, it is a small staff, so allow adequate time for check-in/check-out, especially if you need the valet services or if you're checking out right at noon along with everyone else. The valet parking is a bit pricey by Baltimore standards so if budget is an issue, there are several public garages about 3 blocks away which may be more affordable. The neighborhood is quite historic, with lots to do, but is also the big "nightlife" district of Baltimore; if you are staying over a weekend, especially during nice weather, there will be a lot of partiers on the street. But the advantage is, there's so many pubs and bars that hope to attract these partiers, that you have tons of choices for your evening too. We will be happy to return. We love the Admiral Fell :)

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Cambria5
Reviews.Content: We have stayed many times at the Admiral Fell Inn, chiefly because if its very convenient location. We enjoy Fells Point and Harbor East in Baltimore and this locatin allows you to walk to them, with the Fells Point bars within a very, very short walk from your front door. It is also an easy cab ride to Canton. Cabs are readily available for the ride to the stadiums and Inner harbor, as well. The inn is an old building and most of the rooms are in need of updating. The addition of a restaurant is welcome. Not much of a bar, though. That said, we stay there for the location. The staff is very nice and the hotel is comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in the heart of Fells Point”
Reviews.Author: Todd A
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the weekend at the hotel and it was very enjoyable. From the time we arrived, the front desk staff was extremely personable and helpful. Their recommendation of Adela Tapas (restaurant attached to the hotel) was excellent with an ample wine and drink list along with tasty Spanish style small plates. The room itself was nice with a balcony overlooking the main attractions of Fells Point as well as the harbor. The only complaint was that the room was very warm likely due to it being a 50 Farenheit day in the middle of January. This was actually nice though as it allowed us to enjoy some fresh air on the balcony. Would definitely recommend this hotel if you're visiting Fells Point.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MaryDean206
Reviews.Content: I traveled frequently before retirement and usually stayed in 4 star hotels. The Admiral Fells Inn was one of the best hotel experiences I have had! The rooms are beautiful and spacious, the room service from Meli's is excellent. But the best memory is of the staff- Hakeem, Rachel, the valet parking and the shuttle drivers. Everyone goes above and beyond what you would expect. I highly recommend the Admiral Fells Inn. Great experience!

Reviews.Title: “No ghosts sighted, but wonderful history and great location”
Reviews.Author: JonathanSecor
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a great time at the Admiral Fell Inn. I have loved Fells Point for many, many years-great bars, shops, waterfront and old world feel. Usually I stay with friends in Baltimore, but we decided to be tourists and stay right in Fells Point. Colleges were out as it was last week of December, so it was quieter which was nice. Room was wonderful, place full of history, and they had a nice wine and cheese thing where a woman told the history of the Inn and the area. I thought it was going to be hoaky, but quickly got involved in the history. The free local beer may have helped as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Bill G
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a wonderful week at the Admiral. The room was especially large and nice, the hotel a true find and in a great location, but most of all it was the front desk staff that knocked us out. Hakeem, Rachel, Dorian and Terence could not have been friendlier, more professional or more helpful. We extended our stay due largely to their good will and the good vibes they all exuded. Our only complaint is the Destination Fee. Aside from being a truly awful, obscuring name, we find it odd and unfair that we’re asked to pay for services that we never used. Wouldn’t it be wiser and more candid to offer these services at a fee to those who want them and allow those of us who don’t to opt out? Nancy & Bill from Miami

Reviews.Title: “Location + Ambience Fabulous, wish it were privately owned.”
Reviews.Author: laurie-ellen1973
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have a tradition of staying at Admiral Fell over New Years. The quaint character of the place and location beside Broadway Pier are irresistable. The food and service in both associated restaurants is outstanding. Foodies won't be disappointed. My only complaint is the run-around you routinely incur dealing with Harbor Magic, the management company. We were quoted one rate, then emailed a confirmation with $100 price increase. I guess they hoped I would overlook it. WRONG. Since the same thing happened last year. When this 'error' was pointed out, it took many phone calls and many weeks before we received an accurate rate confirmation. This kind of thing puts a bad taste in my mouth, because it reeks of dishonesty or incompetence or both. Neither are appealing when you seek a trip for romance and R&R. If HM could lose the stingy cheating tactics, the whole experience would be vastly improved. Just give customers the STRAIGHT SCOOP the FIRST TIME. Other than that, we loved our room (Key), view, *extremely* comfortable bed, amenities, and all the touches that make this place very special and unique.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous New Year at the Admiral Fell Inn!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah F
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent the New Years weekend at the Admiral Fell Inn, and had a wonderful time! The staff greeted us with warmth and friendliness, and by the time we left we felt like we were great friends! Dorien, in particular, was a wonderful host. He not only answered all of our questions, but he befriended us in a way that made us feel special. Sandy, on the night desk, was also an excellent ally during our stay! We were so impressed we already booked our stay for next year! We thank the entire staff for making this the best New Years celebration ever!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Devona P
Reviews.Content: I recieved exceptional service from Dorien at the front desk. He made sure our needs were and offered us wine after checking in. I would love to visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Susan G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in town visiting relatives and needed a place to stay. A local recommended Admiral Fells so we booked a room. We were greeted by Dorian, the Front Desk Manager who told us where to have dinner. We looked to par-tay a bit and he suggested The Horse You Rode In On Bar. What a place! We had so much fun. Perfect room, perfect staff, perfect getaway. We cant wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Local that needed a place stay”
Reviews.Author: SarahBethius
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ended up staying here after a fun night of celebrating a friend's 40th birthday downtown (and didn't want to drive all the way home). The staff was so friendly and the room comfortable and cozy. In the morning there was a woman in costume (historic Baltimore) playing a zither type instrument in the lobby and breakfast at the local restaurant was divine. Located right in the center of Fells Point with all the shopping you can't go wrong especially if you're from out of town.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: Soprano1NewJersey
Reviews.Content: Place was decent. Very clean. Staff was good. Location was away from downtown. We spent 2 days there over a long weekend. It is more than suitable for a family stay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: NK1010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Admiral Fell Inn at the beginning of December and were very happy with our stay. Our only complaint was when we booked there was a mistake with our booking, but when it was found it was corrected immediately with no problems. The room was clean, the employees were friendly and helpful, and they had a meet and greet type reception for the guests and it was very nice. We did a cruise and stay package and the shuttle service was great! When we got back our car was waiting and in the same condition as we left it. We would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New Brunswick, New Jersey, United States
Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Kevin S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Admiral Fell Inn with my girlfriend for a weekend and we were absolutely happy with our choice to stay there. The staff was extremely helpful and knowledgable, not to mention super friendly. The Inn is quite charming in its historic entirety and also very clean. I typically do not feel comfortable staying in hotels, but this was like a home away from home (not to be typical and cheesy). I am looking forward to my next visit to Fell's Point.

Reviews.Title: “One of my new favorite hotels”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Admiral's Fell Inn for a week and the service was amazing. Dorian, one of the employees at the front desk provided extraordinary customer service and great dinner recommendations. This hotel believes in customer service and ensuring you truly enjoy the fell's point area. I cannot wait to travel back to Baltimore and stay at Admiral Fell's Inn and hear the wonderful ghost stories.

Reviews.Title: “Much improved second visit to Admiral Fell Inn”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi2003
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Admiral Fell's. We booked a last minute weekend to go down and see the Parade of Lights. We were pleasantly surprised this time. It's not that our first visit was bad, it's just that there seemed to be an overall improvement in the hotel since our last visit about 3 years ago. We got a great rate considering we booked at the last minute. We booked online directly through Harbor Magic-downside is that it is nonrefundable if you have to cancel. But we were pleasantly surprised to find out that our rate also included a $25 voucher which could be used at several local restaurants and spas AND a $25 Harbor Magic gift card which could be used for a future stay. The hotel has been renovated but still has the charm of a historic inn. Our room was very nice, decent size...although because it is an older building that has been renovated and added on to over the years, the room sizes tend to vary. The last time we stayed, we had a much smaller room, but it was very charming with a canopy bed and antique furnishings, and very quiet. This most recent stay, our room and bathroom were larger, but our room did look over the street and you could hear some ruckus when the bars let out. It didn't bother us too much, but if you are sensitive to noise at night, you may want to ask for a room that does not overlook the street. We used our voucher for breakfast at Adela, one of the restaurants attached to the hotel, and it was delicious. We had a minor mistake on our bill at checkout, but it was corrected immediately without any issues once we brought it to the attention of the desk clerk. We are looking forward to going back and using our gift card for our next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Lodging in the Midst of Fells Point”
Reviews.Author: 1Crabhappychick
Reviews.Content: How I love this hotel! Or, I should say WE. My daughter and I took a long weekend trip to Baltimore. Our destination? Fells Point. Why? Because we love the shops and restaurants and bars there and have such a fun time every time we go. And, for the last couple years of this annual trip, every time we passed by the Admiral Fell Inn, we'd say, "Next time we're staying there." And now that we finally did, we wouldn't stay anywhere else! Why? From the few steps up into the lobby, the staff is extraordinarily friendly and accommodating - actually, even before we got there we were contacted by the hotel staff to see what more they could do to make our stay more comfortable, more interesting and more convenient. I like that! The room was gorgeous! Two beautiful mahogany, four poster canopy beds dripping with cotton lace awaited as we entered the room. Everything about the room suited the quirky, historic twists, turns, narrow hallways of the history contained within the hotel. Every room even has a name! Ours was Forbes. We did have a little noise outside of the windows around 3:00 a.m. on Friday night, but rolled right over and went back to sleep. After all, if you want to stay in the midst of where it's happening in Baltimore, what else do you expect? I'd rather have that than have to take a cab back to someplace quiet and boring. And Saturday night was quiet as could be...or else I just slept through it. We can't wait to go back and repeat our experience all over again!

Reviews.Title: “A Terrific Experience”
Reviews.Author: Wally011
Reviews.Content: My wife and I always try to stay in interesting historic inns when we visit cities. The Admiral Fell Inn was not only interesting and historic, it was well run and very comfortable. The staff was excellent. We had contact with the front desk, the maid service, and the valet parking people, and they were all very accomodating and helpful. The costumed lady who led the "ghost" walk through the hotel the evening we got there was fun and informative. This inn equals or surpasses other historic inns we have stayed in across the country.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and Pet Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Natdl11
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't say this place is amazing. It is very cute. It made me feel like I was going back in time. Then there was the loud noises outside to bring me back to reality. All the furniture was old. I wouldn't recommend these beds for serious intimacy. We stayed in the room called the Ruth. Everyone room has a story. I honestly didn't even read our rooms story that dealt with Babe Ruth. There was a city-wide power outage, so it was kind of a mess. The gentlemen at the front desk were so kind though. Everyone was very helpful. The hotel was decorated for Christmas. Very nice for photos! The fireplace was going when we showed up. One day we came down and there was a violinist playing. Our room had two beds, a desk area, and a great view of the city (which was a problem at night, because of the noise). It was not super clean, but it was clean. The carpets looked old and dirty, the tub filled with water while I showed, so I ended up standing in water...Yuck. Along with the power outage, the phones were not working. I had a cell phone, so it wasn't a big deal. I would recommend this place for mature couples who are still looking for a good time. I say mature because of all the old furniture and good time because of all the local nightlife. The location is wonderful. Right around the corner to the right is the famous bar The Horse You Came in On. To the left is the central area where music and snacks are available. Down the street to the left are all the nice restaurants. Across the street is the pier taxi's that take you all over town.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Pinot2011
Reviews.Content: This was my first experience in Inner Harbor and probably my last. We stayed at the Admiral Fell Inn this past Thanksgiving weekend. The outside of the buidling looks very charming and even the entry way.. but once you get to your room WATCH OUT! Our room was dusty, cracked paint, no hot water, dirty comforter and very noisy. We moved rooms the next morning but I was still very uncomfortable. Everything was the same besides the noise. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone I know. The only positive was the area it resided in. Fells Point in general I give a Thumbs Up!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, fun location!”
Reviews.Author: BillinNH
Reviews.Content: My entire family stayed here for a wedding. My cousin got married there, and everything was absolutely perfect. The hotel is stunningly beautiful, and I could feel the history as I walked through the main doors. The lobby feels like a warm, toasty home. The staff was incredibly helpful, and they could not have been nicer to us. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The food in the restaurant was delicious. You can stay in the hotel and enjoy yourself, or you can take a short walk around Fell's Point and visit a multitude of restaurants and pubs. A water taxi is a short walk away to do some touring. The wedding and reception were handled flawlessly by the hotel. I wish that I lived in the area, because I'd probably have my wedding there. Absolute perfection...

Reviews.Title: “Admiration of the Admiral Fell Inn”
Reviews.Author: andil64
Reviews.Content: We had a great time staying at the Admiral Fell Inn for our 25th Wedding anniversary. After having lived in Northern Virginia for over 20 years, I can't believe that we've never visited Fell's Point and the Admiral Fell Inn. We've visited many beautiful hotels all over the world and The Admiral Fell Inn ranks among the tops in historical value, hospitality, overall comfort and excellent customer service. There are many restaurants surrounding the Inn and we just fell in love. I highly recommend a visit to this destination with respect to all types of travel -- business, pleasure; romantic getaway, friends party weekend, a family destination...everything -- just GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!”
Reviews.Author: jesicat3
Reviews.Content: After looking over the list of available hotels from Johns Hopkins and then reading review after review and make call after call, we decided on Admiral Fell Inn. We couldn't have been more pleased with our choice after our stay there. The staff was extremely helpful. The shuttle service to and from the hospital was superb, it made the surgery day so much less stressful. I highly recommend it to anyone that is in the area for a visit to Hopkins.

Reviews.Title: “Historic and charming”
Reviews.Author: LovetheBeach821
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderfu,l historic hotel in fells Point. The area is filled with great shops, bars, and restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. it is located right on the water with cobblestone streets. The views from the hotel are fabulous and the breakfast is great too! You will love the ambiance of the hotel and area. The rooms are clean and beautiful. the staff is outstanding and will accommodate special requests for birthdays, anniversaries or just surprises. We attended a birthday party on the top floor, which was spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Another Outstanding weekend at the Admiral Fell Inn”
Reviews.Author: poppop60
Reviews.Content: This is not our first visit to the Admiral Fell Inn. The hotel is charming, located near many resturants, pubs, and shops. The rooms are cozy, clean, and comfortable. For special requests...Such as fruit and cheese, wine and roses in the room contact Jill... she does a outstanding job in taking care of our requests. Everything she did was perfect. Hakeem at the front desk ..... A true gentlemen.... Welcomes you to the hotel, makes sure each and everyone of our needs were taking care of. A job well done by everyone at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: lesleychr
Reviews.Content: A charming old world hotel close to interesting shops, restaurant & water taxis. Free shuttle service to Pier 5 - downtown area. Rooms weren't large, but reasonably appointed. Second floor has a few sets of stairs to negotiate, but the porter will help with bags. Liked their green policy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Donna V
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about the wonderful stays I have had at the Admiral Fell Inn. I have stayed while on business and with my family for a weekend get-away to visit my son. The service is outstanding. I have found the staff to be exceptional - they are very helpful - always smiling, welcoming and cheerful. The dining is also great. I have never had a bad experience. The hotel is located in the best of the Fell‘s Point– right across from the water with the water taxi just steps away and within walking distance to several good restaurants and unique shops. The hotel ‘s 18th century décor makes it very charming and unique; the rooms are nicely decorated and very clean. I appreciate the wireless internet and having a coffee maker in the room! I highly recommend this hotel for family vacations or for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay in Fells Point”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel23451
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a one night stay in September at the Admiral Fell Inn because several conventions in town made it impossible to find any other hotels closer to my husbands meeting downtown. Although it wasn't our first choice, overall we enjoyed our stay. The location in Fells Point is both a positive and a negative. On the plus side, you are close to restaurants and bars and in the heart of this little historic district. The hotel does a nice job with their wine/beer and cheese happy hour which features a costumed storyteller who offers historical accounts of life in Fells Point from its founding onward. The tiny lobby actually becomes a bit of a party with the storyteller bringing the disparate group together with her tongue-in-cheek/somewhat satirical , but historically accurate delivery. The hotel also is attached to a well-reviewed tapas restaurant where we had a drink pre-happy hour (starts at six.) On the negative side, the location in Fells Point is noisy. We were awoken at 3 am when the bars let out to screaming, laughing and I swear someone was playing a saxaphone.... And this was mid-week! I can't imagine what a weekend night would be like. Our room did face the street on the third floor so there may be quieter, higher floor options. The area also feels a bit dangerous, which didn't stop us from walking to dinner across the square, but was reinforced the next morning when we were having breakfast at the Fells Point market on the square surrounded, I kid you not, by a parade of at least seven policeman in full swat team gear (bullet proof vests etc). The rooms at the Inn are on the older side with tiny out-of-date bathrooms, but the bed was comfy and the free water bottles were appreciated after the generous happy hour. The Inn staff are also very friendly, not overly professional, but I appreciated their humor and their casual vibe. All depends what type of experience you are looking for, whether or not you will enjoy the Admiral Fell Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Property with Great People”
Reviews.Author: HoosierDaddy46131
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in an amazing area. I was on a business trip with many colleagues. Every room was unique. A few of the rooms (including mine) were a little run down. I love to stay in boutique hotels because of the charm and character but some of Admiral Fell Inn's old world charm was just old and run down. It wasn't bad enough to keep me from staying there again but just be aware that your room might have stained carpet, a fridge missing one leg with a towel stuffed under it holding it up, a leaning microwave missing one leg and a chipped, peeling desk (all of these were issues in my room.) The bed, bedding and HVAC were all great and allowed me to sleep well each night. That's most important to me and I can't always say that about places I stay. The staff was excellent and very friendly. They always seemed very happy to help with any request from me or my colleagues. I wish I'd had more time to explore the area! I am planning a return trip for pleasure instead of business. I will consider the Admiral Fell Inn but I will also be comparing other hotels in the area based on features and value. Overall, I enjoyed the Admiral Fell Inn but my room was not quite what I am used to. I went back and forth between an "average" or "very good" overall rating. I chose "very good" based on the amazing service, other people's rooms, the lobby area, The Admiral's Reception, the Historic Ghost Tour and the Harbor Magic Shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms have a lot of character and the staff is very friendly and accommodating.”
Reviews.Author: Osheenseen
Reviews.Content: The Admiral Fell Inn is quite an interesting place. It has a lot of character. Each room I stayed in was unique. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. They have a reception 3 times a week that welcomes guests and teaches you about the history of the inn and Fells Point. They also have a ghost tour that is fun and informative. The restaurants affiliated with the hotel are good and, again, the staff is friendly. I have stayed here twice and would definitely stay again. The street side rooms can be a little noisy, but the views are nice.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay right in heart of Fells Point! The staff is fun, effecient, and welcoming.”
Reviews.Author: Blue_Cup_Girls
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay during the Fells Point Fun Festival. We can't imagine having the same experience for our girls weekend anywhere else. One tip we learned is to self park your car. Instead of paying $60 plus tip for the weekend we paid $23. On Sunday the streets are closed so you have to walk to your car anyway. Check in was quick and service was awesome. We were able to get the room we requested and had a refrigerator within minutes. The entire staff was fun, helpful, and always met our requests.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Malvarez11977
Reviews.Content: Unique boutique hotel. Every room is different, it's cozy and the staff is professional, friendly and very helpful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: FoodMusicman
Reviews.Content: Location outstanding; Staff friendly and accommodating .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, historical hotel, exceptionally accommodating staff!”
Reviews.Author: TimsGal1980
Reviews.Content: It was perfect for our business meeting - the management and staff were extremely accommodating - specifically, I'd like thank Ted, Rachel, Shelby, Terrence, Jessica and Hakeem for their excellent customer service. Hakeem went above and beyond by finding a box for some meeting items I could not carry in my suitcase and personally taking the box to the FedEx office to mail - in the POURING rain! Everyone in our group enjoyed themselves - the fact that it rained the entire time did not keep us from enjoying the good food at Meli American Bistro and Adela. Both places are right at the hotel so we didn't have to step a foot outside the building!

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: USA_Super_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect if you want a hotel in the heart of the Fell's Point nightlife. If you want somewhere calm and quiet...probably not the best place, though still a good hotel. Staff was friendly and helpful. The room was nothing special, but it was clean, comfortable, and safe. Pet-friendly, our dog liked the place too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Filled with History”
Reviews.Author: CravetheCoast
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through the Historic Hotels of America website. My wife and I appreciate staying at Historic Hotels. We were visiting family in the area. The Inn is located in the charming Fells Point area. Saturday morning there was an amazing farmers market in the square acrross from the hotel. Sunday morning there was a fantastic flea market. We enjoyed our visit and are sure to return.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Admiral Fell Inn and always stay there when we visit Baltimore!”
Reviews.Author: Sparkiewillie
Reviews.Content: The Admiral Fell Inn is a lovely place to stay in a great neighborhood and they allow dogs!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: momx3Nj
Reviews.Content: Admiral Fells is in a great location. Fells Point is very lively, there are many eating places and pubs. It seems to be a safe area. The hotel is conveniently located across the street from the water taxi that takes you everywhere. You do not need a car. The hotel is very nice, the staff were accomodating and friendly. My only complaint, although the room appeared clean the stains on the carpet made me second guess the cleanliness. The rooms are well decorated but there is noticeable wear on the furnishings. Also, at reservation I was not informed that there was a $9 destination fee. The fee covers the bottle water, reception and shuttle. The waters and reception were nice. We did not use the shuttle, the water taxi was so enjoyable and convenient and you pay once for all day unlimited use. Overall the Admiral Fells in very nice and we enjoyed our stay. If we were to return to the Baltimore area, we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Charming in Charm City”
Reviews.Author: chocoholic52
Reviews.Content: Baltimore is one of our favorite cities. We visit a couple times a month for day trips. This is the second time we have stayed overnight at the Admiral Fell Inn. The character and ambiance of this Inn makes it a welcome change from the chain hotels. The walls are decorated with pictures of historic Baltimore. The ghost stories that go with the Inn add to the charm. We were pleasantly surprised by the ample space of the rooms. The beds are comfortable. The staff is warm and professional during our stay. After our stay, they were prompt in solving a billing error. We will definitely stay there again and again when visiting Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “The Stay and Cruise package was great!”
Reviews.Author: Amy H
Reviews.Content: This hotel made everything so easy. We were able to get a very early checkin, got a Town Car to the port and upon return, a ride back to the Inn. The staff stored our luggage, allowed us to use the Harbor Magic Shuttle service and got us a cab to the airport. Because of their level of customer service, we were able to enjoy several hours in the Inner Harbor and a great lunch at La Tavola in Little Italy!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But Beware”
Reviews.Author: Mickydel752
Reviews.Content: We moved my daughter into her housing at UMD College Park and decided to take an extra day and spend the night in Fells Point as we'd been there before and enjoyed it quite a bit. We honestly weren't totally sure about this hotel based on some of the reviews posted here but we went with it based on the location. Upon arrival we were pleasantly surprised by the staff and the look of the lobby. Our room was clean and the bed was comfortable. We had a great night out and enjoyed Bertha's Mussels and gelato for dessert. The cost of the room was reasonable and we had a great parking spot on the street. The rub that I have is this... when we received our bill at checkout there was a"destination charge" of $9.95. When we questioned the charge at the front desk we were told that that charge was imposed by the hotel and was not a city or state tax. It was to cover the telephone in the room and the use of the lobby. I don't know how many people use the phones in hotels anymore - we don't. As to the use of the lobby we just walked through it. I'm not totally sure how a lobby wold be "used". I told the clerk they should just raid the rate by $10 rather than be deceptive. He had nothing to say.. I would have rated this hotel higher but really feel like we were decieved by the posted rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent everything was exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Robert P
Reviews.Content: courtsey of staff, location, decour, and cleanliness were outstanding, would definatley go back.

Reviews.Title: “It was a delightful hotel and lovely place to celebrate our anniversary.”
Reviews.Author: Siggy1950
Reviews.Content: Fell's Point is a very quaint and interesting area of Baltimore. The Admiral Fell Inn has an excellent location for numerous attractions and dining. It was a wonderful experience and we would most definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “The only place I want to stay in Baltimore from now on.”
Reviews.Author: haydaze
Reviews.Content: The rooms were fun and beautifully appointed, but the staff is what makes this hotel what it is--superior. They went out of their way to accommodate us, from checking us in VERY early because the rooms were available, to helping us try and track down our Oriole's tickets, to chasing us down the street to the water taxi to give me the papers I had left on the desk by mistake. The rooms are spacious, the beds are comfy, and once the street/restaurant noise dies down (at a very reasonable hour), they are also very quiet. We attended the admiral's reception and enjoyed talking with other guests, as well as employees. we opted out of the ghost tour, but heard from others that it was well done. we breakfasted on site at Meli and were well satisfied with quanity and quality. We are definitely going back and staying at the admiral fell inn again. the hotel is hooked up with harbor magic, which made transportation to the aquarium very easy for us.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Chuloforever
Reviews.Content: I been going to Fell Point for a long time, and I can say Excellent place to be. The Management (Ted) Hakeem at the Front Desk and Sandra are the best. I love coming back to Admiral Fell Inn because they treat us like family. I come with my dogs Nina and Jessie and they love it been because they treat them like stars.. :) Recommend the Admiral Fell Inn to anyone. Is a hidden treasure.

Reviews.Title: “just ok...not that impressed...”
Reviews.Author: dmama21g
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight for a quick trip to Inner Harbor...great location in Fell's Point and very easy to use shuttle to get to inner harbor. Staff extremely couteous...but hotel itself old, OVERPRICED, sink leaked all over floor in bathroom, jacuzzi tub nasty---totally didn't use bc we both were grossed out, and mattress caved in and woke up with sore back which has never happenned in my life! Also, since it's an old building, you can hear everything, like the entire conversation of people next to you and in hallway. I think I would pay the extra $50 and stay somewhere else nicer.

Reviews.Title: “1st time in Maryland”
Reviews.Author: Kathy G
Reviews.Content: MD is such a historical area and this INN provided us with a lot to see, hear and experience. The staff is very knowledgable and there are plaques, pictures, books and people to fill you in on a lot more! It is walking distance from cool attractions, too!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ludlow67
Reviews.Content: Good value and within close provimity to several bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Be sure to see Rachael if you need any help or tourism suggestions”
Reviews.Author: olsenstan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is warm and inviting and location is great if you want nightlife which we didn't realize..our panic (we were meeting with family with total of 11 kids) was very short lived thanks to the front desk woman, Rachael. So warm and gracious...and most importantly...a wealth of knowledge of amazing family friendly resources just minutes away. I happened to be moaning to myself and she sensed my panic and immediately, without me asking, had my itinerary set! I was a king amongst kings with our group for planning such an amazing time...but not even remotely possible without Rachael. How smart of the owners to put an Inner Harbor expert in such a position...valuable resource for your guests. We will be back in October and hope to thank her again in person.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect trip to Baltimore!”
Reviews.Author: ellenmckenna1
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Admiral Fell Inn because it was walking distance to Camden Yards. What we found was a wonderful small hotel, exceptional staff, and a quiet, spotless, comfortable room. It was also wonderfully cool during the recent awful heat wave. The front desk and reservation people answered countless questions on the phone when I booked the room. When we arrived early, our room was ready for us! WHAT a great time we had. Lovely location, wonderful people, great room. Could you ask for a better stay? I think not!

Reviews.Title: “Admiral Fell is the best ******”
Reviews.Author: poppop60
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Admiral Fell Inn again. We celebrated our wedding anniversary at the Admiral Fell, which was the best choice we could have made. I asked for special foods and drinks ordered to our room, the service of the staff was perfect, The food, service, the friendly staff made the stay the most enjoyable weekend one could ask for. The room was very clean, bed was comfy, the room gave us the you are at home feeling..... We stayed at the Admiral Fell before, and we will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: pbld123
Reviews.Content: We had to find a new place to stay this year for our trip to Baltimore when the price of a room at the Marriott went over $300. My husband booked this room through Expedia, and we were all pleased with his choice. The Inn is is an ideal location, surrounded by interesting boutiques and bistros. The rooms were small but very clean and comfortable, The air conditioning worked well and the beds were extremely comfortable. Our only complaint was the spotty service. The only vending machine in the hotel was out of service and when my friend mentioned this at the front desk the only response was agreement that, indeed, it was out of service. There was no offer or suggestion about where she could obtain a desperately needed diet coke. When we asked for suggestions on how to get to the Farmers Market, the evening staff told us that their shuttle would take us there, but in the morning we discovered that this wasn't the case. And on a Sunday morning, in the summer, at check out time, there was only one person assigned to valet service. None of these problem areas would be enough to keep me from staying there again, and I would recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great character hotel”
Reviews.Author: cgfLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot of character and old-time charm. Staff were very helpful and polite. Loved the feeling of history in the room as well as in the hallways and common areas. The adjoining restaurant was fabulous for breakfast - food was very fresh and delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Fell Inn!!”
Reviews.Author: Aunt98
Reviews.Content: Used the Harbor Magic Specialist to reserve our room as well as to get ideas for things to do. I had used this service earlier this year when visiting with my nephew. Jill, my service specialist, remembered me from this contact. She made my reservation for the admiral fell inn and suggested the food tour, making that reservation as well. As the tour, which was good food, interesting history and a lot of fun, started at 3 pm she also requested an early check in, which the inn gladly gave us. We had a great room and the staff could not have been more helpful, and friendly. It is an older historic hotel but was clean and comfortable. My only complaint is that we could not get MASN on the TV to watch the O's game, which seems rather a small matter. If it says anything, we are going back in october for the Little Italy food tour, and another stay at the admiral fell inn!! once i speak with jill, that is!!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place.... We stay at the Fell every year.”
Reviews.Author: where2next-12
Reviews.Content: We go to Baltimore for a weekend every summer, and Admiral Fell Inn is the only place we'll stay. The rooms are clean and well decorated. The staff goes above and beyond to make your stay enjoyable, and they are very helpful and informative if you need information on places to go, eat,or see. The hotel is at a great location.... You can walk everywhere in Fells Point, or take the water taxi into Inner Harbor. If you are going to Baltimore, this is the place to stay. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “We just returned from another wonderful stay at the Admiral Fell Inn”
Reviews.Author: kteacher19
Reviews.Content: Another amazing stay at this lovely hotel! We stayed two nights pre-cruise, using the cruise and stay package,which included a towncar transfer to and from the pier, breakfast one morning at the hotel, and 10 days of parking. The hotel is conveniently located across the street from the water taxi stop. We used the water taxi to visit the Inner Harbor area, as well as Camden Yards (great ball park!). There are lots of great restaurants and museums to visit-it was difficult to choose which ones. We spent most of one day at the American Museum of Visionary Art-this was one of the best museums I've been to in a long time. The hotel is staffed by an amazing group of people. They are the friendliest, most helpful hotel staff that I've ever encountered! The hotel itself is very quaint, with lots of historic framed prints. There are events which are hosted in the hotel lobby that unfortunately due to time constraints we weren't able to take advantage of (hopefully we will during our next stay!). Our room was very clean, comfortable, and we had a nice view from the window. We are looking forward to staying at the Admiral Fell Inn next summer!

Reviews.Title: “All you need for a Harbor stay”
Reviews.Author: DianeS03
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed overnight at the Admirel Fell's Inn. Everything was top-notch. Valet parking was easy to access on our arrival and the front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. They let us know about the amenities such as the Harbor Magic shuttle (will take you to Inner Harbor), the Ghost Tour and the two restaurants attached to the hotel. The room was clean and well-stocked. The four poster bed with lace cover was a nice touch. Despite being located on the street side, the noise was minimal, though I would probably ask for an inner room next time. We had no trouble using our computer in the room. The hotel is located on the corner near the water taxis, restarants and bars. Overall, a nice choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Time, hope to be back soon”
Reviews.Author: Tomdecook
Reviews.Content: Had a great time with a more than perfect room, access to all events within a stones throw.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway”
Reviews.Author: Robinalpn
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in the middle of lots of little taverns! Water taxi across the street. I would recommend a room with a balcony!!

Reviews.Title: “The put the "charm" in Charm City!”
Reviews.Author: AreWeThereYet1973
Reviews.Content: If you like historic character, friendly, helpful front desk staff and being right in the middle of things, you'll love this place! Yes, the carpets could stand to be cleaned or replaced and, as one would expect in an older building, the rooms aren't "super-sized." But the beds (four-poster with canopy) were pretty and comfortable. The front desk staff is amazing and everyone went out of their way to help us and answer questions for us. The free shuttle to Hopkins came quickly when we requested it beyond its set time. The hotel shuttle makes it easy and cheap to get to Hopkins or to the Inner Harbor, but another option is the Water Taxi which stops right outside the door of the hotel and takes you to the Inner Harbor ($10 per adult and you can ride as many times as you want that day-- plus you get a book of good coupons for restaurants and bars in the Harbor and Fells Point). At the end of the day there are dinner and drink options right out the front the door in both directions (we parked the car at the public parking garage on Caroline Street 3 blocks away and paid less for 2 days of parking than we would have paid for one day of valet parking). Little Italy is less than a mile away (an easy walk in the daytime but probably wouldn't walk it at night). If you like charming, old buildings and the quirks that come with them; if you like warm, helpful front desk staff who greet you intimately each time you come through the doors; if you are going to Baltimore to explore all its charms, then this is definitely the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully restored historic inn; comfortable rooms; perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Travel4me4ever
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very receptive to Johns Hopkins patients. The shuttle service the hotel provides to and from the hospital campus worked perfectly. The hotel facilities exceeded my expectations, the Admiral's reception was charming, and the two double four poster beds in our room were so comfortable, we didn't want to leave. The Admiral Fells Inn will be my home base for all future visits to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “will not be back...”
Reviews.Author: golucky1
Reviews.Content: They charge a high rate and our room had one of the filthiest carpets we have ever experienced...on our second day the "cleaning" of room did not even include vacuuming . Thin walls and noise coming through easily....I asked to speak to manager and was told he was "on the way" on the morning we were checking out...waited an additional hour and still no manager and we needed to leave...wrote to manager after returning home to give him information about our stay and discontent with lack of upkeep and rates and have not had a response....obviously, they do not care!

Reviews.Title: “Wife loves it so we'll be back, great location, great deals”
Reviews.Author: BigDaddy3n
Reviews.Content: Nice tucked away historic hotel, very nice staff, to include the vallet...... The rooms are from basic cute to very romantic according to what you reserve. Canopy beds, loft rooms, etc....very nice. This hotel is for different, location, and somewhat romantic...not a 5 star luxury hotel, and not supposed to be. It's perfect for what it was built to be. The new restaurant Mezza is very nice, has great food & very romantic atmosphere...but we miss the old breakfast room in the basement :( A must stay especially if your get a good rate, they have deals all the time... It can get a little noisey outside at night, but great places to walk & eat within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great, wouldn't stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: shayrene
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip June 12-16, 2011. I was given a room on the first floor of the hotel. To get to the room, you have to go through the back of the restaurant, past the service elevators and the outside patio service. Needless to say, this is not a quiet place to sleep. (Rooms 193-195). I heard diners laughing and drinking and dishes being bussed. It kind of felt like the maid's quarters of an old hotel. The carpets need a serious deep cleaning. Also, my bathroom had a drip in the bathtub. The hotel touts being green, but was wasting water with this drip. I let them know and it took 2 times for them to finally fix it. DO NOT VALET PARK HERE. It takes 15-20 minutes for them to retrieve your car. The hours are from 6am-10pm, which I was never told. I came in late one night (11:30 pm) and was left to find my own parking.
