There are 2 garages within walking distance of the hotel with easy 24 hour access. Positives were the hotel front desk staff (Hakeem), free internet, free beer and wine reception on Monday and Wednesday, and complimentary water in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Return visit....”
Reviews.Author: KittyC1
Reviews.Content: Initally stayed and reviewed the AFI in September, 2009. Have been back 2X since then, this past May being the 2nd. As before, I found the hotel to be a most welcome change from "cookie cutter" hotels and the location cannot be beat. Did encounter acouple of "less than great" issues during these subsequent visits (I.e, no towels nor clean mugs, glassware in room) and was given a room my last visit on the 1st floor near the kitchen (NEVER again!) but all in all, the staff works hard to correct what can be corrected and I will definietly stay again. I did discover if you call the hotel rather than book online, you have a chance at getting a (slightly) better rate.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Clerk went WAAAAY out of his way to help us out with some things. AFI is a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Greg_W_Ohio
Reviews.Content: Front Desk Clerk went way out of his way to help us out. My girlfriend has a lung disease and has to carry a lot more baggage on vacations than a normal person b/c of meds and machines. Front Desk Clerk noticed we had a lot of bags and realized we would have to walk up stairs to get to our room. He promptly told us about the stairs and that he would switch our rooms to a more easily accessible room. To get us to a room where no stairs were needed to get there, our room had to be upgraded and that was done at no charge. It was greatly appreciated!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Accommodating and Lovely. We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: MWhit79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 1st anniversary in Baltimore and stayed at the Admiral Fell Inn. We will definitely be back. From booking to check out the staff was accommodating, friendly and warm. Every request we made was made and our expectations exceeded. The staff also went above and beyond to make recommendations. Our room was charming and the Inn itself was beautiful, with extreme care in keeping the buildings historical integrity. We will most definitely make this our place to stay when we are in Baltimore in the future! (Oh and go to the Admiral's Reception, it was great fun!)

Reviews.Title: “Charming and clean”
Reviews.Author: ckyrock85
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a wedding. The hotel was clean and had a charming feel to it. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. I had read reviews that it was in a bad part of town, however we did not see it as a problem. It may have gotten a little loud at night being that there are several bars around the area but it was never scary and we never once felt uncomfortable. We used the Carolina Street Garage which was only 3 blocks away and MUCH cheaper than valet. Overall I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to recover from surgery”
Reviews.Author: jennhames
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Admiral Fell after surgery at Johns Hopkins. We had a great experience with the staff, room and shuttle. Fells Point is a great area to walk around while recovering or to mentally get away from the hospital. We plan on staying at the Admiral at our follow up trips to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay when visiting Fells Point.”
Reviews.Author: ltrain6666
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay when visiting Fells Point. Location is perfect and staff is awesome....

Reviews.Title: “A Quaint Historical site ~pristine rooms, exceptional staff~in the midst of a New orleans type Atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: Marsharina
Reviews.Content: Our stay, too brief to suit us, was fascinating. The Adela Restaurant next door was spectacular, offering a vast array of Tapas, wines, & Sangria! Our intentions are to be back soon to further explor Baltimore's Splendor. We wouldn't think of staying elsewhere. The Ghost tour was a treat~a bit spooky~

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience in a warm and charming inn.”
Reviews.Author: stroberw
Reviews.Content: A stay at the Admiral Fell is great for anyone who would like a warm, comfortable, and friendly inn or small hotel experience. The staff is super and the rooms are comfortable. Shuttle service makes it convenient to major intown facilities. The hotel is particularly convenient to Johns Hopkins Hospital - less than 10 minutes. A plus is the charming neighborhood in which it is located.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Noreen25
Reviews.Content: Loved the location, could walk to everything. Room was very nice and clean. Hotel staff were very accomodating. Loved it and would recommend anyway stay at the Admiral Fell Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Nice visit and staff. Everyone took good care of us and made our visit very enjoyable. We would go back in a heartbeat.”
Reviews.Author: Hokeyfan
Reviews.Content: We made a visit as part of the Harbor Magic package. The staff was above board and helped with everything from minor request to where to eat. The room was very nice and clean. Everything worked. I would recommend if traveling with small children the local restaurants are great (good food & menus) but we did have problems finding kids menu type food. There are some places but we didn't find many. We will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Waaaaaay exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: kathmomma
Reviews.Content: I extended my business trip to make a little mini-vacation. I had no idea I would be staying in such a fun hotel! Everyone there has a smile on their face. They remembered my name when they spoke to me and always asked if there was anything they could do to make the stay better. Their ghost tour was exciting and the admiral's reception delicious! I would highly recommend this hotel whether coming through for business or pleasure! BTW, the two hotels on the premise were SO good that we opted to eat most of our meals right there!

Reviews.Title: “I won't be staying here again”
Reviews.Author: tobroadway
Reviews.Content: The hotel room doors do not have extra security latches, meaning housekeeping can just walk into your room - which they did. I did not enjoy starting my morning with housekeeping seeing me completely naked. Second, valet took forever. Almost an hour pulling up, and an hour waiting to leave - and I was the only one there. If you're going to charge 30 bucks to valet park, you should hire more than one guy. I am still unsure if they offer room service, which is important to me as a solo traveler. I don't know if there is a fitness room, which is also important to me. They give you NO information here. They offer free wine on Mondays from 5-7 but I don't know where. And when I asked the front desk if I can walk to the inner harbor he said, it's a 15 minute walk just follow the water." Those are the wrong directions. There is not a walkway to the inner harbor by the water. Those directions made my walk over an hour. I don't care how great the location is. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful stay! Made our 30th wedding anniversary more special!”
Reviews.Author: 30thanniversary81
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, grand old hotel! Our room was comfortable and extremely clean. We enjoyed the interaction with the other guests, the beer/wine/snacks at the Admiral's Reception. We will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable historic hotel in great location, excellent staff and service”
Reviews.Author: FLgirlinLondon
Reviews.Content: Several members of my family stayed at the Admiral Fell for a stay of over a week and I can't say enough good things about the front desk staff in particular. They were completely responsive -- switching our rooms for better ones when necessary (one of us was in a rather loud room tucked back behind one of the restaurants, but the next morning the staff quickly switched that room for a quieter one on an upper floor) and helping us figure out things like ground transportation around Baltimore. The Admiral Fell is conveniently located for easy access to downtown, Inner Harbour and to Johns Hopkins hospital and they offer special rates for patients receiving treatment at the hospital as well as shuttle service. Fells Point is a charming neighborhood with lots of fun restaurants, cafes and boutiques within two or three blocks of the hotel. Lastly, the Admiral Fell is one of the most pet-friendly hotels I've ever stayed in. The rooms are comfortable with charming federalist period decor (a lot of the rooms have four poster beds). I would definitely stay here again on future visits to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “We fell in love with the Admiral Fell Inn”
Reviews.Author: bunny6224
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Inn for 2 nights. The staff that greeted us was very friendly and helpful. Our room had a balcony,jaccuzi tub and king size bed. What a treat! After a drink on the balcony and a hot soak in the tub we slept like babies in the cozy bed with extra super soft pillows. We were lucky to also have an experience with one of the Inn's famous ghosts. We are looking forward to visiting again. If your looking for a charming,intimate,friendly hotel in a fabulous location with alot to do day and night this is the place for you! Have fun and hopefully you will also get meet one of their permanent long term guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Walk to everything in Inner Harbor area. Pleasant hotel.”
Reviews.Author: IOBLAD
Reviews.Content: Warm and friendly greeting, helpful staff. The room was very adequate, clean, well appointed. Will definitely stay at AFI again.

Reviews.Title: “They treat you better than family”
Reviews.Author: newbeeVa
Reviews.Content: We recently had to travel to Baltimore for a visit to Johns Hopkins. Going to another state to see a bunch of doctors is not typically a good experience but our stay at Admiral Fell turned our trip into a great experience. The staff was so helpful and friendly. They treated us special and like we were old friends. The hotel itself is so beautiful and clean. The location could not be better......right off the water and in the middle of Fells Point with shops and cafe's and pubs. You can spend a day just walking the area. From the valet to the cleaning staff to the front desk clerk.......we LOVED this Inn. We will happily stay there every time we visit Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful all the way around”
Reviews.Author: ibcnyou
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Admiral Fell Inn as part of my husband birthday celebration. The entire staff there was very friendly, attentive and helpful. Our room was small, but only due to the age of the building, and extremely clean. We attended the 5:00 orientation which was given by a woman dressed in the colonial period and that was especially nice. There was beer and wine offered along with cheese and crackers. But the highlight was definitely the woman's way of giving us a history lesson in the form of a story. Very well done!!! Since we booked our room over 14 days in advance, we were also given a $25 gift certificate toward a meal during our stay. There is also valet parking which is well worth the expense due to lack of parking space in the Fells Point area. We had a wonderful weekend retreat thanks to the staff at Admiral Fell Inn. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “The Inn is beautiful, historic, and located centrally to everything I needed.”
Reviews.Author: Echolynn
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed with this site, I would stay here every time that I come to Baltimore. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful, even at the wee hours of the night. They provided everything we needed and more. The rooms were all beautiful, and each one has a story connected to it, which added to the historical feel of the property. It's centrally located to several amazing restaurants and shopping areas, and we were never bored on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not What We Expected”
Reviews.Author: carefree_travler
Reviews.Content: Had to make short fuse arrangements for a hotel near Johns Hopkins Hospital. This looked like a good bet...lots promised as part of the package, right location, etc. Didn't turn out so nice. Reception on arrival was cordial. Room was ready and generally clean...though dirty in some nasty ways--chunks of some substance adhered to end table, smears on wall. sink and tub that didn't drain properly. Used the $25 voucher we received at check-in at one of their two restaurants--which turned out to be a mistake. Very pricey for the quality, slow service and dark atmosphere. Things really went down hill from here. I had a 6 AM report time at the hospital. The 5 AM wake-up call we requested never came...were told no one answered... they didn't see fit to send someone to the room to knock on the door. Turns out that the phone was defective....it was replaced, but the replacement also turned out to be defective. This made communicating from the hospital challenging to say the least. My wife returned to spent the night at the hotel while I stayed overnight in the hospital. She found that her room had not been cleaned at all. The desk gave her another diner voucher as an appology. She ordered diner but her order was seeingly never placed and when she inquired as to why patrons who had arrived after her were served and she was not, the waiter had no answer other that that he would check. He returned shortly with what she descibed as a raw piece of meat. She left. The hotel's reponse was to send a glass of champagne and three desserts to our room. Which seems to me to be a bizzare response to the problem. The hotel seemed pretty nice in many ways and the attitude of almost all employees we interfaced with in dealing with the problems we sincere and appologetic. While thankful to those who tried to correct or compensate for the difficulties we encountered---they deducted $50 from our final bill--I would never stay at this hotel or any of its related properties. I expect what we experienced was the result of serious senior management problems and lack of training....things which take lots of time to straighten out.

Reviews.Title: “Another weekend getaway.....”
Reviews.Author: poppop60
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoy the Fells Point area. This is our sixth time staying at the Admiral Fell Inn. Each and every time we have enjoyed the area, the hotel is within walking distance of plenty of good food and drinks. The hotel staff .... super friendly each and everyone there. Hotel is A ++++

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean, respectful and right in the heart of it all!”
Reviews.Author: kgoldrich
Reviews.Content: I loved staying here. The whole process, from reserving the room up to staying was all very nice. I even got an email that allowed me to upgrade my room for a reduced rate, which I did. It was awesome! The rooms were all very clean, the sheets and beds were all nice (they use down pillows, in case you're allergic). If you get a room with a balcony, you might be sharing with the room next to you, but I didn't have a problem with the neighbors. I went with a large group event, and the staff was all so nice to everyone! The location canNOT be beat in Fells Point. Had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel, great staff, great weekend”
Reviews.Author: Sooper1138
Reviews.Content: The entire time we were there, from beginning to end, the staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were beautiful. One of the better hotels I've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Weaving History, Convienience, and Fun into one.”
Reviews.Author: Larpergirl
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The only problems I had with the hotel were minor and didn't detract from the stay too much. The most major problem was parking. The general area around the Fells Point Inn has no parking. While having the car valet parked was helpful it was also costly. But parking on the street was $2 an hour and there are several garages near the hotel but not really within a reasonable distance from the hotel if you are lazy and don't want to walk a block or two. We used valet this time but If we stayed again would definitely carpool. The other problems we had were temperature, trash, vending, and handicapped related. We had our air on high and max cool and it wasn't very cold. I know this could be related to the age of the building but it was cooler outside than in our room and I know when it is summer that we would have had major complaints had we stayed later in the year. Also the trashcans need to be bigger all around. My group had the run of most of the 5th floor and the rooms there were warm and overflowing with trash There needed to be larger trashcans in the conference rooms and the main rooms. We had to leave extra bags full of trash because we filled up the room and bathroom cans. I went to get ice from the 2nd floor and the room with the vending area smelled really bad. I'm not sure if it was mold, mildew, or some sort of pipe issue. Also there were ramps inside for handicapped people but i didn't see one on the front doors.

Reviews.Title: “Step back into time with friendly, personalized top of the line service.”
Reviews.Author: TLawson84
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in wonderful Fell's Point. Plenty of bonuses including shuttle service, internet, movies in room, special guest events/receptions, etc. Enjoy a Ghost Tour, Wine Reception, etc. all included with your room. Excellent Valet parking. Parked our car when we arrived and never had to move it. Shuttle took us to the areas we needed. Would stay at this hotel again and again. Harbor Magic specialists help you arrange dinner reservations, tickets to attractions, etc. Wonderful staff and gorgeous, unique facility.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous history and hotel experience provided through service, decor, location and welcoming activities. A must stay.”
Reviews.Author: Kiwiaussie65
Reviews.Content: This amazing historic hotel is situated close to the water in Fell's Point Baltimore on a cobblestone street. It is situated close to the water taxis and within 20 minutes walk of the Inner Harbour. A courtesy shuttle provides easy access to down town. The hotel is an experience in itself with its decor, amazing historic photographs, evening reception with the 'Admiral' and a ghost tour. Staff can not be faulted. Excellent restaurants are within the building and close by. The location is that of a village within a city. Learn about the beginning of boat building, canneries and the evolution of the Fells Point area.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the trip!!”
Reviews.Author: Mh3396
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, interesting decor. Great service, the breakfast was phenomenal. We came for the food tour which was awesome. The area is excellent for exploration. We were only there for a short stay; there is so much more to see, so many more photos to take.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: fastueuxcaprice
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely what my friend and I were looking for to spend the night. My friend needed to drop her car off at the Baltimore Port and then be in DC the next day for her doctor apppointment. Baltimore was the best place to stay for us and we absolutely loved the hotel. We checked in very late at night, around 10:15ish. Sandra was right there to greet us with a warm welcome and a friendly smile. She was such a tremendous help to us. She recommended restaurants to eat around the property. She even printed us out directions from the hotel to the port (the exact spot where the car needed to be dropped off) and from the port to the hospital in Washington, DC where my friend had her appointment. Sandra definitely went above and beyond, and I truly appreciate her hospitality. We stayed in the Peabody room on the 3rd floor, and as soon as we opened up the room and saw the two four-post beds, our first reaction was: "Awwwwww, we have to take a picture!" Let me tell you, if your first reaction is that reaction, you know it is a good place to stay. The view was not very good, but we were not there for that and therefore I did not mind. Our room was very quiet and we both slept so good. The room and bathroom were both spacious and definitely adequate enough for two of us. We are actually planning a return trip to stay in Baltimore for one night and DC the next day and you can bet we will be staying at the Admiral Fell Inn.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to stay with your family!”
Reviews.Author: eyesesk
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay with your family! I highly recommend this hotel, and am looking forward to a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing. Had a wonderful weekend -- exceeded all expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda0913
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly and helpful. Hotel was gorgeous -- reminded me of New Orleans. Perfect location for evening walks, browsing shops, restaurants... a must-visit.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Dogmom11236
Reviews.Content: My husband is a US Merchant Marine, and I usually pick him up and/or drop him off at the port of Baltimore. When we stay in Baltimore, we check into this hotel. It has a quiet elegance, and the location is great for walking around the Fell's Point area of Baltimore. On my recent visit, I did opt for the jacuzzi room and I would not do that again. For one thing it was only slightly bigger than my tub at home, and another thing the water from the shower did not drain quickly so after taking a shower, well the thought of sitting in the tub lost its appeal. Two other things of note, if you valet park your vehicle, the valet leaves at 10:00PM. When I had to get my car later than that, I had to get the key card for the garage form the front desk and walk 2 blocks to a closed garage. I was not happy doing this , but luckily my car was on the ground floor. Upon my return, I parked on the street as the meters do not go into effect until 10:00 AM. The Inn also charges a fee for $9.95, to cover internet, phone use, a gym pass, and a shuttle. We did use the shuttle which was convenient. The staff was helpful and friendly, and as I said the location makes its a great restaurant/bar/shopping/museum place.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel with tons of personality!”
Reviews.Author: Bonneville07
Reviews.Content: The Admiral Fell is a quirky hotel with lots of weird corridors and strangely shaped rooms, but that is one of the things we like most about it: this is a hotel that WAS NOT designed-by-committee to make it as bland as possible. Colors are vibrant and interesting, adjoining walls are often not at right angles, the door might not open 100% due to a nearby wall, or whatever, these little quirks, for my money, give the place a ton of charm. Skip the early breakfast at Meli, the attached restaurant. This was our only experience at this restaurant, but it was kind of poor. Staff at the hotel is friendly and courteous, and the location, we think, is quite convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Charm and history in Fells Point”
Reviews.Author: acc47
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Admiral Fell 6 or 7 times. We love its location and its charm. We also love that it is pet friendly, since we like to travel with our dog. The staff is friendly and helpful. The in-house dining options--Meli and Adela--are innovative and fun. Be aware, though, that parking is a huge challenge (unless you valet for $29/night!)--best would be to self-park in a garage a couple of blocks away, leave the car there and take the hotel shuttle around. Also, access to some of the rooms from the elevators is diffifult due to winding hallways and steps up or down in the halls themselves. All part of the charm, we believe!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing area, amazing hotel, amazing time”
Reviews.Author: mikefro15
Reviews.Content: Fell's Point was a great place to get away for a couple of days and there is no better place to stay in the area then the Admiral Fell's Hotel. I've stayed at a number of hotels in the area and this was by far the best. The hospitality was unmatchable, the rooms were clean and comfortable. We stayed in room 289, which was a pleasure. The beds had wonderful canopies and I slept like a baby. It's quiet and private and right near all of the attractions in the area. I would rate this hotel as a 10 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: DianeMcGraw
Reviews.Content: The Inn was a wonderful experience--employees, decor, Tapas, shuttle transportation to Johns Hopkins Hopkins, and valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Fells Point”
Reviews.Author: wildcatkb
Reviews.Content: We LOVED staying here, a great alternative to Baltimore's more expensive Inner Harbor options. The historical value (we stayed in the Frederick Douglass room) and preservation of the building is incredible here. It's located in a prime Fells Point location, a short walk across the street to the water taxi that can take you to the Inner Harbor, Fort Henry, etc. The water taxi ride is really nice, not too expensive, and doesn't take too long. The Fells Point area is also loaded with great bars and restaurants (you MUST go to Bertha's Mussels if you find yourself here!!!). This hotel is also part of the Harbor Magic group, which runs a lot of promotions... I entered a photo from my trip into a contest and won a voucher for a free night at the hotel for a later date! The room was super roomy and comfortable for being in such an old building. The king size bed was great, loved the mattress. The bathroom was nothing special, but it was fine. The TV was in a weird spot (to the side of the bed, and kind of close to it as well) but not a big deal. The staff at the Admiral Fell is probably the NICEST PEOPLE EVER. Seriously, I can't say enough things about how much I loved the staff here, they were so helpful and FRIENDLY! Being from Boston, I was kind of shocked that such nice people even exist in customer service. The staff alone is reason enough for me to want to go back. They answered all my questions, went out of their way to be courteous and helpful, and not once did I feel like I was inconveniencing them. We checked in close to midnight and had no problem whatsoever. If I had any complaints about this hotel, it would be the parking situation. It's a little rough in this area, but there is street parking if you know the rules (ask a staff member!), and there are garages pretty close by that aren't too outrageously priced. I wouldn't expect a full parking lot in a historical neighborhood like this anyway though, so I wasn't surprised. We never had trouble finding a place to park, it was just sometimes more convenient than other times. Another complaint I had was that we had one particularly loud neighbor one night, and their TV had to have been on full volume up until 2-3am. However, when we called the front desk to see if they could ask our neighbors to dial it down, I did hear their phone ring shortly after, and their volume did get turned down after that. I don't know that I will ever stay anywhere else when I go back to Baltimore in the coming years. My experience here was so positive, and I think I will always hold a special little place for it in my heart :)

Reviews.Title: “Our second year coming back!”
Reviews.Author: jfgp100
Reviews.Content: We love this marvelously quaint hotel that is in such a great location that is in the hub of the harbor. The staff is great, the rooms are charming, restaurants at your fingertips..... and there is always a special to be had. We visited Spa Sante upon this visit along with a 25.00 credit to our total. The huge bonus is the shuttle that takes you where ever you want to go..... hence the shuttle and to Ruth's Chris which is in the Pier 5 hotel. As our room was facing the main road I would recomend a room not facing the street if an early bedtime is needed. A great time was had by all!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wanderingduo65
Reviews.Content: We were here in conjunction with a family hospital stay at Johns Hopkins and had to extend our stay several times. The staff could not have been more helpful or considerate. This was our second stay and the hotel continues to provide excellence value. The rooms are spacious and well appointed, the Cloud Club hot breakfast was good and the shuttle service a true gift. David, Andrea and Meredith were especially kind and helpful to us in a stressful situation but all of the staff was efficient and professional. The location is perfect just off the Inner Harbor and I will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Admiral Fell Inn captures the essence of Fells Point.”
Reviews.Author: Cjenks1970
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent place to stay if you want the true Fells Point experience. You can't beat the location since it puts right smack-dab in the middle of the action. The rooms are a great value (compared to across the Harbor) and the surroundings are marvelous. You know the minute you walk through the front door by the way you're greeted that you're in for a wonderful stay. The staff is genuinely warm, friendly, and more than helpful day or night.

Reviews.Title: “Horribly Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jwjon1
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation directly with Harbor Magic about a month in advance for a room with two doubles--important as I was traveling with colleagues. Upon check-in, my room was not yet ready and so I checked my baggage and went about my business for the day. When I returned that evening and asked for my room, the comment from registration was a "oh, you are that person." I didn't know how to respond to that, other than to say I guess so? Turns out, the double room reserved was knowingly given to someone else, and I was "that person"--the one who got shafted. I disappointedly accepted a room with a solo bed, only to find out upon entering that it reeked of cigarette smoke. And not stale smoke, which in itself would be unacceptable in a non-smoking hotel, but fresh smoke. As though someone was just in there smoking, decided they wanted a different room, and hotel management quickly tidied it up to flip it for "that person." When I requested a different room, I was told that no other rooms were available. I had to make alternate arrangements at the very last minute... not a way I like to operate. Indeed, I get that hotels sell out. What I don't get is why this hotel was sold out, or how it continues to garner great tripadvisor ratings. This was the first time tripadvisor failed me. Admiral Fell Inn won't be seeing my business in the future, nor can I in good conscious recommend it to my colleagues, friends, or even strangers.

Reviews.Title: “A Unique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmacdow
Reviews.Content: The Admiral Fell Inn is not like any other hotel. Its more akin to a very lrge B&B because its quant and cosy. The decor is unique and reminicent of turn of the century furnishings and they have a cute little haunted house tour. Its definitely a refreshing to stay at a place that is not a chain hotel. Overall its a cute hotel with a Baltimore flair to it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MandyB13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend and the location is great. Fell's Point is an awesome place for bar hopping and the restaurants are good. The price is a bit pricey, but Baltimore isn't cheap. Not bad, would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip and perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: scogil
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location for nightlife and sightseeing! Great customer service. We traveled for my husband's bday and they gave us a great room with a jacuzzi! Comfortable, clean, and fabulous customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Uniquely Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: metrognomicon
Reviews.Content: This place is a great find -- small and personal, exceptionally friendly staff, neat decor, in a great area to explore. The tie-ins to the neighborhood's maritime history are fun, especially the biographical plaques outside each room that tell a little bit about prominent figures in Baltimore and Maryland history.

Reviews.Title: “The most memorable stay ever at a hotel as well as one of the most fun nights of my life!”
Reviews.Author: hhoiler
Reviews.Content: I called last minute & Dorien Murphy was the best help I've ever had. He made me feel wanted, special, our stay was fabulous, and the entire staff took excellent care of us. WE WILL BE BACK!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, attentive staff, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mamapp520
Reviews.Content: This hotel definitely exceeded my expectations! The location is awesome, as it's right next to the square in Fell's Point. One of my few complaints is the noise; if you have a room that faces the square (as I did), the noise is audible through the walls. Nothing too annoying though. Dorian was at the front desk when I arrived, and was not only extremely attentive to me, but to the guest checking in before me! He was so kind as to upgrade my room, which made my stay that much more memorable. My second (and last) complaint is about the jacuzzi tub; there is only an old, rubber stopper to hold the water in, and it didn't really work. Other than that, the room was clean, staff was attentive and helpful, and the hotel is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay of the year!”
Reviews.Author: Danyette60811
Reviews.Content: A few of my sorority sisters and I took a trip down to fells point and decided to stay the night at the Admiral Fells Inn in fells point. The stay was impeccable. The rooms were beautiful and one employee by the name, Dorien was absolutely amazing. He treated us as if we were family he was very nice and helpful. He provided us with information on the area and enlighten us on the "hot spots" of the area. Needless to say, our stay was incredible thanks to Dorien. My sisters and I will not think twice about visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Attend to my every need!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cee2005
Reviews.Content: When me and my husband arrived at the hotel we were greeted with honor and respect. The manager Mr. Dorien Murphy also made us feel welcomed i never walked into a hotel where the manager introduces his self with out someone asking for them... he made sure that the staff made us feel well at home. And the location is just so beautiful.... love it love it love it.... i would totally recommend this hotel to everyone of my friends and family..... i would like to thank the manger and staff... I hope to stay again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: cbcbcbcb0
Reviews.Content: Admiral Fell Inn is the perfect place to stay in Baltimore. It is conveniently located on the harbor and is easy to get to. The room I stayed in was beautiful and the balcony had great views of the sunset and overlooked the harbor. The hotel staff was excellent, and they were very friendly and helpful. I enjoyed my stay at Admiral Fell Inn and I look forward to staying there again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Night out with my Sorors”
Reviews.Author: 60811Billie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! My sorors and I had a wonderful time as soon as we stepped foot in the foyer. Check in was a breeze and we went into our wonderful rooms with beautiful canopy beds and a breathtaking view of the city. At one point our room did get a bit chilly but an employee, Dorien Murphy, quickly bought up a space heater and extra blankets and ensured us that if we needed anything else to just give him a call (an offer we took him up on until his shift was over..lol..). The service was great and they even offered a ghost tour of the hotel. Its location is great its in Fells Point with great food and fun a couple of feet away. Its in the middle of convenient shopping and lots of fun!

Reviews.Title: “25th birthday was a blast at the Admiral Fells”
Reviews.Author: MissLucky83
Reviews.Content: My 25th birthday was a blast. We decided to stay at the Admiral Fells since we saw a good deal on Groupon. When we arrived the hottie at the front desk (I hope he's not embarrassed. He knows who he is.) checked us in quickly and oriented us with the bars in the area. We settled into our room and we loved it. It has so much class. We then had a few cocktails in Adela (the hotel restaurant) to start our tour of fells point (which really reminds me of Adams Morgan in DC) Afterwards, Dorien took a picture with us and recommended his favorite bar, then called his friend at Meze Restaurant so my girlfriends and I could enjoy more drinks at their bar. They were really booked but he made sure we had the entire bar to ourselves. What service! After a night of partying we returned to our rooms and slept like drunken babies. When we checked out, Rachel helped us with cabs to the train station. The service was so quick and responsive, I will definitely return to the Admiral Fells when I come back to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel provides history, a great location, and luxury!”
Reviews.Author: watts0925
Reviews.Content: I have never been around more friendly staff in a cozy hotel that provided a real sense of luxury and history combined with a fantastic neighborhood. Bertha's Restaurant is unique, serves great food and is literally a few steps away from the hotel. The shops were interesting - packed full of unique items and kind, helpful workers. This area, Fells Point, is a small Georgetown! I highly suggest all give the hotel and the area a try!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel with AWESOME staff!”
Reviews.Author: TierraChanel
Reviews.Content: I was planning a quick romantic get-away and needed a hotel. I did have reservations somewhere else and I was feeling ok about them. But then, the Groupon Gods smiled on me and offered this beauty of a hotel for all of $62 a night. Score! So I bought the Groupon and cancelled my other reservations. Looking on Yelp, I was a bit apprehensive. But I also know that some people just don't Yelp nicely because they're jerks. My good experience with this place started even BEFORE we got there. Kimber, my Harbor Magic Experience Specialist, was very knowledgeable and helpful when it came to planning my trip. She recommended restaurants, told us about parking and was very prompt in getting back to me when I had questions about anything. We arrived at the hotel. Though its in the heart of Fell's Point, near the bars, its not close enough to where you'd hear any riff raff. We don't like riff raff. We were greeted by Dorian, a very professional front desk person. He took care of us, ensuring that the feather pillows I wanted were in the room when I arrived. We got to the room and it was so nice! This hotel has so much charm and character! Each of the rooms has a name and a story behind it. It was a spacious room with a very comfy bed. The bathroom had its requisite soaps and shampoos and such and they were actually good products. Kimber had sold me on a gift certificate to go to one of their restaurants. $40 for $50 worth of food. Not a bad deal. So I did it. We went to Pizzazz. Bad deal. Experience was so terrible that we only got $29 worth of food, making the certificate pointless. I called back to the hotel and told them about that so they could take the certificate off my bill. They were all so nice! Dorian handled the situation like a pro! Wait, it gets better. Because of my situation with the restaurant, Dorian and Hakeem gave me a $50 certificate to the hotel for the next time I wanted to come back. I was impressed with the professionalism of the staff and the overall look and feel of the hotel. Because we enjoyed our stay so much, we're now looking for reasons to go to Baltimore for an overnight stay. Thank you, Admiral Fell Inn staff, for making my experience so good! (This review also appears on Yelp and Facebook)

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could tell you .... they moved our reservation without telling us!”
Reviews.Author: chr15ras
Reviews.Content: I had a Priceline reservation at this hotel for Dec. 5, which I had made three months earlier. My boyfriend and I planned all of our Baltimore activities around the Fell's Point location, and were looking very forward to our stay at the quaint, historic inn. When we tried to check in at 7 pm, we were told our reservation had been moved to their sister hotel, Pier 5 -- a much bigger, more corporate hotel in a less desirable location. When I complained to the desk clerk, I was told there were business travelers traveling together and all had to stay at the same hotel. In other words, I wasn't as important as they were (and was probably paying less), so I was booted. The desk clerk assured me Priceline was supposed to have called me to let me know of the change. When I followed up with Priceline, they had no record of the change. I called Admiral Fell again to speak with a manager. I was told the managers were all in a meeting and would get back to me. Needless to say, I never heard anything back. Is that any way to do business?

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, unique hotel, great location, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: eecolson
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel because it did not look like every other hotel in the world. The furnishings are classic and beautiful and create a refined atmosphere without being stuffy. The location in Fell's Point is ideal--in the middle of some great restaurants, pubs, and shops. The hotel is connected to a pretty French cafe with tasty pastries and good coffee. The staff was genuinely friendly, efficient, and helpful and made me feel comfortable and welcome.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Place”
Reviews.Author: tyoung3
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent a night here in November and loved the accommodations and staff. We had a fantastic local drink with Steven, who told us some great history of the town and stories of the ghosts that "haunt" the inn. The front desk staff, Dorian and David were awesome as well. They were extremely personable and knowledgeable about the area attractions, directing us to a great place for dinner and another great place to get drinks and snacks. Overall, the Inn was awesome and I look forward to my next trip to Baltimore, where we can stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “High Class”
Reviews.Author: mjmtrip
Reviews.Content: We were treated like royalty. Hotel and rooms were beautiful!! Great location for a night out at Fells Point.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: nadine732
Reviews.Content: I planned a slumber party for my 12 year old daughter. She and a few friends, inlcuding out dog, stayed the night. The girls enjoyed the location and the comfortable accomodations. We all had a wonderful time. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Way Beyond Any Of My Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Fouts_Realty
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had never been to Baltimore before and to be completely honest, it was not a destination of choice prior to this stay! My wife had a day long appointment at Johns Hopkins. We did quite a bit of research online trying to find a nice place to stay, since we have had our share of not so great experiences at some "high end" hotels. We actually decided to stay at the Admiral Fell Inn for 3 nights and take some time to see the area after our research uncovered some areas of interest around there. After our 8 hour drive, I was hoping for the best. As we pulled up to the Valet, which we had already expected to pay for, the valet told us that the open space behind us (right in front of the hotel) was a metered space that only needed 2 more hours until the hours were over and that would save me quite a bit for that night alone. This was the beginning of a wonderful stay. he unloaded our vehicle and quickly headed to our room. At check in, the host quickly got us going as he could see that we were tired. He gave a couple of quick suggestions and we headed to the room with high hopes again. We were in the 'Smith' room (395). We opened the door to find a very graciously sized room with a quite alley view (which we requested). With huge smiles on our faces, we rested up for a couple of hours. The bed was very comfortable and the linens were clean and of good quality. That evening we headed out for a bit to eat and didn't have to go far to find a lot of great choices. Throughout our stay, the host was very informative of great places to eat and great things to do. He didn't only recommend the typical "tourist" spots, but recommended some great local establishments that we were very pleased by. He also helped us save a lot of time and money with the various deals that he was able to get us through the connections that the hotel has. The connected Meli Restaurant had some wonderful pastries each morning and Jimmy's Diner across the court had a great diner breakfast. I have to say that of all the hotels that we have stayed at though our years of travel, due to the service, area, and accommodations this stay honestly ranks up there with some of the resorts that we have paid 5 times as much to stay at! We are already looking forward to future trips to the area. Also, if you are traveling to the area with your four legged friends, make sure you find out about the offerings. We boarded our dog for our trip. If we had known how pet friendly this area was beforehand, we surely would have brought him with us! Thank you to all the Admiral Fell Inn staff that made this "medical" trip one of the best we've ever had. You are all awesome and deserve the best!

Reviews.Title: “Don't get a room across from Leadbetters or near the elevators !”
Reviews.Author: dmacart
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a bad experience. -Leadbetters pub across from our room played booming live music until 2:00 a.m., Guest Services has complimentary "ear plugs" but there were none left for us- wonder why ?? Obviously a persistent problem affecting many guests. -The front desk "checked" our bags them left them in the front lobby where anyone could have accessed our travel documents or luggage contents -Restaurant Manager was incredibly rude, staff told us check out time was noon and my card shut down access to the room at 11:00 a.m. - they could do nothing right.

Reviews.Title: “We truly enjoyed our stay at the Admiral Fell Inn!”
Reviews.Author: jeggert1995
Reviews.Content: The staff was courteous and very friendly. They were able to help us navigate the area and even made dinner reservations for us! We enjoyed our stay and will certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointment of Historic Proportions”
Reviews.Author: BHE713
Reviews.Content: This hotel has history and location going for it. But that's it. We went to a wedding there. We had a difficult time making the reservation/reaching anyone we could talk with (first clue), but ultimately found a great rate ($119) with special discounts and booked a Saturday night en route to a Florida vacation. Upon arrival, no hotel staff was available for the valet parking, or to help us with luggage. The reception desk couldn't find our reservation (even though we had a confirmation number), and eventually said they had expected us Friday night for two nights, so had canceled our reservation. Fortunately (?) they still had the room available. But told us the rate was $159, and if we didn't accept it they couldn't check us in. We were running late for the wedding, so chose to sign for the room and deal with the mix-up later. We carried our luggage and hanging clothes to the room (still no one offered to help), and checked in to the Walters Room. The room was next to the elevator, and the bed in the narrow room was pushed up against the wall. So all night we heard the elevator cables, and one of us had to crawl over the other to get out of bed. The shower was in a jacuzzi tub with a cheap plastic handheld shower head that was affixed to the wall. There are lots of great hotels in Baltimore, and if you have your heart set on Fells Point, go to Henderson's Wharf. The Admiral Fell Inn would be better if it actually "fell in" to the harbor!

Reviews.Title: “Daughter's Dream Wedding”
Reviews.Author: powerswedding
Reviews.Content: What a perfect venue for a wedding.! The staff and wedding planners, Christine and John were the absolute best. Christine's recommendations were perfect. The staff went out of their way to accomodate our every wish. The wedding ceremony at the Harbour Pier went off without one single hitch, despite the fact the city was flooded the night before. The food was five star quality, the reception presentation was amazing, reception staff were polite and accomodating. Donna, who handled the bridal suite, knew just what to do to make the evening so much more romantic. Even a week after the event, working with the accounting department was a pleasant experience. The most heart warming event ----other than the actual wedding ceremony itself : The Blanket . Thanks to Jacquine, and Marsha (my daughter's new mother-in-law) , the lost baby blanket is back home safe and sound. After all, what bride could start her first weeks of marriage without her original baby blanket ? Thank you everyone who worked that weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chs11
Reviews.Content: Superb location for eating at great restaurants within walking distance-1-5 blocks from hotel! Also within walking distance to the Inner Harbor (~7 blocks) and Fitness center(4-5 blocks). Felt reasonably safe walking within a 5-10 block radius with one other person or in a group up to @ 9 pm when there were yellow jacketed security persons walking about or on segways. But do take the usual safety precautions. Hotel was very clean. Staff friendly and responsive. Rooms clean but had a "worn" look. Price affordable. Plean to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful nostalgic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: donald53
Reviews.Content: We stayed at other hotels in the Inner Harbor. We definitely love the Admiral Fell hotel much better. It is a step back in time with its accommodations and professional staff. The minute we took a step onto the cobblestone streets with its quaint shops , bistros and seafood we knew we would be back. You can't go wrong with this hotel

Reviews.Title: “We had an amazing night in historic Fells Point!”
Reviews.Author: rzissel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have lived in the city of Baltimore for the past fifteen years and Fells Point is one of our favorite neighborhoods. We have two young children, who spent the night with their grandparents while we snuck away for a night out. It was a belated anniversary gift and we had talked about doing it for years. The Admiral Fell Inn is beautiful and perfectly located in the heart of Fells Point. When you walk in, you feel like you are walking back in time. The staff was extremely friendly and attentive in a laid back way. We had a wonderful time and plan on making it an annual trip.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T SAY I DIDN'T WARN YOU!”
Reviews.Author: tempi72
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Admiral Fell Inn for a business trip with my entire office of about 35 people. My husband and baby travelled with me. The hotel advertises that no two rooms are alike. True, because each room is painted a completely different color of whatever cheap paint was on sale at the hardware store. My room was painted cotton candy pink. Others were neon green, purple, etc. Their was a hole in my wall. Windows were painted shut. Tiles were loose on the bathrrom floor. the carpet was stained and very dirty. The desk chair was broken. Basically, this was Motel 6 caliber for a higher price. I called in advance to ask about a crib and rocker and was assured they'd have both waiting for me. I asked that they notifiy me if they weren't available so I could bring my own. I received no notificaion, and surprise...no rocker or crib when I got there. Upon check in, the desk clerk was incredibly rude. Borderline obnoxious. She was about 20 and clearly had her mind elsewhere, as was demonstrated when her boyfriend meandered in to ask when she could take a lunch break. This was far from the worst of it. Some of the other reviews mention how quiet it is...SO WRONG! 100% of my coworkers had problems sleeping because of the two busy streets and because of the bar that is on the backside of the hotel. That covers the 4 sides of the building, so there is no way to get away from the noise. Not only did I not sleep, but neither did my baby! Sadly, this is still not the worst of it. I was playing on the floor with my baby, in our room, when a mouse crawled out into the middle of the room and simply watched us. As my husband got near him, he didn't run. He didn't budge. Later as I walked downstairs to a work mtg, there was yet another mouse in the hall! Still not the worst part. At dinner in the hotel, one mouse was seen crawling out from the buffett table and another climbed onto the desert table! the next day, my boss reported a mouse in his room . Yes, I understand that old buildings have mice, etc. but this was a rodent INFESTATION. More importantly, it was clear that the hotel was doing nothing about the problem and the mice clearly were not afraid of humans and had been there some time. The one good thing I can say about this hotel is that their food was wonderful, although now I worry about the sanity of the kitchen knowing how many mice they had! On a final note, they misquoted their parking fee by a large amount - our staff only learned the accurate fee upon checkout!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Villasmart
Reviews.Content: The Admiral Fell in Fell's Point, a quaint area of Baltimore on the water, is a gem. The staff is so accommodating, just ask and they take care of you. We wanted to go to a movie and thought we would be late, but they called their free shuttle and we were there in plenty of time. Fell's Point is full of restaurants of all price ranges and it is a fun place to just wander and take in the ambiance of the area. The Inn is well decorated in the time period it was built. A couple of nights a week they have a wine reception.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! The Admiral Fell Rocks!!"”
Reviews.Author: Bibi_Burke
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Admiral Hotel as it was convenient to my brother's wedding on a farm in Randallstown, MD. There was also a group rate, which was a nice incentive to stay there. Upon arrival, we were checked in quickly by very courteous and friendly front desk personnel. The room was beautiful and spotless. My dog liked it too! The Admiral Fell is pet friendly so if you plan on bringing your dog, just let them know. There is a small business center in the lobby where you can check your email, etc. which is very convenient. My husband used it and was happy it was available (it's free). I was only in the room to change for the wedding and did not get back til late that night. The bed was huge and comfortable. I was exhausted and had a wonderful, relaxing nights sleep on that bed from heaven! The next morning, we needed a little extra time past the 12:00 p.m. checkout and it was graciously given. I had not really thought of Baltimore as a weekend destination but after staying at the Admiral Fell and having the chance to do a little walking around the area (harbor - gorgeous!), I definitely want to return!

Reviews.Title: “For those who like the historic but also like to be comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: brooklyn59
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Admiral Fell Inn tired and anxious as we were taking our first child to college in the area. Due to time constraints we had to have some expensive computer equipment shipped to the hotel which made me a bit nervous. However all worries melted away when we walked in and as soon as I said my name a smiling and very professional person behind the desk immediately knew who I was, had the packages in a secure place and gave them to me. Everything was uphill from there as far as feeling comfortable, relaxed, and most welcomed. Staff was helpful and friendly without being in your face pushy. It was very genuine. I loved the history of the place and the inn was clean and beautiful and the surrounding area was old and fun and full of life. Staying here made an emotional time turn into a lovely family get away. I'd go back again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: CTPope
Reviews.Content: It was very relaxing. The wine tasting and the ghost tour was very nice

Reviews.Title: “Only Harbor Magic property to stay in”
Reviews.Author: Bethaf
Reviews.Content: In researching Inner Harbor hotels, Harbor Magic appealed to me namely because of their arrangement with MAC Wellness (stellar health club with great salt water pool complex). Initially I thought I'd prefer Pier 5, but found a better rate at the Admiral Fell. Fate was good to us. The Admiral Fell is lovely if you like historic properties--for us the location was great. Traveling without children, we enjoyed the night life in Fells Point...not touristy but friendly and fun. The hotels have a shuttle that connects the three for guests, which gives a nice free way to get around key points in the Inner Harbor. The drivers are very nice, and we waited no longer than 15 minutes for a ride. The shuttle also goes to Johns Hopkins. The Inn itself was quiet, though, we elected for an interior room to help ensure a good night's sleep. One annoying thing was that housekeeping knocked on our door as early as 8am. When we asked them to come back, they left our door unlatched, and we were reawakened by a helpful neighbor who informed us that our door was not secured. The front desk staff (Rachel) was perfunctory. I would not stay at Pier 5. We went in a few times to call the shuttle. The lobby is strangely decorated and oddly vacant. I don't think I ever saw anyone at the front desk. One evening we attempted to eat at their Tuscan Grill. It was about 9pm on the Sunday before Labor Day. We were ignored for several minutes until someone begrudgingly greeted us. Despite the live music and full deck, the waitress seemed to plead with another staff member to turn us away because the kitchen was closing in 30 minutes. When she was told to seat us, she threw one menu (there were two of us) on a table without word or even looking back to see if we had followed her. That set enough of a tone, and we left without ordering food. Again fate smile upon us and we ended up at Talara and had a thoroughly great experience at a place that appreciated our patronage. All said and done, there are benefits to staying at a Harbor Magic property, but I'd suggest avoiding Pier 5. The Admiral Fell is nice but I doubt it's terribly kid friendly, nor is the location. For couples or singles, I think it's fine. FYI the Hilton Garden Inn has the same MAC benefit.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place for a wedding, we had wonderful service, a great reception”
Reviews.Author: TerryAnn059
Reviews.Content: "A class act" This hotel lived up to seventy out of town guests requirements not one complaint to the Mother of the Bride. My daughter wedding was coordinated by Christie and she took care of everything a very calm influence answered questions and help us all navigate the "out of town" wedding details. Donna the brides personal attendant provided by the hotel was extraordinary. The rooms were clean, well appointed, comfortable and spacious for a historic building. The location was great in that the guest could walk to shop, seek entertainment and lots of restaurant choices. I would like everyone to know the front desk, bell hop, and managers assisted in so many ways, they always had a pleasant attitude and smile for everyone. As guest left that weekend "Best Wedding Ever" repeated over and over. The only aside I have is street noise on rooms facing the main thoroughfare so if you need quiet ask for a room to the back of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: cap249
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently traveled to Baltimore to visit colleges with my daughter. We decided to make a mini vacation out of it and were planning to stay at the Inner Harbor. I was somewhat overwhelmed at all the hotels at the Inner Harbor and was not sure I wanted to stay so close to all the hustle and bustle. We were fortunate enough to come upon the quaint neighborhood of Fells Point, just a water taxi ride away from the Inner Harbor. There we found the Admiral Fell Inn. It was perfect. Wonderful cozy rooms, steps away from the water taxi that can take you to the Inner Harbor, Fort McHenry, and other interesting places. The Admiral Fell Inn sits right in the heart of Fells Point, an historic neighborhood with quaint shops, restaurants and bars. My whole family loved it! We'll definitely stay there the next time we head to the Baltimore area.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has a bed and breakfast feel”
Reviews.Author: LAZYAACRES
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. The staff was great. Location is perfect.The water taxi right near was a great way around the city. Free Internet. Lots of good restaurants all around us.

Reviews.Title: “We will NEVER stay in this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: robnjenn05
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the middle of a “party central”. There is a bar on either side and below the hotel. The suite we stayed in is on the corner and all the walls and windows let us hear everything going on outside. Both children were awakened by the loud party atmosphere and traffic. There were horns beeping, motorcycles, loud music and loud drunks. This kept us up until almost 2 in the morning…it was an awful night for us and our two children (4 & 1). The manager, Alex, did nothing other than say he was sorry. The room we stayed in ended up costing $300 after all the taxes and added costs were paid. Need less to say we will never stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: benas
Reviews.Content: We arrived and the check in was smooth and the people behind the desk were very welcoming. The hotel had a very interesting layout with corridors going left and right and a small set of stairs every so often. The room was a good size with two four poster beds. Everything seemed clean. The only problem I had was the location. It was a bit out of the way of the centre however it didn't take that long to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: DEW47
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Admiral Fell are the most friendly and helpful. They greet you as you enter the lobby and offer to help with anything and everything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, superb staff!”
Reviews.Author: KMencotti
Reviews.Content: Prior to taking a cruise to the Bahamas, my granddaughter and her mother spent the night at the Admiral Fell Inn in the Fells Point section of Baltimore. Upon our arrival, the Staff made every effort to make our stay enjoyable and simple. The terrific Stay and Cruise package was an excellent value! The location couldn't be better! A large plaza is right outside the front door, the water taxis are a stone's throw away, and you are surrounded by historic buildings, wonderful restaurants and funky shops. The desk staff was extremely helpful, the parking valet went "the extra mile" to help me, and the shuttle service to the Carnival pier was friendly and courteous. Check out the delicious pastries in the attached coffee shop! Our only "complaint" was the presence of some noisy patrons in the hallway at night (not the hotel's fault) and some strange items discovered under the bed. In no way did these detract from the overall experience of a night at the Admiral Fell Inn. If you are there on a Saturday, by all means take part in the (free) evening historical tour

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: cdctosan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we were cruising out of Baltimore Harbor and the Admiral Fell offers a Cruise and Park package - you can park for free during your cruise if you stay the night before. Even without that perk, it"s a great place. A quaint but upgraded inn at Fells Point, in Baltimore's historic Inner Harbor.Its a melding of 8 buildings dating from 1790s to 10 years ago. All clean quiet and upgraded. Very helpful professional staff who go out of their way for you. Our package had a coupon for a breakfast in the nice cafe on the first floor. The whole area is very picturesque and interesting, with narrow streets, old townhouses and shops to explore. Our rooms were very nice, good bedding, nothing "historic" about the plumbing.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service, great location at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: smlri
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Baltimore with friends for a sporting event and stayed at the Admiral Fell. The location was perfect-right in the middle of a great area filled with shops and restaurants. It was also right across from the water taxi, so there was easy access to all of the harbor front activities-not that we used it, because the hotel had a shuttle which not only took us to the game, but also came back and picked us up when it was over! The staff was excellent and although our room was a bit on the small size, it was clean and comfortable. Can't wait to come back again next year!!

Reviews.Title: “What a great staycation!”
Reviews.Author: Steelers6burgh
Reviews.Content: We decided to catch a concert at Pier 6 on Sunday 8/1 and figured we'd make a "staycation" out of it by spending the night in Fells Point. The Admiral Fell Inn was situated in a perfect location to everything we wanted to do/see. They are also associated with the Pier 5 hotel so we were able to take advantage of shuttle service to and from the concert as it was right next to the Pier 5 hotel. The Admiral Fell Inn is historic in both its look and feel. Our room was fantastic and overlooked Thames Street. A lot of other reviewers said not to get a room there as the noise from the street level was bad - it wasnt during our stay. The room had a King size bed and flat screen TV which was nice. The sink in the bathroom was a HUGE pedastool sink and I mention this because Im used to the dinky standard sinks in hotel rooms - so it was a cool change of pace - it wasnt your standard hotel bathroom - well except for the phone in there - which I'll never understand!! While a bit pricey the hotel offered a "goverment" rate to state employees which knocked about $20 off the bill - which was nice as that helped pay for the valet parking. The government rate also included a continental breakfast at Meli located off the hotel lobby. It was more food than two people could consume and wonderfully delicious. Everyone that we interacted with at the hotel was nice, pleasant and went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. We'd definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !!!!”
Reviews.Author: MooLWC
Reviews.Content: My family attended a wedding that was held on the fifth floor of the Admiral Fell Inn on Aug. 7, 2010. The food and drinks were fantastic, great views of the Baltimore, MD habor. Thanks to a great staff and servers everyone had a wonderful time! A special thanks to Xsar and Donna the servers for table 5.

Reviews.Title: “I thought I was making a good choice, but boy was I wrong.”
Reviews.Author: Jenae14
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, I will give it that. I understand it is in the heart of Fells Point and it will be loud until about 2-2:30am, what i was not expecting was to be woken up at 3am to people out in the alley screaming, yelling, blaring music until I finally called the front desk and asked them politely to do something about it, finally about 20 minutes later, around 4:00am I was able to sleep.We stayed in the Kirk Room; the room was not clean what-so-ever. There were hairs everywhere in the bathroom, and through-out the room. There was a humongous stain on the love seat couch, and when I turned it over there were more stains on the other side. The room to my opinion needs to be repainted everywhere, getting rid of the marks on all of the walls and also change the color from the hideous pink. The Internet was not working the entire time we were there and after calling the front desk asking why we could not enjoy a movie from your Admiral Fell Inn channel she just said to try it again a little later, which later must have been after we left. Also upon arriving we went to put some things in the fridge and found a god awful smell coming from it and mold inside and also realizing it wasn't even plugged in. Little things like this should not be overseen, it's little things like this that makes the list of why i would never want to stay here again longer and longer. Last but not least I was very disappointed in the fact that the price I was shown online making the reservation and the price we received on our bill the morning of our departure were not the same. The price the website submitted to us was $251 and some odd cents, making our room rate $209 + tax, the bill showed it as $239 + tax. I honestly wanted to do nothing more then make a huge scene downstairs when leaving because i was so disappointed in our stay, but my boyfriend would not let me, he just wanted to leave the hotel and never come back. I hope what all I have mentioned you take in mind, I work at a bed & breakfast in my hometown area and I would be appalled if I worked at a place like the Admiral Fell.

Reviews.Title: “Great dog-friendly hotel in superb location!”
Reviews.Author: anah1717
Reviews.Content: I chose the Admiral Fell Inn for a last-minute getaway with the hubby and our dog. We arrived and were warmly greeted, and were able to check in early. Front desk staff very friendly and were able to valet park my car quickly. I was also given directions to a special book store I wanted to visit and to the Otakon convention. The room we had was a good size, with a decent bathroom, and plenty of room for dog's bed and her food bowls. Very comfy bed for us too! Hotel had a ghost tour but we did not have time to join it. The only thing I did not like was the rather garish green carpet in the hallways. Overall, great hotel in Fells Point histoic district, within walking distance of lots of shops, pubs and restaurants. Perfect for a weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but horrible event/banquet service, even worse billing department!”
Reviews.Author: Jmb618
Reviews.Content: I had my wedding reception at this hotel, and I have a lot of mixed feelings about the place. The location is excellent, and the hotel is beautiful and clean. Some of my guests were placed in rooms that they described as extremely small, loud, and containing broken furniture, but once they asked to be switched all was taken care of promptly. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. The planner assigned to me for the wedding ("Catering Manager") Christina was helpful and always responded to my quesitons in a timely manner. Now for the bad parts. We were given a package with many free perks which seemed wonderful at first until they never quite materialized. Our guests were to recieve gift baskets in each room, but only the guests arriving the day of the event recieved them. I had previously asked if early arrivers would recieve them too and was told yes, but it never happened. On the day of the event the ceremony went well and we set up correctly. For the actual reception the "Bridal Hostess" that I was supposed to have never showed up. The banquet staff was rude and not helpful. The banquet staff even went as far as trying to hurry me into cutting the cake early even though a schedule had previously been established. The food was not nearly as good as the tasting we had sat for. A lot of the food came out of the kitchen late, not everything was out when I went to get my plate. We were given a free breakfast for up to 20 guests. I even paid (quite a steep price) to add 10 people to this event. When I got there there was no food left to eat, and from what I understand when there was food there it was quite slim in choice (Only bagels, chocolate chip scones and coffee and tea). There is no way that they included enough food for the amount of people I paid extra for. After the event I have discovered many billing problems. There was an over charge of $800 that I had to dispute at length with the hotel to resolve, something that they ended up calling a small decimal point error. I'm not sure about you but to me an $800 error is huge. Now even a month after the event I am still trying to work out other billing mistakes. It makes me very sad that all of these bad things turned my wedding reception experience with the hotel into somewhat of a nightmare. All in all the event was just ok, but the headaches I am still trying to deal with now are driving me crazy. Imagine if I had not looked so thoroughly at the bill, I would easily be paying them $1,000 over what should have been charged. Very disappointing the hotel is so cute, and I really thought everything would be wonderful going into this : ( I would love to go back and stay as just a guest, but I'm not sure I should be giving them business at this point. I would definately never have an event here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, small and very friendly inn.”
Reviews.Author: marty41Florida
Reviews.Content: Wanting a special treat for my granddaughter, I investigated the Inner Harbour of Baltimore because of her love of aquariums. I could not be happier about our experience at the Admiral Fell Inn. Many thanks to Rachel who made our stay quite special.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: limegreengal
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a weekend at the Admiral Fell where my daughter got married. The wedding planner (Christine) was fabulous, and the staff at the desk (Darian and Rachel) were helpful and friendly. Rooms were all unique, clean, and beautiful. The wedding on the Pier was a dream, and the banquet food to die for. Minor issues were attended to quickly and it was a great experience for all. Nice job guys.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay on the Thames St. side”
Reviews.Author: cheeze
Reviews.Content: Nice, quaint hotel. Clean with friendly staff, but do not take a room overlooking Thames even if on the top floor. The hotel restaurant and bar puts tables on the sidewalk under the window and the party goes on until the wee morning hours.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at Admiral Fell Inn”
Reviews.Author: cpt55
Reviews.Content: I thought the front office staff was courteous and welcoming, and the building was beautiful and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “If you ever go to Fells Point you have to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Suzanimal34
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Admiral Hotel in Fells Point. I have stayed at other hotels in the area and I loved this place.The staff was so very helpful and the room was beautiful. I loved the view & will make this place the only place to stay in Baltimores Fells Point...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great atmosphere, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: yuckyyank
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were warmly welcomed by the staff, and were given many free drink/food coupons to use during our stay. The location is central to all the action in Fell's Point, and a water taxi is a block away if you care to venture to Inner Harbor, Canton, or Federal Hill. The historic inn is charming.

Reviews.Title: “Admiral Fell is consistently great.”
Reviews.Author: jesuisperdu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Admiral Fell while my husband was at Johns Hopkins Hospital. Our adult kids were with me. The hotel could not possibly have been better. Our room was great, the staff was extremely helpful and they were available for any concern. The shuttle to/from Johns Hopkins was appreciated. We have stayed at the Admiral Fell many times over the last 25 years and always come back. Our kids gave us a gift of a weekend there this past Christmas. Fells Point is an eclectic, wonderful neighborhood with great restaurants and different shops. We would absolulety recommend the Admiral for a couple or a family with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Personalized Service”
Reviews.Author: carolinaspy
Reviews.Content: Kevin was diligent in getting me checked-in to a room as quickly as possible even though I arrived several hours early [due to flight timing]. The bell captain, David, helped me with transportation options to various dinner meetings. Jackie and Roland, were efficient shuttle drivers, getting me where I needed to be in a timely manner.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Admiral Fell Inn”
Reviews.Author: jackmaz
Reviews.Content: 9 of us from RI and VA attended a Red Sox/Orioles game on June 5th and stayed at the Admiral Fell Inn. Everything about our trip and stay at the Inn was fantastic. When we checked in the staff could not have been more helpful and pleasant (our rooms were ready even though we checked in at 11 am and the hotel was booked) and mentioned that our rate came with a $9.95 per person fee for amenities that included transporation that would bring us close to Camden Yards. Not only did they drive all 9 of us there but after the game, we called and they came and picked us back up. Perfect! Loved the location in Fells Point with cute shops, restaurants and bars all right outside the Inn. Hakeem at the desk was super friendly and helpful and genuinely made us feel at home and welcome. Rooms were nicely decorated, beds were comfy and perfect for the limited time we spent in them to sleep. Highly recommend Admiral Fell Inn.

Reviews.Title: “To say it is average is being generous...Dirty sheets!”
Reviews.Author: LaurenM25
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed a weekend getaway in Baltimore with my sister and her boyfriend. All four of us stayed at the Admiral Fell Inn, in two separate rooms. The hotel is historic so if you are looking for modern amenities like a fridge or microwave in the room, a fitness center or a pool, this is not the place for you. The Inn is lacking an important amenity that you will notice as soon as you check in - a bell person/valet to help with your bags. When checking in, you have to pull up to the front of the hotel and leave your car while you go inside and look for someone to take it and park it for you. There are also three steps leading up to the hotel lobby. I had to drag my suitcases up these steps - no one was around to offer assistance. Also, because there are no hotel staff outside to greet guests, panhandlers come right up to you - even if you are standing right in the doorway - to ask for money. This happened to me twice in two days. It was the same person both days, and he became rude and pushy the second time asking me for money. I've been to Baltimore before and was prepared to deal with panhandlers, but you want to experience a feeling of safety in and around your hotel. I feel that if they have a door person or valet, it may deter panhandlers from harrassing hotel guests so brazenly. These first turn offs were not too big of a deal, but what I found in the hotel room was more of a problem. Like most people, the first thing I do when I enter a hotel room is check the carpet, sheets, towels, bathroom, etc for cleanliness. Our sheets had several small bloodstains on them. When I went back down to the lobby, I asked the concierge to have housekeeping change the sheets. When we returned to our room later that evening, the top sheets had been changed, but the fitted sheet had not - and this sheet had a visible stain on it.
