I reluctantly slept on the soiled sheet, and the next morning, we left a note for housekeeping to please change the fitted sheet because it was stained. We left a few dollars tip along with the note. Sadly, when we returned to our room later that day, the fitted sheet had not been changed. This was incredibly frustrating, so the next day, we did not leave a tip for housekeeping. On our last day at the hotel, we passed two of the hotel maids as they were cleaning the room next to ours. My husband heard them complain in Spanish about how we had not left them money the previous morning. I found this unbelievable, not only because they assumed we could not understand them, but also because they expected a tip for below-average service. To me, a clean room is an absoulte must when travelling. The lack of cleanliness in this hotel is a deal-breaker for me. It is a shame because the Admiral Fell Inn is in a wonderful location and has a lot going for it. But I would not stay there again, nor would I recommend that anyone else stay there. Baltimore has plenty of other hotel options to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “This is one of my favorite hotels.”
Reviews.Author: cebule
Reviews.Content: The rooms in the hotel are charming.. The location is great, near to the nighlife and stores.

Reviews.Title: “Admiral Fell Inn - perfect”
Reviews.Author: lmderd
Reviews.Content: Recently spent four nights at the Admiral Fell Inn in Fells Point Baltimore. The inn is very beautiful, clean and in an absolutely perfect location near bars, restaurants and the water. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful (we had some reservation issues and they were great at helping straighten things out). I was initially undecided about staying in the inner harbor area or Fells Point and I am so so glad I choose Fells Point. It is a wonderfully vibrant area with small, independent bars and restaurants and has retained it's historical charm (Inner Harbor had ESPNZone, Hooters, Cheesecake Factory etc yuck). highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “ReLAXing Lax (lacrosse) weekend”
Reviews.Author: anonymous32789
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 traveled to Baltimore for the NCAA lacrosse championships over Memorial Day weekend. We booked our hotel through Expedia and when we arrived late at night we learned that Expedia had mistakenly made our reservation for only 2 people instead of 4 and one room with a King was all that was available. Sandy Clark the Manager went to extraordinary lengths to find us 2 rooms for the first night. When we woke the next morning she had placed a personal note under our door that she had arranged for us to be able to move to a room with 2 queen beds for the next 2 nights. The room was very spacious even with the 4 of us in there. The staff was consistently accommodating throughout the weekend. The Inn's amenities and location made for a great weekend. We look forward to returning for the 2011 NCAA lax Championships.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: BillA186
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Admiral Fell Inn at Fells Point for a quick gettaway weekend. It was the perfect place to go for a nice relaxing few days. I really enjoyed the personal touch that the people at the Admiral Fell provide. Right from my call to make a reservation I spoke with Kevin who helped me get my room set up I was made to feel welcome and new I would enjoy our stay. At check in we meet Hakeem who was also a pleasure to work with and helped us get our room and pointed us to a couple nice spots to have a drink and dinner. We will be back to Fells Point and would not think of staying anywhere else but Admiral Fells Inn

Reviews.Title: “Average -- room outdated and unremarkable”
Reviews.Author: lorischwab
Reviews.Content: We wouldn't stay here again. The location was good -- close to restaurants, shopping, and the harbor. But the room looked a little beat up and overall worn. We had a view of the inner courtyard (and trash cans) so can't say there anything memorable or remarkable about the view. The beds were lumpy and uncomfortable. When we were checking out, a gentleman was informing the front desk of a broken "sloping" bed so future guests wouldn't face the same sleepless night he encountered. He received a "We'll let maintenance know sir" reaction rather than an apology or an accommodation of any kind. The breakfast was lame (some bread, sugary cereals, and scrambled eggs). Needless, to say we passed on the "free" breakfast. The unacceptable was the parking. We called ahead to find out where to park with the free parking offer that came with our room rate. The front desk clerk who answered the phone provided the name of a garage so we parked there and walked to the 4 blocks to the hotel. When we got to the hotel, we learned he provided the wrong garage. So we had to move the car. We got a somewhat insincere apology (i.e., visualize a slight shrug of the shoulder and a "Uh, sorry about that." and a "It wasn't me; it was my colleague." Not exactly great customer service, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful and unique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: farahfantastic14
Reviews.Content: Has a wonderful trip to Fells Point thanks to the Admiral Fell Inn. Beautiful hotel with everything you could want at walking distance. The staff was very helpful and kind. Loved our stay and can't wait to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Admiral Fell Excellent Hotel, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: fittcyn
Reviews.Content: My Wife had to go to John Hopkins Hospital for a condition. We are from New Jersey so we asked the hospital for a list of nice hotels in the area. We stayed at the Admiral Fell. A great choice. The Inn itself was very pretty and the room was comfortable and clean. The staff, especially Kevin were wonderful. They also have a shuttle to and from the hospital. The location was great. Right at the harbor with plenty of shops and places to eat. There is a water taxi right their which for ten bucks for the day will take you to different parts of the harbor to sightsee or eat. Definitely a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Service”
Reviews.Author: mln347
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a great weekend at Fell's Point at the Admirial Fell Inn. The staff, room, and experience were exceptional. The location is the best in the Point. Recommended on all levels.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful time and the staff was top notch!”
Reviews.Author: rosiecallaway
Reviews.Content: Thanks for the Historian and his insights along with the young man at the desk that night. I am thinking the historian's name was Steven and was very kind to stay later to tell us the history or the area.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable taste of history with modern conveniences”
Reviews.Author: cwarner
Reviews.Content: What a fine time we had at the Admiral Fell Inn. The staff was consistently courteous and helpful, our room beautiful, and the location is prime with lots of interesting sites and restaurants within walking distance. I would definately stay again- probably next spring!

Reviews.Title: “charming accomodation, convenient locatoin, delightful, courteous staff,”
Reviews.Author: mochabeanmom
Reviews.Content: Referred here by John Hopkins as we were scheduled for an appointment there for my daughter. We couldn't have picked a better location! Though the reason for our visit was stressful, we found the staff to be extremely welcoming and ever so helpful. The location was within walking distance to the harbor, quaint shops and fabulous restaurants. This provided a great distraction while we were dealing with the uncertainty of my daughter's health issues. Alex at the front desk was especially kind for which I am most grateful. The inn itself is beautifully maintained and the rooms were clean and a comfort to retreat to at the end of the day. We will be heading back to Baltimore for a follow up visit and look forward to staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loving Baltimore!”
Reviews.Author: buttons334
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the cruise package. The hotel is very charming and we are now totally in love w/ Baltimore. The staff was sooo helpful. We are not city people...at all, lol. So when I thought we could just drive the 2 miles to Camden Yards for the O's game...the staff very gently informed me that 2 miles, in the city, on a ball game night....would be about a 45 minute drive. They also very kindly explained to me how exactly to get a taxi. What can I say, we seriously don't take taxi's where we live. The room was actually good sized considering the age of the hotel. Now let me say that the hotel is old...if you don't like old, you may not like the hotel. However, we thought it was adorable and had tons of history. We didn't tell our 5 year old about the "haunting" part until the morning after. She promptly asked the front desk staff about it and they gave her a very age appropriate "ghost story" that she just loved. With the cruise and stay, you get a taxi voucher and the staff calls you a taxi. I have to recommend asking for Leroy at Baltimore Taxi (that's the service they use)... he was totally awesome. Picked us up from the cruise and had us back to the hotel (even called to make sure our car would be ready) in lightening speed. My only recommendation is this...realize that Fell's Point is party central...our room faced the road and it was a Sat. night. We heard EVERY band in EVERY bar in a 2 block area. But as soon as last round was called, it became very quiet. We were so excited about our cruise we couldn't sleep anyway so we just stayed up and enjoyed the music. You may want to ask for an interior room though on a weekend. Oh and they valet park your car for free! Yes to us country folk... that was pretty neat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Service, Great Location, Great Property, A Lovely Time”
Reviews.Author: basicbob
Reviews.Content: "Sandy Clark was the best, a real pleasure, who helped me several times with phone reservations and changes, and advice. She deserves a raise. The memory of her showing my daughter the "ghost" in the clock, after we met her in person, will be forever precious. A gentleman at the front desk was kind enough to provide Acquarium passes, and a proper book of ghost stories for us to share in the evenings. I actually asked for this book in error [ it was another hotel that had advertised the book with their stay , during this E.A. Poe event weekend ; oops ] The staff at the desk didnt bat an eye and found one in a closet off the lobby. I didnt realize this till later. Very smooth. Many thanks. We really enjoyed the house ghost tour also, the guide's knowledge and passion for history made it very enjoyable. The shuttle links with the other Baltimore properties were very useful in getting around [ we did not bring a car , a great relief ] We stopped at Pier 5 for Crabby hour and chocolate dessert during our travels, which made us feel more like locals than out of town guests. The staff there was also very welcoming, especially Empress, who treated us to a fun time. I work for Continental Airlines, so have travelled a bit. Most of all, great staff, wonderful hotel, perfect location. Best hotel experience ever. Have never had better customer service at a hotel, from truly nice people. It was just this Dad with his 11 year old daughter, and we made memories to cherish, with the help of the folks at the Admiral Fell. Thank you."

Reviews.Title: “The service was outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: domagnet
Reviews.Content: We went during a rainstorm and spent most of the time in the hotel. When the rain let up just enough, the staff was extremely accomodating and helpful in finding things for us to do. While we were indoors, everyone made a great effort to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable. We highly recommend this hotel, if not for the service alone, but the rest of the hotel is pretty good too!

Reviews.Title: “It was a very quaint and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: townmnagermoorestown
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to find the location of the hotel at such a unique area of Baltimore. It has been many years since I visited Fells Point and the stay here only enhanced my last memories. I was greeted by a genltleman who gave me the run down on parking etc. He offered to handle my bags and my car. Once inside, the check in process was quick and I was up to my unique room in no time. The shape of the room was not typical meaning square but more rectangular with various angles. It overlooked one of the streets with many uniques shops. I was always greeted by someone as I came in to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Snug Harbor”
Reviews.Author: Jamison
Reviews.Content: What miserable weather for a week end get away- torrential down pours with artic blasts coming off the harbor, puddles as deep as lagoons- and Friday five o'clock traffic to boot! Not a very auspicious beginning, but remarkably birghtened stepping into the lobby of the hotel! It was beautiful, inviting and warm. Our check in was handled flawlessy, with genuine civility and an abundance of tips for a fun filled week end. Our room, a suite, which exceeded my expectations, was very lovely with a view of the harbor and very comfortable furnishings. After the hectic ride in, it was ever so nice to have 2 half bottles of wine waitng for us. The weather never improved for us, but we still had a delightful time in Baltimore. The hotel was truly a snug harbor for us as we raced through Fells Point from shop to watering hole to restaurants all within blocks. The complimentary breakfast was really quite good and the servers poised and poite despite the rush. We didn't try the restaurant, but the cocktail lounge was very warm and the service impeccable. All through out our stay, we were delighted by the warmth and concern of ALL staff members, whether desk clerks, housekeeprs or service staff. Going the 'extra mile' just seemed second nature to their professional staff. On our last day, the sun finally broke through and it was VERY hard to leave. We will be back for sure! PS This is the best ever dog friendly hotel ever. Our pooches loved their stay and the welcome they received too!

Reviews.Title: “Great place in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: MitsyAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Admiral Fell Inn was great. The appearance of this historic hotel was appealing, the room was lovely, the beds were very comfortable, and the cleanliness was excellent. The shuttle back & forth to Johns Hopkins OP Center was a terrific help. I will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “This is truly a gem of a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Tosca1946
Reviews.Content: I am so delighted that my daughter chose to have her wedding at this hotel. The wedding arrangements were easy and the wedding was beautiful thanks to all the help we received from the staff. We were able to relax and truly enjoy the day. All our out of town guests raved about the hotel. The hotel accomodated a variety of guests from toddlers to seniors . We were given a wonderful sense of the history of Fell's Point on the ghost walk hosted by the hotel on Friday evening. Later we enjoyed a delicious dinner at the outstanding restaurant Meli's next to the hotel. The day of the wedding, one of the guests needed the services of a dentist and the hotel quickly arranged this. The day after the wedding, the staff helped me comb the wedding reception site for a missing piece of jewelry, which did turn up. Our rooms were comfortable and clean. The staff was outstanding, and the hotel itself was very interesting with historical photos throughout and the historical notes outside each room. Our guests also enjoyed visiting the neighborhood around the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Heartfelt gem for Hopkins patient”
Reviews.Author: JesterMD
Reviews.Content: As a twenty-year resident of the Baltimore area, I specifically chose Admiral Fell Inn for my parents when my father had an appointment at Johns Hopkins Hospital. The East Coast had another snow storm looming and I knew that AFI was literally only one turn off the road from his doctor-- My seventy-two year old father was barely one week in recovery from major heart surgery. The Inn also provides complimentary door to door shuttle service to Hopkins medical campus (and other downtown hot spots) and also special rate packages for Hopkins patients. We could not have been more pleased with my choice. The accomodations were delightful-- a nice change from sterile, big chain hotels. The staff were kind, professional and wonderfully accomodating, particularly the front desk clerk, Alex, who personally took care of my requests instantly despite the late hour. The room was clean, bright, cozy, and very quiet. The bedding was crisp and very comfortable -- my parents slept like a rock. The coffee bistro with fresh, unique pastries, was a true delight. Our dinner at the Mezzi restaurant included an elegant, delicious meal with terrific staff-- they bent over backwards to accomodate my dad's requests. AFI is a true gem in the heart of historic Baltimore. Fells Point is a delight with great restaurants, pubs, and eclectic shops. I highly recommend this wonderful Inn to any aged visitor-- you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful One Night Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: trouble89
Reviews.Content: My husband & I needed a break so we booked a night at the Admiral Fell Inn. The service was great & the Valentine's package that was offered was wonderful! We returned home relaxed and well rested.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: toddheap
Reviews.Content: If you're going out in the Fells Point area, this hotel is right in the heart of the neighborhood. It's very classic, well-maintained, and I'd recommend it highly. I also enjoyed the Mezzi wine bar connected to the lobby. :)

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional weekend visit”
Reviews.Author: Altekameraden
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I stayed at the Admiral Fell Inn while attending a family wedding which was also hosted there. The accommodations were very nice. Historic building and our room had canopy beds which were very comfortable! The staff, particularly the well-attired gentlemen at the front desk, were outstanding and went out of their way to assist with even the smallest request. There are two adjoining restaurants which were also quite nice. Very convenient to Harbor Place and the Fell's Point Historic area has several interesting neighborhood dining and drinking establishments. My wife teaches literature and Edgar Allan Poe is a favorite of hers. So quick side trip to his grave was a must. Wedding and reception on top floor also went very well.

Reviews.Title: “Metal Band at this classy joint??”
Reviews.Author: JeniferCrowl
Reviews.Content: Our band was put up at this hotel on our 1st visit to Baltimore. It was like walking into a page out of a history book! Great rooms! And comes with Ghosts to boot! You'd think a metal band coming into this place would cause a rucus...but the staff was friendly and accommodating and treated us just like everyone else :) Located right on the corner near the waterfront. Close to great little diners (Jimmy's!) and Indie record stores :)

Reviews.Title: “One of my best experiences ever!”
Reviews.Author: ckuser
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Admiral Fell Inn during the worst snow storm in decades. Feb. 5th thru Feb. 7th. 2010. Things were chaotic everywhere, but all of the staff at the Inn was great. My whole family, mom, sisters and our husbands enjoyed every minute of our time there. All of our questions were answered and all of our needs and wants were taken care of. The Inn was quaint, we just sort of lounged around and watched the 3 feet of snow pile up. I recommend this Inn to everyone and I will return for another stay this spring.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Cozy Atomosphere, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lilkathy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Admiral Fell Inn for a wedding we attended there. The wedding ceremony and reception were both held at the Admiral Fell Inn and it was beautiful. They did a great job! The Staff was amazingly friendly and helpful. Our room was very nice with plenty of room for both my husband and I to get ready at the same time without running into each other. The whole atomosphere was cozy and inviting. Plus, you can't beat the location! You are surrounded by all kinds of shops, bars, resturaunts, coffe shops, etc. We are definitely planning on staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service in the snow”
Reviews.Author: Ubiquitinate
Reviews.Content: During the historical snowfalls that Baltimore experienced in February 2010, I was at the Inn with approximately 30 colleagues, and we were all unexpectedly snowed in. We had planned on many meals being outside the hotel, but the snow made it impossible. The staff at the inn were extraordinary in their ability to cater a number of unexpected meals and providing regular breakfasts. The staff is excellent. My only complaint was a lack of closet space in the rooms, it was difficult to hang all my shirts and suits.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay, I would recommend the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: trip1NewJersey
Reviews.Content: Dorien, front desk reception, was great to help book me a cab that could navigate a horrible snow storm. The room was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The staff went above and beyond any expectation.”
Reviews.Author: peachems
Reviews.Content: The Admiral Fell Inn is warm and inviting and has the best staff I have ever encountered. My business group got stranded there during a historical snowstorm and everyone bent over backwards to help us make a stressful situation pleasant. Dorien tirelessly helped me make travel reaarangements and got the group out safe and sound. Barry and his staff madfe sure that our events were wonderful in some very trying circumstances. I have dealt with them many times, but this stay showed real dedication to customers. Thank you for all that you did for us!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, awesome historic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BaltimoreSam
Reviews.Content: Admiral Fell Inn has a perfect location in the heart of Fells Point. We have stayed here many times, and always look forward to our return visit. The hotel is clean and comfortable, the staff is friendly and helpful, and all complimentary toiletries are Earth Friendly!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Tasteful1974
Reviews.Content: While we do not seek out historic hotels, we found the Admiral Fell a great find. The staff from reservations to the desk, bellman and van drivers were friendly and very accommodating. Walking access to shops and restaurants in area was very good. The room was nice, although the bathroom was small. When we return to Baltimore, we shall return to this gem.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond the call of duty”
Reviews.Author: amariacody
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Admiral Fell Inn was amazing. My original room was small and cozy with a jacuzzi tub. It was the perfect size for me. I had a king sized bed with a small couch, flat screen television and internet access. I was able to do my work and relax. My second room (I checked out to return home only to check back in again for one more night due to snow storm) was great! It was like a townhouse with an up and downstairs. It too was cozy with the gas fireplace. Just perfect although when I arrived the hardwood floor had not been mopped. The hotel is surrounded by great restaurants and shops. It is in a very eclectic area. I really appreciated the shuttle service which was free. It saved me from paying for a taxi. What I liked least was the house keeping could have been better. I ate in my room and when my room was cleaned housekeeping left my empty containers and used silverware in my room unmoved from where I left them. The staff was the best part of the trip. David, Dorian, and Kevin were wonderful. They ensured my stay was the best it could have been. Dorian's restaurant and food selection was impeccable. Kevin's travel arrangements from business work site to airport was well coordinated and worry free! David went above and beyond the call of duty the first night I was there by delivering my restaurant ordered (non-room service) dinner to my room. Everyone was very nice and made a potentially unpleasant trip (due to injury) a very pleasant one. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for room in back away frm street ; Very clean; nice staff; quaint; great price and location.”
Reviews.Author: AllanGoRedSox
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights last week, had an amazingly good price combined with airfare from Priceline.com. Never been to Baltimore before. Nice convenient location near many tourist sites in historic Fells Point. Staff helpful; room good & clean. Nicely decorated with old photos and information about old times, which fits into neighborhood. BE SURE TO GET A ROOM THAT IS NOT FACING THE STREET AS AREA IS VERY BUSY AT NIGHT WITH POPULAR RESTAURANTS AND BARS! We did and had no problems. Quibbles: 1) $10 daily 'resort' fee per room which can not get out of, covers usage of 'business center' (two OK pcs in lobby which were not that hard to get onto), free unlimited local/national phone calls (most probably use their cells anyway) & 2 bottles of water & access to a primo fitness center about 15 blocks away. 2) A cigarette hole in comforter cover.

Reviews.Title: “professional/ courteous service provided by Kevin/Dorian”
Reviews.Author: francismu
Reviews.Content: All aspects of our stay/park/cruise package were performed in a timely and thorough manner. People make the hotel. Thanks again to Kevin/Dorian

Reviews.Title: “Not amazing, not terrible.”
Reviews.Author: DBmaniac1
Reviews.Content: We wanted to get away for the weekend for a quiet birthday weekend celebration. Having only one night to get away and relax we wanted a special place that was neat and had some historic elements to it. The Admiral Fells Inn is definitely historic. It was very clean, the staff was pleasant, and our overall experience was average. Fells Point is a very neat place with a lot of quaint shops and taverns, but if you aren't a drinker or are there to simply get away, this is not a place the place to go. We were up half the night due to the amount of foot traffic and loud bar hoppers. Yes, we probably should have done more research, but I will definitely not return to the area for a quiet get-a-way. They did allow our dog to come, which we appreciated. The Inn was fine, but our experience was proved for us to return home more tired than when we left.

Reviews.Title: “Our best get-a-way.”
Reviews.Author: MaryMarg917
Reviews.Content: We live about 25minutes from Baltimore. We love the Admiral Fell Inn for numerous reasons. We like a occasional break from our life. No kids, no doggies, just ourselves. We have traveled all over and have stayed in properties that cost much, much more but you cannot beat the customer service at this lovely inn. The rooms never disappoint. They are all different, but quite elegant in an historic way. We love reading the plaques outside the rooms that describe the person the room was named after. The Ansel Adams photos in the rooms are wonderful. But it is the customer service that shines. Hakeem at the front desk is a really funny, sweet and an efficient guy. Thank you. David, the valet parker (and I suspect he does a lot more than that) is great. Looked out for our needs: cabs, safety and just general directions. Jessica at the front desk as well, was very gracious. She stored our left-over food from the surrounding great restaurants in their refrigerator and David even offered to bring a microwave up to our room to heat them up! The onsite restaurants are stellar. Great food and service. Head to the Admiral Fell Inn and leave your cares behind!

Reviews.Title: “Don't pass up Baltimore's Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: TiaWKnott
Reviews.Content: Oh my gosh, I can't even begin to describe the great time we had at the Admiral Fell Inn.! i decided to stay there with my 12 year old daughter and her two friends to watch the New Year's Eve fireworks and not have to fight traffic in or out of Baltimore. From the moment we walked in the door, Alex was there to answer EVERY question out of the kids' mouths! Later that evening, as the kids were getting antsy, Sandy was there to advise of activities to do! We were catered to like we were the only guests! The next day, Hakeem helped us with our departure and other activities to do, we went to the IMAX and really enjoyed ourselves! Will DEFINITELY visit again! May even make this a new New Year's Eve tradition!

Reviews.Title: “This was by far our best stay when we went to Baltimore!”
Reviews.Author: baltimorefan
Reviews.Content: We truely enjoyed our stay at the Admiral Fell Inn. We love to go to Baltimore for weekends and the location and service that we recieved while there was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodation, great location, great people, great seafood...and more!”
Reviews.Author: ReadingDutchman
Reviews.Content: Our second visit at the AFI and we can't wait to return. We even gave a visit to our daughter and husband for Christmas. We had a great weekend starting at the front door, where Kevin greetedus. Jessica made every bit of our stay more pleasant starting by changing our room to the one we had last year. Dinner at Kali's was amazing. We're still talking about it. This hotel has become one of our favorite escapes. I think we may need to return next year!

Reviews.Title: “The Admiral Fell Inn was a perfect wedding destination hotel”
Reviews.Author: doc1018
Reviews.Content: As an out of town guest of a wedding reception at the Admiral Fell Inn We checked out many hotels in the Baltimore area and decieded to stay there. We had a great experience. The wedding reception was held in the Ballroom and the views were beautiful. the service was very friendly we had a lovely room with a very comfortable bed

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service during the storm of the decade.”
Reviews.Author: saskatonian_in_phl
Reviews.Content: I was extremely impressed by both the hotel and the quality of service. Jessica did a wonderful job of helping us with the challenges posed by the pre-Christmas snow storm. The rooms are charming, each with its own name and story about its namesake. The hotel rooms, halls and lobby feature nautical themed artwork and historic photography of the Fell's Point area in Baltimore. It is located just a few steps away from a wide range of restaurants, shops, and the harbor. We highly recommend this hotel for your next visit to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing Historic Estate right at the harbor of Fells Point!”
Reviews.Author: AmericanConductor
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing Inn located on a corner lot with lots of enterainment and dining to go around! Every price range can be accomidated as well. One of the most dedicated staff members at this Inn is Alex. I wish I had his last name, but I don't. I stayed over Christmas Eve and Christmas day and he was truly exceptional. Take the time and head over! ~Brian

Reviews.Title: “Fells Still Charming through Blizzard at Admiral Fell Inn”
Reviews.Author: britainsangel
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I thought to escape our home in Laurel to visit downtown Baltimore. While passing through Fells Point we wandered into a quaint building amongst bustle of the area which turned out to be a hotel. The charm of Fells Point was equally matched by the antique fixtures and moldings of the hotel. While checking in, a charming young man named Dorian quickly moved our bags from our car and into our room as desk worker Jessica explained the history of the area. We dined at Adelo, a spanish restaurant located at the hotel. Food was great. The next day a blizzard hit baltimore so we left through the middle of it. That wasnt a good idea... well enough rambling. Rooms and service were excellent. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful feel of the oldtime historical hotels”
Reviews.Author: mammam64
Reviews.Content: Admiral Fells Hotel was a hotel that my husband and I both shared our love for. We sat in the room and admired the architecture. We here in the USA have become so accustomed to chain hotels that are generic at best. All new and shiny but with no past, nothing to make you question the time in history and the events that may have transpired at the very hotel we were in. I loved that it was right on the water and loved the quaint little shops that were within walking distance. Everyone at the hotel was kind and friendly and did their jobs in a manner that made you feel like they were friends. A telephone call made to the hotel and a thoughtful employee welcomed us whose last name was Simons. My husband and he shared the same hometown of Washington DC and their chat about events and places was again, like an old friendly chat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Anniversery Getaway”
Reviews.Author: galomax
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Baltimore many times and in many different hotels, but we have finally found our place. The Admiral Fell is in the heart of the Fells Point section of the city which is one of our favorite parts of town. It is within walking distance to at least a dozen or so fun eating and drinking establishments. You are just a short cab ride to the Inner Harbor or Little Italy. The Hotel itself is a really cool old, but very nicely decorated place. I believe it used to be a vinegar factory at one time and it is said to be haunted. We had great time on our 1 night anniversery getaway and will definitely go back. Finally, if you are there, the bell captain, Dorian, is a very nice and helpful young man. Be sure to ask for him.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: pachipper
Reviews.Content: The Admiral Fell Inn is in the heart of Fells Point...an area of great restaurants, fun pubs, etc. It is an historic property and is just a water taxi away from Baltimore's inner harbor, the Orioles and Ravens Stadiums. Make sure you say hello to Hakeem at the front desk. He'll go out of his way to help you.

Reviews.Title: “everything was absolutely perfect!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cjones1200
Reviews.Content: six of us came for a birthday party that was in the same area. we had the valet parking, easy check in, things to do at the hotel, a great shower and a wonderful nights sleep. i cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dee1Dee
Reviews.Content: This is a vintage hotel with a lot of old character. The hotel is designed like a maze with narrow hallways, no map of the floors were posted. Check in was a bit slow, more staff is needed to accommodate busy times. The room and bathroom were clean however they should dust the tops of things and wash the walls and woodwork. The bed was very comfortable but is extremely high, I am short and the step stool was useful. The valet parking was a great help and the valet was very nice. Overnight valet parking was $29.00 plus tax. I did notice a number of the staff did multi-jobs. Dorian who helped us with a key problem at check-in was the parking valet the next morning. I told Dorian I would give him a thumbs up on Trip Advisor; great job Dorian! We attended a Christmas party on the 5th floor and were able to see the lighted boat parade, that was cool. We did not have a ghost in our room to our knowledge, although the bedcovers did slip down and I don't remember pushing them down and one of the light bulbs in the bathroom went out and a few minutes later turned on again? So, maybe we were not alone. If you like vintage hotels this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Atmosphere and Location, Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: sweetpotato018
Reviews.Content: What a treasure! We've visited Baltimore many times, but stayed in the suburbs. I discovered the Admiral Fell Inn when researching Baltimore on line. Our first experience was with Dorian at the front desk who cheerfully took care of our bags, car, and showed us to our delightful room. We saw him throughout our stay, he remembered our names and continued to be very helpful. The Admiral Fell Inn is a wonderfully restored historic landmark. The rooms are beautifully appointed, ours had lovely canopy beds which were incredibly comfortable and deep set colonial style windows. The lovely cozy room was equipped with all the modern amenities, as well. Great room service, too. The area is historic and loaded with charming pubs, very good restaurants and unique original shops and galleries, (no chains, which was a nice change), all within an easy walk around the harbor area. Water taxis are available, also a free shuttle to take you around the harbor to a new entertainment venue, but who wants to leave Fells Point! It's completely captivating! We had hoped to find a ghost or two, but were unable to locate any! We'll definitely be back at the Admiral Fell Inn!

Reviews.Title: “A Five-Star Experience!”
Reviews.Author: TamaraStan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here to celebrate my birthday. We selected the hotel for its ambiance, and its proximity to the water, shopping and entertainment. The hotel is truly "magical" as the service staff treats you with personal attention from check-in to check-out. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable... ours with a waterview. The restaurants and shopping are just steps from the front door, in the charming city of Fells Point, which we enjoyed strolling thru on the warm,sunny day by the water. The parking fee was a bit high, but worth it as we never needed it the entire stay. We will gladly return to this fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It is a great hotel, in an excellent location, with AWESOME staff to help you.”
Reviews.Author: BigBulldog13
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. The staff were excellent. Answered all my questions and provided extra. The front desk person that registered me, helped answer questions about what to do and where to go. Reccomended a ghost tour that was also provided by the hotel. She even remembered me from day to day and asked about the stay I was having. Just very friendly people that payed attention to who I am and didn't treat me just like another number.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly my favorite hotel anywhere!!!”
Reviews.Author: Italicizeme
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth visit to the Admiral Fell Inn. I return again and again for several reasons. The main reason is the location - right on the historic old harbor at Fells Point - is fantastic because interesting shops and good restaurants abound in the area. In addition, I was born in Fells Point. Once a working class community of Poles, Greeks and Italians, it has become a smart and trendy historically protected district attracting tourists from around the world. The next reason is the charming decor and great service and attention I always receive. The rooms are nicely appointed and very clean. A roomy clothes armoire also held an ironing board and a really good iron in addition to a large flat-screened TV. There are good options for things to do, from walking to Little Italy and its fantastic restaurants, to driving downtown and up Charles Street and exploring Mount Vernon Place and the Washington Monument. Further north, you can discover the Johns Hopkins University Homewood campus and the gorgeous nearby neighborhoods of Guilford and Roland Park or funky Hampden, where you will see people much like those in the movie "Hairspray"! Back in Fells Point, I enjoyed a lunch of crabcakes, fries and fresh coleslaw at Duda's on Bond Street near the hotel. The food was very good, but the wait was inordinately long and the young waitress who served me seemed to feel she was worth both the visit and the wait. She wasn't. Nevertheless, I recommend Duda's for its neighborhood flavor (it was in operation when I was still in grade school back in the '50s). Dinner at Meli (adjacent to the hotel) was nice, trendy young waiters dressed in black shirts and pants, nice modern yet warm decor, and a small but adequate menu of chicken, fish and meat entrees. It was fine dining at its best in the heart of Fells Point and a highlight of my visit. I look forward to returning to the Admiral Fell soon!

Reviews.Title: “this hotel provided excellent customer service, I highly recommend them”
Reviews.Author: LindaandWill
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Admiral Fell Inn. The hotel is beautiful and historic, however, the rooms have all necessary modern amenities. Additionally, we found the staff at this hotel to be extremely helpful and a pleasure to deal with. We are especially grateful to Ray, the shuttle driver, who really went above and beyond to help us when our son became ill during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Loves2Travel3487
Reviews.Content: I found the Admiral Fell Inn online and was a bit nervous at first, as sometimes old and dingy can be labelled 'historical.' However this was definitely not the case. We suprised my Mom with an over night to the Admiral Fell and I was so pleased with everything from the service, location, and room, to the added amenities of the free breakfast, ghost tour, and tea time. The AAA rate we recieved was excellent, and our whole family had a wonderful time at the scheduled activities. Additionally, our furry family member Sophie (our chihuahua) was welcomed by everyone at the hotel and we felt perfectly safe with her in the room while we explored the great little shops and restaurants nearby. Additionally the young woman at the front desk was wonderful with all of our requests and questions. I was just so pleased with our trip over all, I have recommended the Admiral Fell to several of my co-workers and plan on taking a return trip with some friends from college to visit the nearby bars.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Admiral Fell!”
Reviews.Author: LockHaven_PASasha
Reviews.Content: I went to the Admiral Fell on recommendation from Johns Hopkins' personnel. Since I was working around appointments, I tried to make a "mini-vacation'"out of my free time. Access to the Water Taxis, Inner Harbor and all the attractions and restaurants made it a wonderful time. Thanks to all the staff, the shuttle driver and Lou Johnson who made it all possible!

Reviews.Title: “Classic”
Reviews.Author: Lauraturner510
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, the staff was really great- nice and informative especially of parking. They knew about all the local hotspots. The room was very clean and historical with the canopy beds with plenty of room, especially in the bathroom which you don't find in most places! The best part is the location which is right in the heart of fells, you go outside and everything is right there! I went with friends and we had a blast but I would have loved to go with my spouse since I think it would be quite romantic!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Charming Hotel with Exceptional Staff”
Reviews.Author: thurmont
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Admiral Fell In while enjoying a weekend at Historic Fells Point, Inner Harbour, Baltimore Maryland. Wonderful waterfront dinning, shopping and strolling. many excellent historic pubs and taverns with live music. This is a beautiful Historic Hotel very much in vibe with the Fell's Point atmosphere. Excellent location in the Center of Fell's Point. Beautifull historicall appointed rooms. And without a doubt the most personable, accomodating staff I have ever experienced. Assistant Hotel Manager Brett Henry and Registration clerk Jessica made my stay extremely memorable. I would highly recommend a stay here, the staff will make it magical!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: Gruet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Admiral Fell Inn for my buddy's bacholar party and we had a blast. The service is wonderful and the staff are knowledgable about the area. The ghost tour and other hotel activities offered are alot of fun and add to the atmosphere of the hotel. I would definately stay here again when I come to Baltimore and reccomend it to anyone staying in the area. There is plenty to do in Fells Point and it is also close to all the downtown attrations. Along with the excellent service Admiral Fell Inn is a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Admiral Fell Inn is a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: djf143
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Fell's Point and the Admiral Fell Inn was a perfect home. The location made it very easy to explore the area and the courtesy shuttle allowed us to explore other areas without taking our car out of the garage. The rooms were very nice and the restaurant and room service was very good. The staff was extremely helpful. I look forward to our next visit to the Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: mselizann
Reviews.Content: I was thrilled with the location of this hotel. It is situated in a historic neighborhood full of great restaurants and taverns. The front desk staff was very helpful to me, in offering me different options for parking my car and also in helping me to get checked out in the early AM. As a solo traveler I felt very secure in the hotel and in my room. I also visited the lounge, and was very pleased with the quality of the cocktails and attention of the bar staff. I cannot wait to visit this hotel again with my husband for a weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite, warm and fun”
Reviews.Author: mom305
Reviews.Content: The fall is an excellent time to visit Baltimore, and the Admiral Fell Inn pulls out all the stops. We were warmly greated and treated like family royalty during our October visit. A great place to return to next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: SouthJerseyParcha
Reviews.Content: We frequent Fells Pt and only stay at the Admiral Fell Inn because of the warmness the staff and rooms provide. It is worth every penny to travel there knowing you are getting a beautiful room with such a nastalgic and historic setting. Every visit the staff makes you feel very comfortable and they are so accommodating. They have a free shuttle to inner harbor. They have it all at AFI. You are walking distance from some of the best restuarants and nightlife around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: sisterpp
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay! Everything was so nice. The women who checked us in was so nice and friendly and knowledgeable about the activities at the hotel. We will definately come back for another getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: njweekender
Reviews.Content: T he staff was excellent. They were very helpful and knowledgable. The fact that you can use the facilities at their sister hotels was very good with different things to do. The shuttle was very convenient so ou can park and not need your car. The reservation staff was so helpful and the rooms very clean. I would definetly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Rew60
Reviews.Content: The staff was so helpful in writing out directions for us to the resturant we went to and a couple of sites we wanted to visit. They knew the local and had excellent recommendations. I also left my mediation at home and they were helpful in arranging me to obtain the dosage I needed while at my conference. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Inn located in the center of Fells point”
Reviews.Author: NJbub
Reviews.Content: Second stay at the INN , great staff , great location for walks and pubs , water taxi launch right across the cobble stone street , city easily available by water taxi , car or bus, valet and self term parking within 3 blocks at reasonable price.Hakeem at the desk was VERY helpful both visits . different rooms on visits and both were very spacious and tastefully decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: sandrine66
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for the EA Poe (part of the Weird USA package) events and for it's location and the fact that it is a historic, and apparently haunted, hotel with nice amenities. All of the staff were quite helpful and the package received was as advertised, except the drink vouchers which had apparently run out and so the hotel took a discount off the room rate, which was acceptable. The room was cosy and comfortable and the jacuzzi worked great. A hot breakfast was included and it was qute good. I didn't get to experience the Tea Party on Sat. but the hotel ghost tour was excellent. I would definitely stay again. I heard from another guest that there was some kind of shuttle service, which I never found out about, for local stops but I did have a rental car anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: mngshamr
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the Admiral Fell Inn for our anniversary. It was an excellent time. The service, food and ambiance of the hotel were top notch. I would recommend this location to anyone who wants a nice time.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: rck43w
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great place to stay! The staff was more then friendly and very helpful. There was always someone around to assist you. I really enjoyed the tour and the stories and history of the hotel. The hotel was surrounded by restaurants and there was transportation right outside if I wanted to take a trip to the inner harbor. I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Gr8 place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 3grlz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the AFI for a girl's weekend which also happened to be during Fell's Point Fun Festival. The location of the hotel was wonderful, very convenient to all the activities. Everything is in walking distance. The hotel itself was very clean and well maintained. The staff was exceptional (especially those at the front desk). We had no issues with our room, reservations, getting assistance with our vehicle, etc. Although we didn't need access to it, our car was in a parking garage a few blocks away which wasn't fun when we were checking out and dragging all our luggage through the streets of Fell's Point, but that was a minor inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Festival”
Reviews.Author: llevy0211
Reviews.Content: I would like to give my congratulations to a job well done by the staff at the Admiral Fell Inn. Jessica was very helpful in getting us to our events at Pier 5 on Friday night and recommending the other events there and at the Amiral Inn. She is a pleasure to deal with. Also Kevin, Thane, David and Kakeem were very helpful with opening the door, helping me and my sister with the steps, answering any questions we had, helping get us to events with the shuttle, getting our car when we were ready to leave. They are very professional and a pleasure to work with. I would and will recommend your hotel to my friends and family. And we look forward to our stay next year.

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best”
Reviews.Author: CrystalO
Reviews.Content: The Fells Point Festival is an annual event for our group (10 - 15). This year we stayed in Fells Point at the Admiral Fell Inn. This hotel was absolutely perfect, location, hospitality and accommodations. The staff was delightful, especially Jessica who catered to our every need and did it with a smile and enthusiam. The rooms were spaceious and very comfortable with a wonderful view of the city as well as the harbor. This is hands down our only choice for the annual trip, we have already made our reservations for next year! Crystal O, Richnmond, VA

Reviews.Title: “What a Disapppointment”
Reviews.Author: ElmoDelaware
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are celebrating our 20th anniversary, and decided to take a quick get-away, our first without the children for 13 years. Based on the historic nature of the building and on the extra "in-house" activities offered, we selected the Admiral Fell Inn. First, the good news. Our room was clean and comfortable, and we both enjoyed the Jacuzzi. Before I get to the bad news, I am wondering if a community fair might have affected the service we received. However, since no one thought it was worth mentioning the fair when we booked our room, I have to assume it was not considered a significant issue. 1. The "Valet service" involved driving our own car to a public garage and then schlepping our stuff six blocks to the hotel. For this service, we were charged $29 plus tax. (We later learned that there is a quicker route, which would have involved walking only four blocks.) 2. One of the "in-house" activities which drew us the the AFI, the Tea Party, was cancelled with no notice. 3. The other "in-house" activity which we wanted to attend was the Ghost Tour. It was scheduled from 5-6. At 5:20, we gave up and left. The front desk could not tell us when, or even if, the tour would take place. 4. Our smoke detector was "chirping" at regular intervals (as when the battery is low). We called the front desk and were told that someone would come take care of it. No one ever did. 5. The web site shows a "breaksfast room" and a menu featuring omelettes and quiches. Evidently, this has been discontinued and replaced with a "breakfast buffet". The buffet consists of two chafing dishes, one containing scrambled eggs, the other containing potatoes and bacon. This is generally included in the room fee, but since we booked with AAA discount, we would have been charged $11/person for this meal. (When the front desk manager saw us leaving to go to a diner, he comped our breakfast.) 6. We found our room to be very noisy. We could hear people outside our third floor room at 3am. (It seems there are a number of bars and taverns in the area.) We commented, with no irony or sarcasm, that we've spent much quieter nights at Times Square. Ear plugs helped some. I would suggest to anyone planning to stay at the AFI to expect a nice room, and to consider anything else they come across to be an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: jacquev69
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a wedding and stayed at the hotel for a week. Service was wonderful, room was clean and bed was very comfortable. Location is second to none.

Reviews.Title: “New Friends”
Reviews.Author: JaneauMass
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Baltimore for the Red Sox series against the Orioles. Staying at the Admiral Fell in was the best!! The staff was so helpful arranging transportation and restaurant reservation, they truly made our stay a memorable one. They treated us like old acquaintances and when leaving we felt we were leaving friends behind. We hope to return often.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: Euro-Traveler-1971
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my trip back to Baltimore. This was easily our favorite hotel during our vacation. The staff is absolutely the best. It is difficult to find great customer service today, but this place fits the bill. From check-in to check-out, we have no complaints. The hotel is not in the middle of the tourist attractions, but it is a short ten minute walk. They also have a shuttle that can transport you to the Inner Harbor within a couple of minutes. Fells Point is a better area than the commercialized Inner Harbor anyway. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great historical hotel”
Reviews.Author: KittyC1
Reviews.Content: Great historical hotel (nice change from "cookie cutter" places). Spent five days here and had a wonderful time. The location, staff, and atmosphere (Fells Point) were all excellent. Appreciated the complimentary wine tasting and ghost tour. So much to see and do in the area --- location made for an easy walk to most everything. Would defintely stay there again and would definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic, fabulous, restful time we had at the beautiful, historical Admiral Fell Inn!”
Reviews.Author: BrendaLaurelMD
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at The Admiral Fell Inn, to meet with the rest of the family, who were coming to Inner Harbor by boat. The hotel is just gorgeous and so full of history. We were greeted by the most friendly, helpful, hospitable staff, who whisked our car away, carried in our bags and made us feel extremely welcome. We found out that a part of the building is over 200 years old! The lobby was beautifully decorated and comfortable. Our room was huge and grand, with three big windows, that let in lots of light, but could be easily darkened when needed. We had two lovely canopy beds, just as we had requested, with lots of pillows, quality linens and cushy blankets. There were wing-back chairs, and a flat screen TV, carefully tucked away in a charming armoire. There was also a refrigerator, microwave, and coffee maker, and everything was just so clean. Our breakfast was included, and served in the lovely, immaculate dining room. There was a free shuttle at our beck and call to take us over to the Inner Harbor and bring us back whenever we requested. We had a spectacular time and can't wait to go back. We want to go on the night of the famous ghost tour next time. This hotel gets an A+.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Loved it Here”
Reviews.Author: bmoretraveler15
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here after our friends wedding at the hotel. The wedding was beautiful and we had such a great stay. A couple of our friends stayed there as well and all of our rooms were different and unique. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful with all of our questions. We loved being right in the middle of the action in Fell's Point and had a great brunch at Meli which is located right in the hotel. Overall a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “What a Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: EastCoastTraveler77
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a quiet weekend away from the kids. The Admiral Fell Inn lived up to everything that they advertised. From the time week checked in on Friday evening until our departure on Sunday morning the staff could not do more to make our stay more enjoyable. They answered every question we had and gave great insight into the unkown secrets of Baltimore. For a hotel that is as historic as the Admiral is, the guest rooms and lobby area are extremely well maintained. The staff of the Inn truely takes pride in their work and it shows at every turn. Great hotel, Great staff, Great location

Reviews.Title: “Allergy suffers beware!”
Reviews.Author: finicky_traveler79
Reviews.Content: Perhaps the Admiral Fell Inn’s greatest claim to fame is the supposed ghosts that reside within its walls. There were no ghosts to be found during my stay, and I can’t say that I blame them; even if I were dead, I’m not so sure I would want to hang around there either. While the Inn itself is beautifully steeped in an old-fashioned, unassuming charm, from its dimly lit, Federal-style lobby to its sprawling red-carpeted corridors that would make Stephen King drool with envy, the rooms themselves are products of age and what can only be constituted as human neglect. Upon entering the room, my husband and I were assaulted by the overwhelming scent of mustiness, reminiscent of a dank basement. It wasn’t hard to see why. The air vents were literally caked in solidified layers of dust and grime, the ceiling was marred by signs of water damage, and the shower was a ghastly display of mold and mildew. Allergy suffers beware: if you are staying here, come prepared with an arsenal of decongestants. I take pleasure in the simple things in life, like long, hot showers during my vacation. So you can imagine my utter horror when I see that the very shower/tub that I am supposed to be enjoying is grossly stained and spotted with the browns and reds of mildew, with the occasional random hair strewn about (do ghosts shed? I don’t think so). Now, part of the appeal at staying at the Admiral Fell Inn was so that I could fall in love with the charisma and uniqueness of someplace historically charming, instead of staying at your run-of-the-mill, sterile hotel chain. However, after one look at the shower, I wanted to run into the awaiting arms of the local Marriott or Holiday Inn, because at least there I would have been practically guaranteed a hot shower that wouldn’t involve a hazmat suite. I had hoped that a good night’s sleep would help turn my frown upside down, though I worried that my night would be plagued by nightmares about killer mold spores. I never got the chance to find out. Sleep was sparse because of conversational neighbors congregating in the hallway all hours of the night, and though they weren’t especially loud, the walls are so paper-thin that they might as well have been carrying on their conversations beside my bed. I was even awakened by the sound of a woman’s cackling laughter a few doors down. A crazy ghost, maybe? My money’s on an obnoxious drunk in need of attention. You can imagine how hard it is to enjoy Fells Point/Inner Harbor on just a few hours sleep. The one saving grace of the Inn, however, is the location. Everything you could want is at your fingertips, be it good food and drinks, quaint shops, or in my case, water-taxis (I was sleep deprived, so walking everywhere would have been a dangerous to my person). The proximity of all the tourist attractions was definitely a plus, and though tired, I enjoyed all of the sights and sounds of the area and the people. Another saving grace? The staff at the Inn were exceptionally sweet and personable and always willing to make you smile. Even if they were oblivious to the state of the rooms they represent, they were a pleasure to work with. We were informed, upon leaving after a night’s stay, that the Inn was undergoing some updating. I hope this wasn’t just a line. The Inn has so much potential to be a historical and pleasant place to stay. With a little work, it could easily be polished into the shining gem of Fells Point. All it would take would be some hard work, a little creativity, and a lot of Tilex.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and great location”
Reviews.Author: GIfishguy99
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife as a getaway. It was an eligant but cozy place. The rooms were great and the service was even better. They put me in the wrong room at first but they quickly corrected it and upgraded my room to a corner juccuzi suite. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Magical Experience”
Reviews.Author: JessicaHerman
Reviews.Content: This was my very first time at Inner Harbor, MD and had the best time of my life! The hospitality and luxury of the Admiral Fell Inn made me feel like a true, pampered celebrity. Wonderful espresso martinis in their chic cocktail lounge, cloud-like beds, huge bubble bath jacuzzi, environmental-friendly toiletries...and the list goes on and on. Kudos to Admiral Fell Inn! Truly a magical experience!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: wherman
Reviews.Content: Great, historic hotel! The location is right where you want to be in Inner Harbor for a relaxing, chilled-out and fun-filled stay! Friendly staff! Valet was prompt, front desk was extremely helpful! I can only imagine that the HR Dept behind the scenes is one of the best! We will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Disaster”
Reviews.Author: LillianLoewe
Reviews.Content: We had prepaid in full, arrived at hotel to be told they had no room for us. We were sent to their "sister" hotel, Pier Five, which the desk clerk claimed was more "upscale" and "luxurious." If true, which I doubt, I can only imagine what the Admiral Fell Inn rooms were like, which we never saw. Should we have demanded a refund? Argued about it? Who wants to send their vacation time like that? It was a horrible experience which I hope to forget as soon as I finish this warning to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend in fells point!”
Reviews.Author: covelca
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous after booking our room at Admiral Fell's because I had read some negative reviews about the hotel on this site. My boyfriend and I spent the day in Inner Harbor and then came to Fell's Point in the evening to check in. That was Friday night, we did not leave the area one time after that! We both LOVEd the hotel, it was unique and charming. Our room wasn't the biggest hotel room i've ever stayed in but it was decorated very historic and i felt it was rather cute. The area is wonderful, located in the heart of Fell's point across from the harbor, and lined with small pubs and restaurants up and down each street. We opted not to eat in the restaurant in the hotel, and tried various little places in the area, which were all very good and reasonably priced. We mingled, made friends and are looking forward to going back this summer with other couples. All in all it was a perfect romantic little getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Imperfect, but without doubt, a gem.”
Reviews.Author: partnersentwine
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here twice. It's in a beautiful historic neighborhood with cobblestone streets, and it's quite charming. NOT for the traveller who loves Holiday Inns and sterile environments, but for those who love adventure, it's great! Nicely appointed in period furniture, a friendly helpful staff. Great breakfast included in our fairly priced deal. Endearing. They say it's haunted. Can't say for sure, but this image mysteriously appeared on our camera. oooOOOooo What do you think?

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here! False Advertising! Dirty Rooms! Terrible Management!”
Reviews.Author: Birdwhistle
Reviews.Content: The hotel was recommended by a friend of mine. I should have checked the posts on this site. If over promising and under-delivering was what the hotel was after, then they succeeded. After making our reservation, I was contacted by an "Experience Specialist" who wanted to make sure we had everything we needed. I thought that was a nice touch. I asked about family-friendliness of the hotel, the area, restaurants etc... We were taking my daughter for an over night trip to go to Port Discovery the next day. I was told that the hotel had a great restaurant Meli, that was very child friendly. I was also told that they would accommodate my request for a room with a nook or sitting area so that my husband and I didn't have to go to bed as early as our daughter. Got there and went to room. The room smelled like disinfectant. The carpet was FILTHY. There were large brown stains and it crunched when we walked on it. THe room was set to about 80 degrees as well. We went downstairs to go to dinner and before going to the restaurant, I was asked by the front desk how everything was. I told them about the room and they immediately gave me keys to a different room. Went to Meli. There was a 30 minute wait (after being told by the hotel we didn't need a reservation on a Monday night). Was sent to their sister restaurant ,Mezze down the street where it took them 20 minutes to bring a glass of wine. This doesn't work when you have a two year old with you - and we were assured Mezze was child friendly as well. We got back and went to the second room. Also dirty. Mold on ceilings in bathroom. Dust on the night tables. Cob webs on the lap shades. Ugh! The room was right off of Thames Street. My daughter couldn't sleep and kept saying "I wanna go home!" I could go on about this but I'm not sure Its necessary...... This hotel has the right intentions when you first come into contact with staff. Once you enter BEWARE! They are not what they advertise on line, in their pictures, on the phone orin their restaurants. They really need a complete over haul. Meli and Mezze's management should be replaced. They need lessons in how to recruit wait staff. Every wait person we encountered was either unfriendly and/or looked past us as if we didn't exist. I'm not sure why they told us they were child friendly. I enjoy dinners without kids as much as the next person. But why the false advertising? To make more money? I hated every minute we spent there and would have gone home in the middle of the night if we hadn't already planned on Port Discovery the next day. Please don't go!! Save your money and go to any of the big chains in the city instead.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: Middle_Aged_Guy
Reviews.Content: After reading the negative reviews on this hotel, I was pleasantly surprised by it and rate it above average. There is a caveat to this rating in that I paid a total charge of significantly under $100 via Priceline. If I had to pay around the $200 a day rate advertised at many sites, I would rate this hotel as average. My expectations for an under $100 a night hotel are different than my expectations at a $200+ a night hotel. My room was reasonable sized, clean and nicely furnished with a large flat screen TV. The bathroom was functional. Overall, the word "quaint" comes to mind. I think I read that each room is unique and the Admiral Fell Inn is definitely is not your cookie cutter Hilton or Quality Inn. What really makes this hotel stand out is its location in Fells Point, near nice restaurants, and very close to the water. It would be ideal for a romantic weekend out. As mentioned in an earlier review, you should expect the extra $9.95 charge for the 2 bottle of waters, access to a health club, newspaper, and other stuff I don't remember. Parking is $20 a day, not too bad for a hotel in the city. You might get around the parking charge if you find street pay parking, its probably cheaper than $20. I would recommend that you get a room as high as you can get. The hotel is in a city and there is street noise till pretty late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Not Much Else”
Reviews.Author: DarrenWashington
Reviews.Content: Well, booked the hotel for a quick night away from Washington, looking to spend the evening in Fell's Point. The location of this hotel is perfect, right on the wharf, in the heart of this historic part of Baltimore. Entered the hotel shortly after 4, the posted check in time, and was told, "Oh, I am sorry, I have some bad news. We had some guests from Johns Hopkins stay beyond their reservation and so we do not have a room for you. We can give you a room in one of our sister hotels. It is only a ten minute drive away." I asked why I had not been called about this and he just looked at me. I asked for the manager, demanded a room, and within ten minutes had the key in my hand. It seemed oddly like something they had done many many times. Do they just overbook all the time, or are they that poorly managed? Despite the problem, the room was large and comfy. The hotel is charming in a sort of rundown historic hotel way. There were some stains on one of the chairs and some cracks in the plaster in the room. The hotel could use a pretty big overhaul. BUT, if you are looking to spend a few days in Fell's Point (which I do recommend), this place would do, just make sure to keep your expectations low, very low.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is run by a bunch of cheats!”
Reviews.Author: ghost81
Reviews.Content: The hotel tried to charge me a 9.95/day destination fee when I checked in. I explained that since I used priceline, my reservation was paid in full. After a 45 minute argument, they clerk informed me that he would waive the fee for me as a 1 time courtesy. 2 weeks later I see the fee show up on my credit card statement!! Calling the hotel resulted in claims that they'd never waive the fee and I must be lying. I'm filing a dispute with my credit card company. This hotel matched a 3 star bid on priceline in the fells point area. I strongly recommend that you do not use priceline in this area as you may get this hotel, and who knows what they'll try and tack on your bill!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: onyka
Reviews.Content: I am very torn as to what to say about the Inn. There were some really cool points about locale which includes the funky flavor of Fell's Point itself as well as the quaint facade of the Inn. I can also say that every person at the Inn was very friendly and helpful. That being said let's move on to the not so good moments. First off, we tried to check in and our reservation wasn't in the system so we had to wait 20 minutes for them to enter us in manually. This wasn't a problem since we came early but beware if you're on a tight schedule. The staff member that helped us was very apologetic and gave us a large room as compensation for our waiting. We grabbed our things and went to the third floor triping over small flights of steps along the way. We ended up in the POE room which seemed like an awesome start to the weekend. The room was tastefully decorated in 18th century furniture accented in nautical colors of forest green, navy and beige. The tv was a desent size and the heater was mercifully quiet. Unfortunately, the closer I looked at things the grungier it looked. The walls have smears and battle scars from from previous furniture arrangements, the bathroom's plaster is cracked and peeling, the bathtub wasn't exactly sparkling but what bothered me the most was that the sheets were clearly not changed. There were short and curly hairs in the bed and they weren't from us! That completely grossed me out and then I noticed that my comforter was torn and ragged. I just let it go figuring that I was being paranoid. The first night we opted to take their shuttle service to the city and was greeted by a van covered in tacky stars and driven by a very sweet man who was NOT a great driver. Those with a faint heart better skip this ride! Anyway, we woke up the next morning and was greeted by a bill for an adult movie that we didn't order. We contested the bill and it was quickly waived but we started to wonder if they tried to charge everyone that bogus bill in the hopes that some people will pay it. As for the 9.95 destination fee. Pretty sneaky but we weren't terribly put off by it. We used the shuttle and bottled water so I'm sure it shook out. I'm just really appalled at the lack of cleanliness. I would have dismissed the cracked plaster and such because it's an old building but there is NO ESCUSE FOR DIRTY LINENS!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a disaster!”
Reviews.Author: drdebtech
Reviews.Content: I booked the Admiral Fell Inn for the weekend since they were offerring a two for one special, and we love the Fells Point area in Baltimore and were planning on attending the "Night of 100 Elvises." The Inn is conveniently located and the reception area is lovely, with dark panelled wood, pretty antiques, a roaring fireplace, and tasteful decorations . . .if only the rooms lived upto the expectations of the reception area. Our initial room was a corner one that was quite tiny . . .think about hotel rooms in Europe. As we ran into each other trying to get our suitcases in the room, and stared at the carpet (which looks about 20 years old . .brown, stained, and ugly), we realized that there appeared to be no heat in this room (this is December and it was freezing.!) After complaining to the management and asking to be moved to another room, we were told there were no other rooms and that someone would be over to "fix" the problem. As the temperature in our room hovered around 50 degrees, we decided to go the bar as we waited for the repairman. The one positive thing we had was a lovely "experience" concierge, who was kind and upbeat and our drinks were comped by her (unknown to us, for I would have definitely had more than 1 cocktail if I had known what was ahead.). However, after 2 hours of waiting, we still had no heat in our room. We were then offerred the opportunity to move to their sister hotel, and the shuttle would take us there. We packed up our things and hustled over to the the Pier six (5?) hotel, which is right on the water. As we walked into the hotel and were greated by the loud beat of techno music, I honestly felt like I was in the tackiest hotel in Las Vegas. This hotel is very modern, the walls are purple with orange accents and you feel like you're in a Jetsons episode. Yes, the room had heat and was much larger, but for someone like me who goes for that whole "Williamsburg" vibe, it was terrible. So, after checking into this hotel, we told the desk clerk that we would like to return to the Admirel Fell Inn for the next evening . . that is, if they could give us a room with heat. So, we packed up our things once again and went back to the Admirel Fell Inn for our Saturday night stay. The room we stayed in was a very small suite, but once again, it is quite dated and oddly decorated. The drapes and bedspread looked like something out of a Motel 6, we had that same brown, seedy carpet, but most surprising, the walls in this room were painted a bubblegum pink! The bathroom had a mixture of gold and nickel fixtures, but there was a decent sized television which still does not compensate for the quality of the furnishings. What was most amazing to me is that no one acted like this was an unusual occurrence, i.e. checking into a room with no heat in December, being shuttled to another hotel after a 2 hour wait, and shuttling back again for another night. Although there appeared to be staff, they did not offer to help with our bags, there was no complimentary parking, basically nothing for our troubles. Would I ever come back here again? Probably not . . .but if the location is all you care about, then go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: levh01
Reviews.Content: I had an overnight stay here because I was presenting to a trade group who met at the Inn. I can't comment on the surrounding location much (other than it seemed like a cool spot) because it was raining when I arrived and I left first thing in the morning. First thing I want to say was that the staff was quite friendly. The doorman practically jumped through hoops to get my stuff (I had a laptop, projector, and two bins of samples) to the right place, and he did it quickly. My room seemed clean and cozy. The bed was very comfortable. The shower didn't work that well, however, but not a biggie. The two things I would like to say most about is that it seems that my floor (2nd) had an almost maze-like quality, with several sets of stairs to get to different levels. If you have a lot of stuff to carry (like I did), you will have a hard time getting to your room without help (the staff were more than willing to help, but then you had to tip them, which I did). I'm not sure what the other floors are like, but you might want to inquire if you have any disabilities or lots of bags. Secondly, beware of the fees. My room was $129, but I ended up paying around $190 after all the fees and taxes, including $29 for overnight valet parking(!). Also, they charge $9.95 fee for miscellaneous items(!). They claim this is charged to everyone, and breakfast wasn't included. This reminds me of the baggage fees that some airlines charge; just include it with the cost! Again, it seems like a cool area with the surrounding bars and restaurants and its across the street from the water. Just make sure you check out those fees!

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitly Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: gak146
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a place to spend our anniversary. We had not been to visit my sister since she moved to Baltimore a year or so ago, so we decided to kill 2 birds with one stone and booked a "Ghostly Getaway" weekend at the Admiral Fell Inn. We chose this hotel for 2 reasons: 1. It is a historic hotel-if you like to stay at places that have a lot of history behind them and evoke a sense of days gone by, then the Admiral Fell Inn does not dissappoint.
