Our room was spacious, clean, tastefully decorated, and super comfortable. 2. Pet friendly. We were able to bring along our beloved golden retriever for the weekend. The staff was so complimetary and made sure that we, as well as our dog, had a great time. Upon check in, our dog recieved his own pet pack complete with a toy, food and water dish and other things. We really didn't need it since the dog already has everything he needs when we travel but it was included in the price and we plan on donating it to a local rescue group. The Admiral Fell is located in historic Fells Point. This is a great, historic neighborhood complete with cobblestone streets, quaint bars and resteraunts and tons of history. The ghost walk was a great way to learn about the history and see some of the main landmarks. The hotel offers a shuttle to their other properties in the inner harbor making it a nice feature to get back and forth without having to drive. Pros: Pet friendly, clean and comfortable, courteous and helpful staff; walking distance to everything Cons: Street noise from surrounding bars, valet parking only

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with dog at charming little hotel !”
Reviews.Author: violetnj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Admiral Fell this weekend, bringing our family poodle with us. She was greeted with their welcome dog package ( a $49 pet charge for the entire stay which they do not publicize)) but a cute package also arrived in our room with feeding dishes, dog bed, toys, brush etc. to use and take home. She was really made welcome! The staff was great. Incidentally, we always bring and use a crate so that the room can be cleaned and the pet does no damage. Makes you very popular with the cleaning staff. The room was quite charming and very very clean! The staff was lovely and helpful . Previous reviews tended to indicate the hotel was for the young, hip, drinking crew. Not at all! We're grandparents and we had a great time. Used the water taxis based across the street to go all over the place in the Inner Harbor. The Fells Point neighborhood itself is charming, walkable, a little funky - everyone walks their dogs and talks to you. We walked all over it and over to Little Italy for one dinner. The stay was a definite pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms could do with a good clean”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTrav_8
Reviews.Content: I just stayed for two nights at the Admiral Fells Inn. The hotel is in a good location, but lets itself down on the following points: 1) Hotel should provide some sound insulation/double-glazing for rooms overlooking the noisy Thames Street. Many people have commented on this point already. 2) The bathroom in my room was not very clean. The bathroom had a stale, musty smell, had broken tiles on the floor, walls and surfaces were still covered in tooth-paste from previous guests, and the AC air-vent was filthy. Generally the room, carpet and furnishings all looked like they were not being cleaned properly. I hope these points are addressed by the Admiral Fell Inn Management. I would look to stay in another hotel, next time I am in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty but not the best”
Reviews.Author: susanp99
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the KEY room and it was large and dated looking. Sheets unironed, musty smelling. A lot of noise from other guest doors and street noise from Broadway since windows are not soundproof. It is a cute old home and common areas are lovely, but bedding was hard and uncomfortable as well as pillows. I would stay there again if I have to, but would not choose this property.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Old hotel”
Reviews.Author: robs8
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms mid-week at the Admiral Fell Inn at a disounted rate of $109.00 (through TravelZoo), and was very pleased with our stay. The staff was very eager to please (above average friendliness). Our rooms were 116 and 216, and both were large, with 2 full beds in each room, and a moderately-sized bathroom. The rooms and lobby were clean and tastefully furnished. Room 216 had a very squeeky floor, but this is a historic building, so I can accept some squeeking. We did not eat at their restaurant. There were 4 steps in the front of the building, so I guess it is not wheelchair accessable. Inside there are a few steps at various places on each floor, but there are elevators. After a 6% hotel tax and a 7.5% Baltimore tax, and the hotel's service fee ($9.95), our total came to $140/room.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Tinwoman
Reviews.Content: Disgusting. The valet's were the only employees there who were kind and courteous. The experience specialist would not make it in the real world. No extra's at all. Full price for water taxi tickets. $9.95 extra fee. I am glad we only stayed one night. The maids were up and walking around knocking on doors to clean at 9:00 a.m.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: willtravel12345
Reviews.Content: We spent five days there under a Johns Hopkins package. I've stayed many places, from value motels to four diamond properties, and this is one of the best trained group of personnel I've encountered. They could not have been more friendly or helpful, from shuttle driver, to front desk, to valet parking, to general help. It's easy to overlook a shortcoming or two when everyone is working so hard to make your stay a good one. The location is superb, right on a great waterfront with numerous really good restaurants, art galleries, and shops. There are also a lot of condos in the area, so the whole downtown is alive at night. There are lots of areas to walk. The hotel room we had was on the ground floor, overlooking a little alleyway garden where someone had even planted herbs. There were 3 chairs and a desk, in addition to a small fridge, two beds, and several tables, but the room was not at all cramped. The only downside to the room was that for some reason, between about 11:30 p.m. and 1:30 a.m., there always seemed to be doors slamming -- was never able to figure out who or why. I was never able to get a good internet connection in the room (it may have been my browser settings), but I was able to use the computer in the lobby. A complimentary breakfast buffet in the tearoom was good and a nice way to start the morning. There were a few housekeeping issues, but they didn't really distract from the overall experience, and the hotel seemed genuinely interested in feedback. To bottom line, it was an attractive, cozy, very enjoyable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but watch the hidden costs”
Reviews.Author: yarly
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the weekend for a music festival in Mount Vernon. After reading a bunch of horror stories of hotels and motels in that area, we opted for this well reviewed hotel in Fells Point (about $10 cabfare away). We had the chance to explore the Inner Harbor and some other neighborhoods while we were in town and we would say Fells Point is the best place to stay. You have restaurants, bars, etc. in a nice cobblestone street setting right on the water and a very easy 10 minute stroll into the Inner Harbor. 15 minute walk to convention center. The bars and restaurants in Fells Point offer a good mix of tourist and local folk whereas the Inner Harbor is more crowded and mostly with tourists. The only thing to watch with this particular hotel is the hidden $9.95/night charge. This "destination fee" gets you internet access, US phone calls, and some other stuff for a flat rate of $9.95/night. They advertise it on flyers in the room as though it's an optional package but it's not. While it may be a good deal for some, we didn't need any of it and disputed the charges on check-out. The clerk explained to us it's not an optional charge and it's applied to all their rooms. I told him we didn't use any of those facilities and that I thought it was misleading to hide $10 of the nightly room rate in fine print. The clerk ended up waiving the charges for us but, although extremely polite, he made it seem like he was doing us a big favour so don't count on this. Everything else with the place was fine. Check-in was fast (under a minute). The room was comfortable. Housekeeping was thorough. Staff were polite and helpful. Didn't use room service. Would I stay here again? Maybe. I'd look around first though for somewhere a bit more honest.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Inn”
Reviews.Author: Mickeydoodle
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a great location in Fells Point with the water taxi directly across the street from the Inn. Room was very nice and the breakfast was good. They also have shuttle service to their sister hotel for free, but add an additional $9.95 per day to your bill whether you use the service or not. So save the money on the water taxi and use the shuttle service. I would recommend this Inn. We loved it and also Fells Point bistro's.

Reviews.Title: “Great Potential”
Reviews.Author: Bama_Grits
Reviews.Content: I had always wanted to go into Baltimore for the Independence Day fireworks at the Inner Harbor. So this year we finally did it! And I'd always wanted to stay at an historical place. So we chose the Admiral Fell, at the end of Broadway in the heart of Fells Point. The setting is quaint, if a bit shabby. There are some upscale shops, but more run-down bars and vacant storefronts. The Inn is in a similar state. The registration process should have given me a clue. While I could look up availability on-line, I had to call to actually make the reservation. The staff was very attentive and professional, and the room was adequate, but there were little things that just didn't add up. There was an overpowering potpourri smell in the lobby. And some of the upholstery was visibly dirty. The room was adequate, nice furnishings, one bedspread had a tear, there was a glass shelf in the bathroom that seemed loose and was slanted enough to allow things to slide off, one table lamp was not working, and half the length of the sheets were tucked under the end of the mattress. But the thing that bothered me most was the dirty windows(inside & out)! And just outside, the peeling paint! The other down-tick was that I had signed up on the "Harbor Magic" website for the 4 p.m. Afternoon Tea and the 5 p.m. Ghost Tour, only to find out upon arrival that both had been canceled because of the holiday. They had my email address, they could have had the courtesy to contact me and let me know. While there was no mention of a complimentary breakfast, we imagined that they must have some provision, and I asked at the desk what they could recommend. The night clerk said there was a breakfast buffet that was regularly $11, but that we should ask about their voucher in the morning. What we discovered the next morning was that the voucher was only included in certain packages, and our stay did not qualify. Oh, and the buffet was really $11.95. We asked for alternatives, and they only offered one, a diner across the square, but we found it was way too crowded. We cut our losses & headed out of the city for a popular chain restaurant down the road. As for parking, we took the cheap route: street-side metered parking was $1/hour 10 a.m. -8 p.m. and free overnight. Alternatives were a nice garage 3 blocks away for about $15 overnight, or valet service from the Inn at $30 for 24 hrs.

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: BobHfromPA
Reviews.Content: If you stay here you will be treated like DIRT from the desk clerks, you will get double billed on your credit card, and this hotel will charge an extra $9.95 as a destination fee which is not tax and is probably illegal. NEVER AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Has advantages and disadvantages”
Reviews.Author: horatioalger
Reviews.Content: The main advantage of the Admiral Fell is its proximity to the Inner Harbor area. Travel by water taxi is easy - the pier is right across the street, which we found a great advantage over trying to navigate the terribly congested streets in the area with very aggressive drivers. At first impression, the hotel looks lovely and colonial, and our room had attractive canopy beds. We liked the fact that there was free bottled water in the room as well However, within a very short time, we found the room small for two adults and a teenager; the bathroom's lack of exhaust created a steamy, always damp room; the internet connection did not work even when the mechanic came to check it out. We asked for a room off the street because we heard about the noise of street-facing rooms. Yet we awoke to the sounds of a brawl outside our room on the weekend, and there was no way we could sleep. Fearing the worst, we called the front desk to see if they would contact the police but could not reach anyone at the front desk. The next day we were told that this experience is standard fare on the weekend because the hotel is basically surrounded by bars that all close around the same time - 1 am. We also did not find the front desk to be particularly attentive nor helpful. And parking is ridiculous - rather than pay $29/day for valet parking, we walked several blocks to self-park at a city garage. Walking our wheeling bags over cobbled streets was no picnic.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Admiral Fell Inn - Definitely will stay again”
Reviews.Author: tchoiniere
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend while in town for 2 Red Sox games. Got a decent rate off of Quikbook. Benefits Location in Fell's Point is absolutely perfect. Many restaurants / bars within walking distance. Also, right near the water taxi launch. Harbor Magic package included free breakfast (initially included on my bill at checkout - but was removed). The free breakfast was your typical buffett. This package also included a lot of coupons for buy 1, get 1 drink free at many bars. Some restrictions do apply so some weren't able to be used. Room was decent sized and clean. Drawbacks Smoke alarm went off while getting out of the shower due to the water vapor. Talk about making sure you are awake. $29 / day valet charge. Parking is very limited so you don't have many options. Next time I come - I will make sure not to have a car. You don't need 1 in Baltimore anyways!

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: travelwell_8
Reviews.Content: The Admiral Fell Inn has lots of charm and an interesting location but has gotten really shabby. The rooms are in need of paint and updating (not to make them more modern, but to make them more in keeping with travelers' expectations). The staff is very friendly and helpful, but we were overcharged on our room rate, and the parking has gone up to $29 a night, close to NY rates. The breakfast buffet is large but is not very high quality, and I would not recommend it to anyone who wants more than packaged goods for breakfast. There are many good breakfast places in the area which are cheaper and better. Our room was on the street and was incredibly noisy on the weekend, so much so that the other person in the room had to use ear plugs to sleep. There are many clubs in the area which stay open late and are full of people having a good time. Because of no-smoking rules inside the clubs, many of them smoke outside which causes large groups to hang out. The Inn should put triple pane glass on the front windows, just as they do in Europe to insulate against noise. I would not recommend the Inn or stay there again, since there are much better hotels at similar rates in the Inner Harbor or elsewhere in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “If You Don't Like Chain Hotels...”
Reviews.Author: Pumpkin88
Reviews.Content: Whether or not you will enjoy this hotel depends on whether you're the kind of traveler who likes history and ambiance or the kind of traveler who likes to stay at a chain hotel and know exactly what to expect. For the more-flexible traveler, this hotel should prove to be a nice experience. (I am kind of a mix, but am trying to learn to be more of the adventurous type.) Yes, the price was high but not out of line with other Inner Harbor lodging. I had been warned that there was a lot of street noise, so I took my white noise machine with me and plugged it in by the bed. (Slept like a baby.) The very reason there is street noise, though, is the very thing that makes this a very convenient place to stay: It's right in the middle of where you want to be! I'm not much of a walker, so this was a great choice since it's only steps from a water taxi stop. There is a cute little park across the street and many cute little shops within walking distance (including ice cream - yay!) The negatives: The pillow shams were like you would find in someone's guest room, and I was a bit afraid to put my head on them since they don't look like the type of thing that would get washed after every guest. (There were 3 pillows in regular white pillow cases, though, so it was ok.) Also, there was a little stain on one of the bath towels which creeped me out. Not the world's best water pressure in the shower, but it was clean. The positives (which more than made up for the negs): The staff is WONDERFUL! There are afternoon tea parties complete with amusing "ghost" hosts. The valets are always ready to get your car at a moment's notice. The breakfast was delicious and served in a charming room very unlike at a chain motel where you eat crammed into some lobby. Would I return? Absolutely - just don't forget earplugs or a noise machine if you're staying anywhere in Inner Harbor and you'll have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravelNewYork
Reviews.Content: let me start by saying that the hotel is beautiful. Customer service is above and beyond. buffet breakfast is very nice. Area is quaint and historical. Everything is a fast free shuttle ride away or you can use the water taxi located across the street. Went there with family of 5 from April 19 - 22. When I go back next April I will stay there again. The kids ages 14 and 9 thought it was great even without a pool. Baltimore has so much to do that a pool is not necessary. At night they were so tired they just wanted to go to sleep. We spent alot of time at the inner harbor and none of those hotels impressed me. They lacked the character that this hotel had.There is so much to do I could have stayed a couple more days. Once you get to the inner harbor which is beautiful you can walk to everything. The rooms at hotel are georgous and very comfortable. They have internet hookups in room. The housekeeping staff is very impressive, The room was cleaned spotless everyday. If you needed extra towel or glasses or coffee and you left a little note on desk it was there when you returned. The hotel staff was always smileing, very polite,and if you had any questions about attractions or resturants they had the answers. We really felt that they had the best customer service we had ever seen. We read the reviews before we booked and were a little leary with some of the negative ones glad they didnt scare us off because this place is a real gem!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quanit but with LOUD noises”
Reviews.Author: JackStorm
Reviews.Content: The hotel was quaint and had a lot of character. The staff at the front desk was very friendly and outgoing. In fact, one desk clerk helped me the day before with setting up a gift for my wife when we entered the room. We just had a couple of problems that made the stay less than enjoyable. The sounds outside and inside the hotel kept us awake most of the night. There was a baby screaming in the next room (which sounded as if they were actually in our room... the walls are paper thin) and outside on the streets we heard everything as if the window was open. We were both miserable the next morning with our lack of sleep. The other issue was the privacy sign hanging outside our door was ignored at 10:00 AM in the morning from the cleaning crew. The last issue was the breakfast. The quality was very low. The bacon was undercooked. The eggs seemed like powdered eggs or some cheap substitute and the lack of service was horrible. I actually had to walk to the back to get silverware and drinks from someone.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: NM43
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Admiral Fell Inn and would not hesitate to stay there again in the future. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly, the location was convenient, and the net connection was good. The breakfast the first morning I was there was disappointing -- about what you would expect as a free breakfast in a low-end chain motel, not at all what you would expect if paying $10+ for it. But the next day it was excellent. I realized that second morning that the problem the previous day had been the fact that the breakfast area was being used for something else, meaning breakfast had to be served in a cramped area with very little space for much food. (I think the hotel would be wise to consider making breakfast free on a day like that first day.)

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: esegrs
Reviews.Content: The Admiral Fell Inn Was quite charming. The valet parking is worth the $25 /night charge . We were able to check in early and found our King bed room to be clean and comfortable. The room was small, but we were only there to shower and sleep. The bathroom needed updating but all in all it was a great place to stay. The concierge and front desk service was excellent. St Patrick's Day weekend is a blast in Fells point!

Reviews.Title: “Invalid Charges/Parking Woes”
Reviews.Author: x-alien
Reviews.Content: It starts off with the hotel not having a parking lot, so they offer a valet service for $25/day. The valet will take your car to a nearby parking garage, but won’t be too happy if you need your car often, because he will have to walk 4 blocks every time to get it. There are 3 or 4 spots in front of the hotel where you can wait for the valet, but if it’s busy and the spots are full, you are out of luck until the valet finishes his 4 block walk. Be aware, valet ends at 10pm, so if you’re out late, you have to find a spot all on your own; good luck, because there are 40 bars in the area which of course are open until 2am. Note, parking on meter spots around the area is free from 8pm-10am and the hotel does have a shuttle that can take you around Baltimore for free. The valet is also the bell hop, so if he’s on his walk, be ready to take your bags to your room yourself or wait for him. If you’re not paying for a fancy room, you won’t get one. You’ll get a small room that just fits all the furniture and doesn’t have enough space for all your things. And to add on, the walls are paper thin, so be prepared to hear loud guests and barking dogs, after all the hotel is pet friendly. The hotel has two wonderful employees, who refer to themselves as the ghosts of the hotel. These two are very entertaining and helped make the trip more enjoyable. The hotel has a bar downstairs that is open to public and stays quiet and relaxed, if that is what you’re looking for. The breakfast buffet is decent, especially if you booked the business reservation which comes with breakfast coupons, otherwise its $25 for two. If you’re heading out to the Aquarium, you can purchase the tickets through the hotel and receive VIP entry to the Aquarium (no wait). On your way out the door you are handed a bill with breakfast charges that were supposed to be free and valet parking charges for days you didn’t use valet. Luckily the front desk person was very professional and removed the charges without much question. I hope this helps! Enjoy your stay at the Admiral Fell Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Pleasure, not for business travel”
Reviews.Author: redelaneymd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Admiral Fell while in Baltimore on business. This is a very unique, quaint inn located at Fell's Point in Baltimore. It is very nicely appointed with period furnishings. It is certainly clean and well maintained. Every afternoon, there is tea in the lobby with characters sharing stories from the inn's history. Unfortunately, when in town on business, you never get the chance to enjoy this. By the time I arrived back at the inn after 5:30, most of the surrounding shops had closed, though I did still manage to find some excellent crabcakes nearby, and there was a Maggie Moo's right across the street for dessert! Parking is available by valet, or you can park about a block away in a public garage, which I chose. My only complaints are the following. First, there is no on-site excercise facility, which I desire, especially when traveling alone. They did shuttle me to one of their sister hotels, where there was a small workout room with some cardio equipment. After exercising, I had to wait 30 min for the shuttle back to the Admiral Fell, and had to ride on this shuttle with other people who probably didn't appreciate my post-workout state. Second, I was charged for valet parking even though I didn't use it. This matter was corrected, but only on my insistence that I didn't use the service. Third, there is a "convenience" charge of $10 per day which includes their wireless internet, phone, and bottled waters. I raised a little stink about this since I didn't have a computer with me, I used by cell phone exclusively, and I even brought my own cooler of drinks. They did remove the charge, but reluctantly. I think it is silly to have that as an extra charge, they would be smarter to just raise their rate 10 bucks, then none of us would know the difference. In summary, this is a very nice place to stay, but it is much better suited to a weekend getaway with your sweetie than for business travel. I would love to go sometime with my wife and enjoy the ghost tour, and afternoon tea, and get to shop in the area some. But for business, I'll take a chain hotel with free wireless and excercise facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Most helpful hotel”
Reviews.Author: pennyptc
Reviews.Content: After reading the great reviews by other trip advisor members we contacted the Admiral Fell Inn in Baltimore when our aunt underwent heart surgery at nearby Johns Hopkins Hospital. The hotel gave us a special "Hopkins" rate - lower than the published price on their website. The hotel (part of a group of three hotels in Baltimore) provides a shuttle service which took us directly to John Hopkins whenever we wanted to visit. We could have also used the shuttle to visit the other properties and their restaurants. The rooms at the Inn were each unique, comfortable and inviting. Closets are extremely small but for short stay - just fine. Everyone at the hotel from the desk (especially Diana) to the bellman to the cleaning staff was always friendly and most helpful. A Breakfast Buffet is available but not included ($12), however, when we asked about a place nearby with pastries/coffee Diana became excited and wanted us to try her favorite place - only a block and a half away. "Napolean's" was all she said and more. Great French pastry. Fell's Point is a great location for shops and restaurants. Very walkable from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ria6677
Reviews.Content: The Admiral Fell is chock-full of history and they have a ghost walk around the building and a ghost "sing along" in the lobby. I like that they have tea five nights a week. Breakfast is your standard hotel buffet. Plenty of choices buy nothing terribly innovative (juice, coffee, eggs, cheese, yogurt, fruit, oatmeal, bacon, sausage, muffins, breads...) Rooms are very spacious and clean (don't know why others called them dark and dingy - I didn't see that). Beds huge and comfortable. Bathroom nice and clean. Peeked into neighboring room and saw loft with jacuzzi. Building is actually several buildings connected together. We were in one of the oldest parts. One thing I didn't like - the $10 destination fee tacked onto the bill that paid for breakfast, local shuttle, two 20 once bottles of water (worth $2) and newspapers. Why not just roll it into price of hotel? We did use the shuttle, though, which took us to a hotel near the aquarium (really nice in the frigid January weather). The location is AWESOME. The Fell's Point area is full of great restaurants and tons of bars. If outside noise bothers you, you may want to choose a different place - or ask for an interior room. The hotel itself is quiet and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: bamt08
Reviews.Content: The staff was very courteous and professional. My room was very clean and nicely appointed. The hotel is located on one of the main streets in Fell's Point an historic section of Baltimore. The hotel fits with that historic feel. I would gladly stay in this hotel again. You can avoid the cost of the valet parking by using a public garage about 2 blocks away. If you use the public garage, make note of when the garage opens in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Inn and Fell's Point!”
Reviews.Author: tbjustice
Reviews.Content: I must admit, I was worried after reading the reviews on here. But, I have come to realize that some people are just entirely too picky and that everyone's experience will differ. I am so glad I heeded the good reviews and ignored the bad because Admiral Fell Inn is spectacular. This hotel is not a luxury hotel, and it is not meant to me. It's a charming, boutique hotel with everythin you would need. Our room was very cozy with beautiful four-poster beds, and a great view of the cobblestone street. We did not have any trouble with noise, and the staff could not have been more accomodating and friendly. They even offered us an upgraded room! Our room was impeccably clean, and the bed was one of the more comfortable we've had in a hotel And we're picky! The location cannot be beat-right across from the Water Taxi, close to all the great shops and pubs. We loved Fell's Point! The breakfast, which was included with our room rate, was fantastic. A huge spread and a variety of items to please all palates. We were so happy we stayed here and will definitely stay here anytime we come back to the area! Ignore the naysayers on this review and stay at the Admiral Fell Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Historical not Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: MAN615
Reviews.Content: First thing you must realize is this is not a LUXURY hotel. It is a historical, old, well maintained boutique hotel. I will begin by saying I had no negative issues with this hotel because it was what I expected, and because I got an amazing price from Hotwire on it. The website prices were extremely high which is what the area commands, but for the same prices you can do much better in the area. Parking is 25 bucks for valet, or you can park on the street right outside for free from 9pm to 10 am the next day, and 1 buck hourly before that. Lobby nice, room had dated look to it, but all functional and for its age, was what I expected(pix atached.) If paying full price, its a no brainer to go to Hendersons wharf which is right down the street. If getting a bargain price, there are no issues to worry about, and you will enjoy its unique charm and excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: shopgirlChicago
Reviews.Content: Find another place to stay. I had a reservation at this hotel but ended up going to another hotel once I checked into the room. I requested a non-smoking room only to be placed in a heavely smoked in room that was dark, dingy, and dirty. When I went back to the front desk to request another room, I was told that there was nothing they could do for me. The front desk staff was disorganized and not very helpful. A colleague that stayed in the hotel reported used sunflower seeds scattered across the floor, which indicated that a vacuum hadn't been run. If there is visable dirt, I'm sure there is a lot more that you don't see. I do a lot of traveling for work and have never left a hotel upon check in. I will not be staying at this hotel again and encourage others to look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Would be better if the ghosts ran it.”
Reviews.Author: cooljazz69
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights to be near the Hopkins campus. Imagine that Marriott Courtyard designed and ran a place with the patina of an ersatz Colonial Inn and you have the Admiral Fell. The intro went poorly as the front desk (1 person) was overwhelmed with a lost reservation. This created a line of people for 30 minutes waiting to check in. No other person came to help. The room is ok but nothing special. I got the jacuzzi room which turned out to be a big bathtub with some spray nozzles... I called to ask about a work out room and was told "we're a simple hotel. We have no work out room, only a bar and restaurant." But like the rest of this "quaint" area of Baltimore, they sure invest in ghost tales and associated nonsense. As I was standing in line, I got to hear the boring ghost history of the hotel as recounted by some guy in goth makeup and striped pants and colonial-era shirt. Those listening seemed bored as they looked around the room during the lecture...The punchline of one joke was "the Admiral fell in...." Get it? If you like dank English pubs, and mediocre sea food (go to Bertha's mussels) stay in the Admiral Fell. Want variety or pizazz or a health club....look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Poor Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Tillie21617
Reviews.Content: The Admiral Fell Inn has a wonderful location and the decor is very charming. However, it begins to lose some of the charm due to poor housekeeping. I have stayed at this hotel twice this month and both times the room has not be thoroughly cleaned. Both times there was hair on the bathroom walls and in the shower. Candy wrappers are on the floor providing proof that the room had not been vacumed properly, if at all. On the first visit used linens were left in the room. It's a nice place to stay for convenience to local entertainment and restaurants they just need to get a better housekeeping staff.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this place”
Reviews.Author: PickyTravelNy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not very comfortable. Both the bathroom and the bedroom don't feel comfortable. The room was quite dark and dingy. There was noise from bar across the street till late night. They charge $10 "Destination Fee" for a newspaper and few other services that most hotels provide for free. The fact that they chose a vague term like "Destination Fee" for additional services means that they want to scam their customers. If you have a baby or are handicapped, this place is especially bad for you. Once you get to your floor in the elevator, you might have to go up and down additional stairs to get to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Find another place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: LewesBeach
Reviews.Content: Extremely overrated for the high price. Desk /staff service was just OK. Big clump of hair to greet us on the shower wall. Annoying "Destination Fee" tacked on for services I had no use for except maybe the newspaper - but that was not delivered to the room as advertised anyway. parking is a big pain. Stay somewhere else and take the taxi. Fells Point is definately worth the destination, just not worth the overnight stay. There needs to be more hotel competition in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: eksl029
Reviews.Content: My husband and I always stay at the Admiral Fell Inn every time we go to Baltimore. We always have a great time and no complaints about the hotel. Everyone is always nice and the room is always clean. We stayed on St. Patty's day weekend. The weather was horrible the whole time but at least we still had a great time, except for getting our car locked in the PMI parking garage because they are closed on Sundays and they don't tell you that before you park there and then when you go to leave on Sunday you find out that your really not leaving until Monday after 6 am! But luckily someone had a monthly pass to the parking garage and let us in and out and we didn't have to pay for parking, Saved us alot of money. But anyway, we had a great time and always do every year and we will definitely be back next year!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but bad experience....”
Reviews.Author: kaf9379
Reviews.Content: My cousin, her husband, my husband and myself stayed at Admiral Fell Inn on the weekend of 3/16, St. Patty's Day weekend. We booked the Ultimate Harbor Experience for $210 for the entire weekend. The package included 2 nights at the Admiral Fell, 2 tickets each to the Aquarium, Science Museum and the Top of the World, 2 game cards with 40 points each to ESPN Zone and 2 water taxi tickets for free use all day. The deal was very, very good. The hotel was nice and I really liked the area-cobblestone streets, pubs, eateries, stores, etc. And the water taxi is right there, even though it was closed all weekend due to the weather. It only cost us under $7.00 for a taxi ride to the Inner Harbor. The restaurant true was very nice and breakfast was very good with a big selection. The downside: We left housekeeping $5 the first day, expecting a clean room when we got back. All she did was put the comforter back on the bed and replace the hand soaps. I could've done that for free! She didn't even vacuum (we were next door at my cousin's room and she was in there for like 10 minutes). There were also dirty glasses still in the room and the coffee pot had coffee in it from the previous guests. We were also facing the main street so you could hear everything at night-cars going by, people shouting, etc. It didn't bother me-I still fell asleep right away but I know my cousin's husband was up for hours because of the partying. The biggest advice I can give anyone on this trip that will save you from a living nightmare: DO NOT PARK IN THE PMI PARKING GARAGE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! We arrived Friday night with plans of leaving on Sunday. We all went and ate breakfast and then my cousin and I took the luggage to checkout while our husbands went to get the car (down the street). My husband calls me on my cell phone and tells me that, in small print, on the outside of the building there are hours for Mon-Sat and then it says your car will remain in the garage until the next business day. Meaning, if you planned on leaving on Sunday forget it! The doors were locked and there were metal roll down gates and every entrance/exit so there was NO way to get your car out unless you had a monthly pass. This was not amusing and they had not posted hours anywhere inside the building. Only on the outside at the exit so that the only way you'd see them is if you turned around as you were leaving the garage. We called the number and the guy basically said oh well, we'd have to wait until 6am Monday morning. We all had work and my cousin had two small kids who were being watched by her mother, who could not call out of work the next day. We even had a police officer call and they told her the same story. We went back to the garage and found someone with a monthly pass, who was able to lift the roll down gate and let us out. We offered him money but he refused. He said every weekend he's letting people out because they do not know they are closed on Sunday. We got very lucky. My cousin has parked in that garage several times and it was always open. It's a parking garage! You don't expect that it'll be closed. Pay the $25.00/day to valet park! There was only one bellboy and people were very agitated that he was taking a long time to get their car. I told them to be thankful they were able to have their car, that mine was locked in a garage until Monday! The hotel was of no help AT ALL in getting our car. They didn't even offer to assist. They said they tell people not to park there...well no one told us! The hotel was quaint and if you like that sort of thing, stay there. If not, stay at a more updated hotel in the Inner Harbor-preferrably one with a parking garage that's open on Sundays!

Reviews.Title: “I liked it very much”
Reviews.Author: seafoodben
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried at first reading the reviews here, but I just got back from Baltimore and had a great time. The hotel is ideally located, very unique, had very friendly staff, and free cookies which are amazing! Our room was very spacious, clean, TV had many channels, and overall, very pleased. There was an ice storm the night we stayed, and we unfortunately forgot to bring toothpaste, instead of going out in the weather, we asked the front desk and they were happy to give us some for free! The one thing was you could hear things outside in the halls and next door pretty easily. This wasn't a problem at night since there were no one in the hall ways. But come morning, I could here next door and from the halls ways pretty loudly. Other than that... great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here before, but things have changed...”
Reviews.Author: RCD19027
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here several times in the past and have enjoyed quait atmoshphere of this inn. However, the inn has recently added a banquet facility to the top floor of the building. Unfortunately, our room was situated one floor beneath the banquet facility and a very loud wedding reception kept us awake until 1:00 am. My husband finally called the front desk to inquire when we could expect quiet. After some pressuring, the desk clerk agreed to move us to another room on another floor. That was no better because drunken wedding guests were fighting, yelling and slamming doors all night in the hallway. In the morning, we were just miserable from sleep deprivation and expressed our dissatisfaction to the desk clerk again. The response we received was "well, no one else has complained." Will NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: SeekingPerfection
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 2 nights while visiting Johns Hopkins. Room very large and beautiful - I had 2 canopied beds. Room appeared very clean - until I stepped on glass in carpet. Found 3 different colors of shards! Very quiet. Hotel is a string of old buildings so no hallway more than 3 rooms long before hall turned or went up or down a few stairs. This dramatically cut down on hall noise. Concierge service very poor. Was told I couldn't eat in downstairs restaurant or get room service because it was "Restaurant Week". I asked her to help me find a place to eat dinner and she waved toward front door and told me to "Go out there!". Area has lots of pubs etc - not what I was looking for after a difficult day during a long trip alone. Went downstairs to restaurant anyway and they happily served me - said they always reserve tables for hotel guests. Restaurant was excellent. Morning breakfast was simply outstanding. Would stay there again but would wear slippers and not use their concierge.

HotelInfo.Name: Admiral Fell Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 888 South Broadway, Historic Fell's Point, Baltimore, MD 21231
